functions.name: GetOwner
functions.description:
Returns the owner entity of this entity. See <page>Entity:SetOwner</page> for more info.

<note>This function is generally used to disable physics interactions on projectiles being fired by their owner, but can also be used for normal ownership in case physics interactions are not involved at all. The Gravity gun will be able to pick up the entity even if the owner can't collide with it, the Physics gun however will not.</note>

returnValues.description: The owner entity of this entity.

functions.name: GetParent
functions.description: Returns the parent entity of this entity.

returnValues.description: parentEntity

functions.name: GetParentAttachment
functions.description:
Returns the attachment/bone index of the entity's parent. Returns 0 if the entity is not parented to an attachment/bone or if it isn't parented at all.

This is set by second argument of <page>Entity:SetParent</page> or the **SetParentAttachment** input.

returnValues.description:
The parented attachment/bone index
<note>Will return bone index instead of attachment index if the **EF_FOLLOWBONE** effect is active on the entity. See <page>Entity:IsEffectActive</page>.</note>

functions.name: GetParentPhysNum
functions.description: If the entity is parented to an entity that has a model with multiple physics objects (like a ragdoll), this is used to retrieve what physics object number the entity is parented to on it's parent.

returnValues.description: The physics object id, or nil if the entity has no parent

functions.name: GetParentWorldTransformMatrix
functions.description: Returns the position and angle of the entity's move parent as a 3x4 matrix (<page>VMatrix</page> is 4x4 so the fourth row goes unused). The first three columns store the angle as a [rotation matrix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rotation_matrix), and the fourth column stores the position vector.

returnValues.description:
The position and angle matrix.

If the entity has no move parent, an identity matrix will be returned.
If the entity is <page text="parented to attachment">Entity:GetParentAttachment</page> 0 or the parent isn't a BaseAnimating entity, the equivalent of <page>Entity</page>:<page text="GetMoveParent()">Entity:GetMoveParent</page>:<page text="GetWorldTransformMatrix()">Entity:GetWorldTransformMatrix</page> will be returned.

functions.name: GetPersistent
functions.description:
Returns whether the entity is persistent or not.

See <page>Entity:SetPersistent</page> for more information on persistence.

returnValues.description: True if the entity is set to be persistent.

functions.name: GetPhysicsAttacker
functions.description: Returns player who is claiming kills of physics damage the entity deals.

arguments.name: timeLimit
arguments.description:
The time to check if the entity was still a proper physics attacker.

<note>Some entities such as the Combine Ball disregard the time limit and always return the physics attacker.</note>

returnValues.description: The player. If entity that was set is not a player, it will return NULL entity.

functions.name: GetPhysicsObject
functions.description:
Returns the entity's physics object, if the entity has physics.

<note>Entities don't have clientside physics objects by default, so this will return `[NULL PHYSOBJ]` on the client in most cases.</note>

returnValues.description: The entity's physics object.

functions.name: GetPhysicsObjectCount
functions.description: Returns the number of physics objects an entity has (usually 1 for non-ragdolls)

returnValues.description: numObjects

functions.name: GetPhysicsObjectNum
functions.description:
Returns a specific physics object from an entity with multiple <page>PhysObj</page>ects (like ragdolls)

See also <page>Entity:TranslateBoneToPhysBone</page>.

arguments.name: physNum
arguments.description: The number corresponding to the <page>PhysObj</page> to grab. Starts at 0.

returnValues.description: The physics object

functions.description: Returns the playback rate of the main sequence on this entity, with 1.0 being the default speed.

returnValues.description: The playback rate.

functions.description:
Gets the position of given entity in the world.

See <page>Entity:GetLocalPos</page> for the position relative to the entity's <page>Entity:GetParent</page>.

returnValues.description: The position of the entity.

<warning>This value will be from 0 - 1 on the client and from minimum range to maximum range on the server! You'll have to <page text="remap">math.Remap</page> this value clientside to <page>Entity:GetPoseParameterRange</page>'s returns if you want get the actual pose parameter value. See <page>Entity:SetPoseParameter</page>'s example.</warning>

returnValues.description: Name of given pose parameter

functions.name: GetPoseParameterRange
functions.description: Returns pose parameter range

returnValues.description: The minimum value
The maximum value

See <page>Entity:SetPredictable</page> for more information

arguments.description: Maximum extent of an OBB in local coordinates.

returnValues.description: Minimum extent of the AABB relative to entity's position.
Maximum extent of the AABB relative to entity's position.

functions.name: GetSaveTable
functions.description:
Returns a table of save values for an entity.

These tables are not the same between the client and the server, and different entities may have different fields.

<note>It is highly recommended to use <page>Entity:GetInternalVariable</page> for retrieving a single key of the save table for performance reasons.</note>

You can get the list different fields an entity has by looking at it's source code (the 2013 SDK can be found [online](https://github.com/ValveSoftware/source-sdk-2013)). Accessible fields are defined by each `DEFINE_FIELD` and `DEFINE_KEYFIELD` inside the `DATADESC` block.

Take the headcrab, for example:

```
BEGIN_DATADESC( CBaseHeadcrab )
// m_nGibCount - don't save
DEFINE_FIELD( m_bHidden, FIELD_BOOLEAN ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_flTimeDrown, FIELD_TIME ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_bCommittedToJump, FIELD_BOOLEAN ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_vecCommittedJumpPos, FIELD_POSITION_VECTOR ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_flNextNPCThink, FIELD_TIME ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_flIgnoreWorldCollisionTime, FIELD_TIME ),

DEFINE_KEYFIELD( m_bStartBurrowed, FIELD_BOOLEAN, "startburrowed" ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_bBurrowed, FIELD_BOOLEAN ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_flBurrowTime, FIELD_TIME ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_nContext, FIELD_INTEGER ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_bCrawlFromCanister, FIELD_BOOLEAN ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_bMidJump, FIELD_BOOLEAN ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_nJumpFromCanisterDir, FIELD_INTEGER ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_bHangingFromCeiling, FIELD_BOOLEAN ),
DEFINE_FIELD( m_flIlluminatedTime, FIELD_TIME ),

DEFINE_INPUTFUNC( FIELD_VOID, "Burrow", InputBurrow ),
DEFINE_INPUTFUNC( FIELD_VOID, "BurrowImmediate", InputBurrowImmediate ),
DEFINE_INPUTFUNC( FIELD_VOID, "Unburrow", InputUnburrow ),
DEFINE_INPUTFUNC( FIELD_VOID, "StartHangingFromCeiling", InputStartHangingFromCeiling ),
DEFINE_INPUTFUNC( FIELD_VOID, "DropFromCeiling", InputDropFromCeiling ),

// Function Pointers
DEFINE_THINKFUNC( EliminateRollAndPitch ),
DEFINE_THINKFUNC( ThrowThink ),
DEFINE_ENTITYFUNC( LeapTouch ),
END_DATADESC()
```

* For each **DEFINE_FIELD**, the save table will have a key with name of **first** argument.
* For each **DEFINE_KEYFIELD**, the save table will have a key with name of the **third** argument.

arguments.name: showAll
arguments.description: If set, shows all variables, not just the ones marked for save/load system.

returnValues.description:
A table containing all save values in key/value format.

The value may be a sequential table (starting with **1**) if the field in question is an array in engine.

arguments.name: sequenceId

returnValues.description: Table of information about the entity's sequence, or `nil` is ID is out of range. See <page>Structures/SequenceInfo</page>.

functions.name: GetSequenceList
functions.description: Returns a list of all sequences ( animations ) the model has.

returnValues.description: The list of all sequences ( animations ) the model has. The indices start with 0!

functions.name: GetSequenceMoveDist
functions.description:
Returns an entity's sequence move distance (the change in position over the course of the entire sequence).

See <page>Entity:GetSequenceMovement</page> for a similar function with more options.

arguments.name: sequenceId
arguments.description: The sequence index.

returnValues.description: The move distance of the sequence.

functions.name: GetSequenceMovement
functions.description: Returns the delta movement and angles of a sequence of the entity's model.

arguments.name: sequenceId
arguments.description: The sequence index. See <page>Entity:LookupSequence</page>.

arguments.name: startCycle
arguments.description: The sequence start cycle. 0 is the start of the animation, 1 is the end.

arguments.name: endCyclnde
arguments.description: The sequence end cycle. 0 is the start of the animation, 1 is the end. Values like 2, etc are allowed.

returnValues.description: Whether the operation was successful
The delta vector of the animation, how much the model's origin point moved.
The delta angle of the animation.

functions.name: GetSequenceMoveYaw
functions.description: Returns the change in heading direction in between the start and the end of the sequence.

arguments.name: seq
arguments.description: The sequence index. See <page>Entity:LookupSequence</page>.

returnValues.description: The yaw delta. Returns 99999 for no movement.

functions.name: GetSequenceName
functions.description:
Return the name of the sequence for the index provided.
Refer to <page>Entity:GetSequence</page> to find the current active sequence on this entity.

See <page>Entity:LookupSequence</page> for a function that does the opposite.

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: The index of the sequence to look up.

returnValues.description: Name of the sequence.

functions.name: GetSequenceVelocity
functions.description: Returns an entity's sequence velocity at given animation frame.

arguments.name: sequenceId
arguments.description: The sequence index.

arguments.name: cycle
arguments.description: The point in animation, from `0` to `1`.

returnValues.description: Velocity of the sequence at given point in the animation.

functions.name: GetShouldPlayPickupSound
functions.description: Checks if the entity plays a sound when picked up by a player.

returnValues.description: `true` if it plays the pickup sound, `false` otherwise.

functions.name: GetShouldServerRagdoll
functions.description: Returns if entity should create a server ragdoll on death or a client one.

returnValues.description: Returns true if ragdoll will be created on server, false if on client

functions.name: GetSkin
functions.description: Returns the skin index of the current skin.

returnValues.description: skinIndex

functions.name: GetSolid
functions.description: Returns solid type of an entity.

returnValues.description: The solid type. See the <page>Enums/SOLID</page>.

functions.name: GetSolidFlags
functions.description: Returns solid flag(s) of an entity.

returnValues.description: The flag(s) of the entity, see <page>Enums/FSOLID</page>.

functions.name: GetSpawnEffect
functions.description: Returns if we should show a spawn effect on spawn on this entity.

returnValues.description: The flag to allow or disallow the spawn effect.

functions.name: GetSpawnFlags
functions.description: Returns the bitwise spawn flags used by the entity. These can be set by <page>Entity:SetKeyValue</page>.

returnValues.description: The spawn flags of the entity, see <page text="SF_Enums">Enums/SF</page>.

functions.name: GetSubMaterial
functions.description:
Returns the material override for the given index.

Returns "" if no material override exists. Use <page>Entity:GetMaterials</page> to list it's default materials.

<bug issue="3362">The server's value takes priority on the client.</bug>

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: The index of the sub material. Acceptable values are from 0 to 31.

returnValues.description: The material that overrides this index, if any.

functions.name: GetSubModels
functions.description: Returns a list of models included into the entity's model in the .qc file.

returnValues.description: The list of models included into the entity's model in the .qc file.

functions.name: GetSurroundingBounds
functions.description: Returns two vectors representing the minimum and maximum extent of the entity's axis-aligned bounding box for hitbox detection. In most cases, this will return the same bounding box as <page>Entity:WorldSpaceAABB</page> unless it was changed by <page>Entity:SetSurroundingBounds</page> or <page>Entity:SetSurroundingBoundsType</page>.

returnValues.description: The minimum vector for the entity's bounding box in world space.
The maximum vector for the entity's bounding box in world space.

functions.name: GetTable
functions.description:
Returns a <page>table</page> that contains all lua-based key-value pairs saved on the <page>Entity</page>.

For retrieving engine-based key-value pairs, see <page>Entity:GetSaveTable</page>

returnValues.description: A table of the lua data stored on the Entity, or `nil` if the Entity is NULL.

functions.name: GetTouchTrace
functions.description:
Returns the last trace used in the collision callbacks such as <page>ENTITY:StartTouch</page>, <page>ENTITY:Touch</page> and <page>ENTITY:EndTouch</page>.

<note>This returns the last collision trace used, regardless of the entity that caused it. As such, it's only reliable when used in the hooks mentioned above</note>

returnValues.description: The <page>Structures/TraceResult</page>

functions.name: GetTransmitWithParent
functions.description: Returns true if the TransmitWithParent flag is set or not.

returnValues.description: Is the TransmitWithParent flag is set or not

functions.name: GetUnFreezable
functions.description: Returns if the entity is unfreezable, meaning it can't be frozen with the physgun. By default props are freezable, so this function will typically return false.

returnValues.description: True if the entity is unfreezable, false otherwise.

functions.name: GetUp
functions.description: Returns the upward vector of the entity, as a normalized direction vector

returnValues.description: upDir

functions.name: GetVar
functions.description: Retrieves a value from entity's <page>Entity:GetTable</page>. Set by <page>Entity:SetVar</page>.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: Key of the value to retrieve

arguments.name: default
arguments.description: A default value to fallback to if we couldn't retrieve the value from entity

returnValues.description: Retrieved value

functions.name: GetVelocity
functions.description:
Returns the entity's velocity.

<note>Actually binds to `CBaseEntity::GetAbsVelocity()` on the server and `C_BaseEntity::EstimateAbsVelocity()` on the client. This returns the total velocity of the entity and is equal to local velocity + base velocity.</note>

<bug issue="774">This can become out-of-sync on the client if the server has been up for a long time.</bug>

returnValues.description: The velocity of the entity.

functions.name: GetWorkshopID
functions.description:
<deprecated>The function **currently** does nothing and always returns nil</deprecated>

Returns ID of workshop addon that the entity is from.

returnValues.description: The workshop ID

functions.name: GetWorldTransformMatrix
functions.description:
Returns the position and angle of the entity as a 3x4 matrix (<page>VMatrix</page> is 4x4 so the fourth row goes unused). The first three columns store the angle as a [rotation matrix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rotation_matrix), and the fourth column stores the position vector.

<bug issue="2764">This returns incorrect results for the angular component (columns 1-3) for the local player clientside.</bug>

<bug issue="3106">This will use the local player's <page>Global.EyeAngles</page> in <page text="rendering hooks">3D_Rendering_Hooks</page>.</bug>

<bug issue="3107">Columns 1-3 will be all 0 (angular component) in <page text="rendering hooks">3D_Rendering_Hooks</page> while paused in single-player.</bug>

returnValues.description: The position and angle matrix.

functions.name: GibBreakClient
functions.description:
Causes the entity to break into its current models gibs, if it has any.

You must call <page>Entity:PrecacheGibs</page> on the entity before using this function, or it will not create any gibs.

If called on server, the gibs will be spawned on the currently connected clients and will not be synchronized. Otherwise the gibs will be spawned only for the client the function is called on.

<note>
this function will not remove or hide the entity it is called on.
For more expensive version of this function see <page>Entity:GibBreakServer</page>.
</note>

arguments.name: force
arguments.description: The force to apply to the created gibs.

arguments.name: clr
arguments.description: If set, this will be color of the broken gibs instead of the entity's color.

functions.name: GibBreakServer
functions.description:
Causes the entity to break into its current models gibs, if it has any.

You must call <page>Entity:PrecacheGibs</page> on the entity before using this function, or it will not create any gibs.

The gibs will be spawned on the server and be synchronized with all clients.

Note, that this function will not remove or hide the entity it is called on.

This function is affected by `props_break_max_pieces_perframe` and `props_break_max_pieces` console variables.

<warning>Large numbers of serverside gibs will cause lag.

You can avoid this cost by spawning the gibs on the client using <page>Entity:GibBreakClient</page></warning>

<note>Despite existing on client, it doesn't actually do anything on client.</note>

arguments.name: force
arguments.description: The force to apply to the created gibs

functions.name: HasBoneManipulations
functions.description:
Returns whether or not the bone manipulation functions have ever been called on given  entity.

Related functions are <page>Entity:ManipulateBonePosition</page>, <page>Entity:ManipulateBoneAngles</page>, <page>Entity:ManipulateBoneJiggle</page>, and <page>Entity:ManipulateBoneScale</page>.

<bug issue="3131">This will return true if the entity's bones have ever been manipulated. Resetting the position/angles/jiggle/scaling to 0,0,0 will not affect this function.</bug>

returnValues.description: True if the entity has been bone manipulated, false otherwise.

functions.name: HasFlexManipulatior
functions.description: Returns whether or not the the entity has had flex manipulations performed with <page>Entity:SetFlexWeight</page> or <page>Entity:SetFlexScale</page>.

returnValues.description: True if the entity has flex manipulations, false otherwise.

functions.name: HasSpawnFlags
functions.description: Returns whether this entity has the specified spawnflags bits set.

arguments.name: spawnFlags
arguments.description: The spawnflag bits to check, see <page>Enums/SF</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether the entity has that spawnflag set or not.

functions.name: HeadTarget
functions.description:
Returns the position of the head of this entity, NPCs use this internally to aim at their targets.

<note>This only works on players and NPCs.</note>

arguments.name: origin
arguments.description: The vector of where the attack comes from.

returnValues.description: The head position.

functions.name: Health
functions.description: Returns the health of the entity.

returnValues.description: health

functions.name: Ignite
functions.description:
Sets the entity on fire.

See also <page>Entity:Extinguish</page>.

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: How long to keep the entity ignited, in seconds.

arguments.name: radius
arguments.description: The radius of the ignition, will ignite everything around the entity that is in this radius.

functions.name: InitializeAsClientEntity
functions.description:
<deprecated>
This function got disabled and will always throw an error if it's used. This is the error:
```
[ERROR] InitializeAsClientEntity is deprecated and should no longer be used.
```
</deprecated>

Initializes this entity as being clientside only.

Only works on entities fully created clientside, and as such it currently has no use due to this being automatically called by <page>ents.CreateClientProp</page>, <page>ents.CreateClientside</page>, <page>Global.ClientsideModel</page> and <page>Global.ClientsideScene</page>.

functions.name: Input
functions.description:
Fires input to the entity with the ability to make another entity responsible, bypassing the event queue system.

You should only use this function over <page>Entity:Fire</page> if you know what you are doing.

See also <page>Entity:Fire</page> for a function that conforms to the internal map IO event queue and <page>GM:AcceptInput</page> for a hook that can intercept inputs.

arguments.name: input
arguments.description: The name of the input to fire

arguments.name: activator
arguments.description: The entity that caused this input (i.e. the player who pushed a button)

arguments.name: caller
arguments.description: The entity that is triggering this input (i.e. the button that was pushed)

arguments.name: param
arguments.description: The value to give to the input. Can be either a <page>string</page>, a <page>number</page> or a <page>boolean</page>.

functions.name: InstallDataTable
functions.description: <internal></internal> Sets up Data Tables from entity to use with <page>Entity:NetworkVar</page>.

functions.name: InvalidateBoneCache
functions.description:
Resets the entity's bone cache values in order to prepare for a model change.

This should be called after calling <page>Entity:SetPoseParameter</page>.

functions.name: IsConstrained
functions.description:
Returns true if the entity has constraints attached to it

<bug issue="3837">This will only update clientside if the server calls it first. This only checks constraints added through the <page>constraint</page> so this will not react to map constraints.

For a serverside alternative, see <page>constraint.HasConstraints</page></bug>

returnValues.description: Whether the entity is constrained or not.

functions.name: IsConstraint
functions.description:
Returns if entity is constraint or not.

This also means that <page>Entity:GetConstrainedPhysObjects</page>. <page>Entity:GetConstrainedEntities</page> and  <page>Entity:SetPhysConstraintObjects</page> can be used on this entity.

<warning>Some constraint entities, such as `phys_spring`, will return false!</warning>

returnValues.description: Is the entity a constraint or not

functions.name: IsDormant
functions.description:
Returns whether the entity is dormant or not.

Client/server entities become dormant when they leave the PVS on the server. Client side entities can decide for themselves whether to become dormant.
This mainly applies to [PVS (Potential Visibility Set)](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/PVS "PVS - Valve Developer Community").

returnValues.description: Whether the entity is dormant or not.

functions.name: IsEffectActive
functions.description: Returns whether an entity has engine effect applied or not.

arguments.name: effect
arguments.description: The effect to check for, see <page>Enums/EF</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether the entity has the engine effect applied or not.

functions.name: IsEFlagSet
functions.description: Checks if given flag is set or not.

arguments.name: flag
arguments.description: The engine flag to test, see <page>Enums/EFL</page>

returnValues.description: Is set or not

functions.name: IsFlagSet
functions.description: Checks if given flag(s) is set or not.

arguments.name: flag
arguments.description: The engine flag(s) to test, see <page>Enums/FL</page>

returnValues.description: Is set or not

functions.name: IsInWorld
functions.description:
Returns whether the entity is in the world (not inside a wall or outside of the map).

<note>Internally this function uses <page>util.IsInWorld</page>, that means that this function only checks <page>Entity:GetPos</page> of the entity. If an entity is only partially inside a wall, or has a weird GetPos offset, this function may not give reliable output.</note>

returnValues.description: False if the entity is inside a wall or outside of the map, true otherwise.

functions.name: IsLagCompensated
functions.description: Returns whether the entity is lag compensated or not.

returnValues.description: Whether the entity is lag compensated or not.

functions.name: IsLineOfSightClear
functions.description:
Returns true if the target is in line of sight.
<note>This will only work when called on CBaseCombatCharacter entities. This includes players, NPCs, grenades, RPG rockets, crossbow bolts, and physics cannisters.</note>

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: The target to test. You can also supply an <page>Entity</page> instead of a <page>Vector</page>

returnValues.description: Returns true if the line of sight is clear

functions.name: IsMarkedForDeletion
functions.description: Returns if the entity is going to be deleted in the next frame. Entities marked for deletion should not be accessed.

returnValues.description: If the entity is going to be deleted.

functions.name: IsNextBot
functions.description: Checks if the entity is a <page>NextBot</page> or not.

returnValues.description: Whether the entity is an NextBot entity or not.

functions.name: IsNPC
functions.description:
Checks if the entity is an NPC or not.

This will return false for <page>NextBot</page>s, see <page>Entity:IsNextBot</page> for that.

returnValues.description: Whether the entity is an NPC.

functions.name: IsOnFire
functions.description: Returns whether the entity is on fire.

returnValues.description: Whether the entity is on fire or not.

functions.name: IsOnGround
functions.description:
Returns whether the entity is on ground or not.

Internally, this checks if <page text="FL_ONGROUND">Enums/FL</page> is set on the entity.

This function is an alias of <page>Entity:OnGround</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether the entity is on ground or not.

functions.name: IsPlayer
functions.description: Checks if the entity is a player or not.

returnValues.description: Whether the entity is a player.

functions.name: IsPlayerHolding
functions.description:
Returns true if the entity is being held by a player. Either by physics gun, gravity gun or use-key (+use).

<bug issue="2046">If multiple players are holding an object and one drops it, this will return false despite the object still being held.</bug>

returnValues.description: IsBeingHeld

functions.name: IsPlayingGesture
functions.description:
Returns whether there's a gesture with the given activity being played.

<note>This function only works on <page>BaseAnimatingOverlay</page> entites!</note>

arguments.name: activity
arguments.description: The activity to test. See <page>Enums/ACT</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether there's a gesture is given activity being played.

functions.name: IsPointInBounds
functions.description:
Returns whether a given point is within the entity's Orientated Bounding Box.

This relies on the entity having a collision mesh (not a physics object) and will be affected by `SOLID_NONE`.

arguments.name: point
arguments.description: The point to test, in world space coordinates.

returnValues.description: Whether the point is within the entity's bounds.

functions.name: IsRagdoll
functions.description: Checks if the entity is a ragdoll.

returnValues.description: Is ragdoll or not

functions.name: IsScripted
functions.description: Checks if the entity is a SENT or a built-in entity.

returnValues.description: Returns true if entity is scripted ( SENT ), false if not ( A built-in engine entity )

functions.name: IsSequenceFinished
functions.description: Returns whether the entity's current sequence is finished or not.

returnValues.description: Whether the entity's sequence is finished or not.

functions.name: IsSolid
functions.description:
Returns if the entity is solid or not.
Very useful for determining if the entity is a trigger or not.

returnValues.description: Whether the entity is solid or not.

functions.name: IsValid
functions.description:
Returns whether the entity is a valid entity or not.

An entity is valid if:
* It is not a <page text="NULL">Global_Variables</page> entity
* It is not the worldspawn entity (<page>game.GetWorld</page>)

<note>Instead of calling this method directly, it's a good idea to call the global <page>Global.IsValid</page> instead, however if you're sure the variable you're using is always an entity object it's better to use this method</note>

It will check whether the given variable contains an object (an Entity) or nothing at all for you. See examples.

<warning>NULL entities can still be assigned with key/value pairs, but they will be instantly negated. See example 3</warning>
This might be a cause for a lot of headache. Usually happening during networking etc., when completely valid entities suddenly become invalid on the client, but are never filtered with IsValid(). See <page>GM:InitPostEntity</page> for more details.

returnValues.description: true if the entity is valid, false otherwise

functions.name: IsValidLayer
functions.description:
Returns whether the given layer ID is valid and exists on this entity.

<note>This function only works on <page>BaseAnimatingOverlay</page> entities.</note>

arguments.name: layerID
arguments.description: The Layer ID

returnValues.description: Whether the given layer ID is valid and exists on this entity.

functions.name: IsVehicle
functions.description: Checks if the entity is a vehicle or not.

returnValues.description: Whether the entity is a vehicle.

functions.name: IsWeapon
functions.description: Checks if the entity is a weapon or not.

returnValues.description: Whether the entity is a weapon

functions.name: IsWidget
functions.description:
Returns whether the entity is a widget or not.

This is used by the "Edit Bones" context menu property.

returnValues.description: Whether the entity is a widget or not.

functions.name: IsWorld
functions.description: Returns if this entity is the map entity `Entity[0] worldspawn`.

returnValues.description: Whether this entity is the world entity.

functions.name: LocalToWorld
functions.description: Converts a vector local to an entity into a worldspace vector

arguments.name: lpos
arguments.description: The local vector

returnValues.description: The translated to world coordinates vector

functions.name: LocalToWorldAngles
functions.description: Converts a local angle (local to the entity) to a world angle.

arguments.name: ang
arguments.description: The local angle

returnValues.description: The world angle

functions.name: LookupAttachment
functions.description: Returns the attachment index of the given attachment name.

arguments.name: attachmentName
arguments.description: The name of the attachment.

returnValues.description: The attachment index, or 0 if the attachment does not exist and -1 if the model is invalid.

functions.name: LookupBone
functions.description: Gets the bone index of the given bone name, returns `nil` if the bone does not exist.

arguments.name: boneName
arguments.description:
The name of the bone.

Common generic bones ( for player models and some HL2 models ):
* ValveBiped.Bip01_Head1
* ValveBiped.Bip01_Spine
* ValveBiped.Anim_Attachment_RH

Common hand bones (left hand equivalents also available, replace _R_ with _L_)
* ValveBiped.Bip01_R_Hand
* ValveBiped.Bip01_R_Forearm
* ValveBiped.Bip01_R_Foot
* ValveBiped.Bip01_R_Thigh
* ValveBiped.Bip01_R_Calf
* ValveBiped.Bip01_R_Shoulder
* ValveBiped.Bip01_R_Elbow

returnValues.description: Index of the given bone name, or `nil` if the bone doesn't exist on the Entity

functions.name: LookupPoseParameter
functions.description: Returns pose parameter ID from its name.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Pose parameter name

returnValues.description: The ID of the given pose parameter name, if it exists, -1 otherwise

functions.name: LookupSequence
functions.description: Returns sequence ID from its name. See <page>Entity:GetSequenceName</page> for a function that does the opposite.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Sequence name

returnValues.description: Sequence ID for that name. This **will** differ for models with same sequence names. Will be -1 when the sequence is invalid.

The sequence duration
* 0 if the sequence is invalid

functions.name: MakePhysicsObjectAShadow
functions.description:
Turns the <page>Entity:GetPhysicsObject</page> into a physics shadow.
It's used internally for the Player's and NPC's physics object, and certain HL2 entities such as the crane.

A physics shadow can be used to have static entities that never move by setting both arguments to false.

<note>Unlike <page>Entity:PhysicsInitShadow</page>, this function doesn't remove the current physics object.</note>

arguments.name: allowPhysicsMovement
arguments.description: Whether to allow the physics shadow to move under stress.

arguments.name: allowPhysicsRotation
arguments.description: Whether to allow the physics shadow to rotate under stress.

functions.name: ManipulateBoneAngles
functions.description:
Sets custom bone angles.

<bug issue="5148">When used repeatedly serverside, this method is strongly discouraged due to the huge network traffic produced

As of update `2024.10.29` this has been resolved. However, network traffic is still generated and should be taken into consideration.
</bug>

arguments.name: boneID
arguments.description: Index of the bone you want to manipulate

arguments.name: ang
arguments.description:
Angle to apply.

The angle is relative to the original bone angle, not relative to the world or the entity.

arguments.name: networking
arguments.description: boolean to network these changes (if called from server)

functions.name: ManipulateBoneJiggle
functions.description: Manipulates the bone's jiggle status. This allows non jiggly bones to become jiggly.

arguments.name: boneID
arguments.description: Index of the bone you want to manipulate.

arguments.name: type
arguments.description:
The jiggle bone type. There are currently the following options:
* `0` = No jiggle override, use model default
* `1` = Force jiggle, with hardcoded settings
* `2` = Force disable jiggle bone (currently also broken, but will be fixed in the next update)

functions.name: ManipulateBonePosition
functions.description: Sets custom bone offsets.

arguments.name: boneID
arguments.description: Index of the bone you want to manipulate.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: Position vector to apply. Note that the position is relative to the original bone position, not relative to the world or the entity.

arguments.name: networking
arguments.description: boolean to network these changes (if called from server)

functions.name: ManipulateBoneScale
functions.description:
Sets custom bone scale.

<bug issue="5148">When used repeatedly serverside, this method is strongly discouraged due to the huge network traffic produced.</bug>

<bug issue="3502">This does not scale procedural bones.</bug>

arguments.name: boneID
arguments.description: Index of the bone you want to manipulate

arguments.name: scale
arguments.description: Scale vector to apply. Note that the scale is relative to the original bone scale, not relative to the world or the entity.

functions.name: MapCreationID
functions.description:
Returns entity's map creation ID. Unlike <page>Entity:EntIndex</page> or <page>Entity:GetCreationID</page>, it will always be the same on same map, no matter how much you clean up or restart it.

To be used in conjunction with <page>ents.GetMapCreatedEntity</page>. See also <page>Entity:CreatedByMap</page>.

returnValues.description: The map creation ID or -1 if the entity is not compiled into the map.

functions.name: MarkShadowAsDirty
functions.description: Refreshes the shadow of the entity.

functions.name: MuzzleFlash
functions.description: Fires the muzzle flash effect of the weapon the entity is carrying. This only creates a light effect and is often called alongside <page>Weapon:SendWeaponAnim</page>

functions.name: NearestPoint
functions.description:
Performs a Ray-Orientated Bounding Box intersection from the given position to the origin of the OBBox with the entity and returns the hit position on the OBBox.

This relies on the entity having a collision mesh (not a physics object) and will be affected by `SOLID_NONE`

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: The vector to start the intersection from.

returnValues.description: The nearest hit point of the entity's bounding box in world coordinates.

functions.name: NetworkVar
functions.description:
Creates a network variable on the entity and adds Set/Get functions for it. This function should only be called in <page>ENTITY:SetupDataTables</page>.

See <page>Entity:NetworkVarNotify</page> for a function to hook NetworkVar changes.

<note>
Entity NetworkVars are influenced by the return value of <page>ENTITY:UpdateTransmitState</page>.
So if you use the **PVS**(**default**), then the NetworkVars can be different for each client.
</note>

<warning>Make sure to not call the SetDT* and your custom set methods on the client realm unless you know exactly what you are doing.</warning>
Combining this function with <page>util.TableToJSON</page> can also provide a way to network tables as serialized strings.

arguments.name: type
arguments.description:
Supported choices:

* `String` (up to 511 characters)
* `Bool`
* `Float`
* `Int` (32-bit signed integer)
* `Vector`
* `Angle`
* `Entity`

arguments.name: slot
arguments.description:
Each network variable has to have a unique slot. The slot is per type - so you can have an int in slot `0`, a bool in slot `0` and a float in slot `0` etc. You can't have two ints in slot `0`, instead you would do a int in slot `0` and another int in slot `1`.

The max slots right now are `32` - so you should pick a number between `0` and `31`. An exception to this is strings which has a max slots of `4`.

This can be omitted entirely (arguments will shift) and it will use the next available slot.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name will affect how you access it. If you call it `Foo` you would add two new functions on your entity - `SetFoo()` and `GetFoo()`. So be careful that what you call it won't collide with any existing functions (don't call it `Pos` for example).

arguments.name: extended
arguments.description:
A table of extended information.

`KeyName`
* Allows the NetworkVar to be set using <page>Entity:SetKeyValue</page>. This is useful if you're making an entity that you want to be loaded in a map. The sky entity uses this.

`Edit`
* The edit key lets you mark this variable as editable. See <page>Editable Entities</page> for more information.

functions.name: NetworkVarElement
functions.description:
Similarly to <page>Entity:NetworkVar</page>, creates a network variable on the entity and adds Set/Get functions for it. This method stores it's value as a member value of a vector or an angle. This allows to go beyond the normal variable limit of <page>Entity:NetworkVar</page> for `Int` and `Float` types, at the expense of `Vector` and `Angle` limit.

This function should only be called in <page>ENTITY:SetupDataTables</page>.

<warning>Make sure to not call the SetDT* and your custom set methods on the client realm unless you know exactly what you are doing.</warning>

arguments.name: type
arguments.description:
Supported choices:
* `Vector`
* `Angle`

arguments.name: slot
arguments.description: The slot for this `Vector` or `Angle`, from `0` to `31`. See <page>Entity:NetworkVar</page> for more detailed explanation.

arguments.name: element
arguments.description: Which element of a `Vector` or an `Angle` to store the value on. This can be `p`, `y`, `r` for <page>Angle</page>s, and `x`, `y`, `z` for <page>Vector</page>s

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name will affect how you access it. If you call it `Foo` you would add two new functions on your entity - `SetFoo()` and `GetFoo()`. So be careful that what you call it won't collide with any existing functions (don't call it "Pos" for example).

arguments.name: extended
arguments.description: A table of extra information. See <page>Entity:NetworkVar</page> for details.

functions.name: NetworkVarNotify
functions.description:
Creates a callback that will execute when the given network variable changes - that is, when the `Set<name>()` function is run.

The callback is executed **before** the value is changed, and is called even if the new and old values are the same.

This function does not exist on entities in which <page>Entity:InstallDataTable</page> has not been called.

By default, this means this function only exists on SENTs (both serverside and clientside) and on players with a <page text="Player Class">Player_Classes</page> (serverside and clientside <page>Global.LocalPlayer</page> only).

It's therefore safest to only use this in <page>ENTITY:SetupDataTables</page>.

<bug request="324">The callback will not be called clientside if the var is changed right after entity spawn.</bug>
</name>

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of variable to track changes of.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description:
The function to call when the variable changes.

<callback>
<arg type="Entity" name="entity">Entity whos variable changed.</arg>
<arg type="string" name="name">Name of changed variable.</arg>
<arg type="any" name="old">Old/current variable value.</arg>
<arg type="any" name="new">New variable value that it was set to.</arg>
</callback>

functions.name: NextThink
functions.description:
Controls when, relative to <page>Global.CurTime</page>, the <page>Entity</page> will next run its Think function.

For Scripted Entities, this is the <page>ENTITY:Think</page> function.
For engine Entities, this is an internal function whose behavior will depend on the specific Entity type.


For a Client-side equivalent, see <page>Entity:SetNextClientThink</page>.

<bug issue="3269">This does not work with SWEPs or Nextbots.</bug>

arguments.name: timestamp
arguments.description: The timestamp, relative to <page>Global.CurTime</page>, when the next think should occur.

functions.name: OBBCenter
functions.description: Returns the center of an entity's bounding box in local space.

returnValues.description: The center of an entity's bounding box relative to its <page>Entity:GetPos</page>.

functions.name: OBBMaxs
functions.description: Returns the highest corner of an entity's bounding box as a local vector.

returnValues.description: The local position of the highest corner of the entity's oriented bounding box.

functions.name: OBBMins
functions.description: Returns the lowest corner of an entity's bounding box as a local vector.

returnValues.description: The local position of the lowest corner of the entity's oriented bounding box.

functions.name: ObjectCaps
functions.description:
Returns the entity's capabilities as a bitfield.

In the engine this function is mostly used to check the use type, the save/restore system and level transitions flags.

Even though the function is defined shared, it is not guaranteed to return the same value across states.

<note>The enums for this are not currently implemented in Lua, however you can access the defines [here](https://github.com/ValveSoftware/source-sdk-2013/blob/55ed12f8d1eb6887d348be03aee5573d44177ffb/mp/src/game/shared/baseentity_shared.h#L21-L38).</note>

returnValues.description: The bitfield, a combination of the [FCAP_](https://github.com/ValveSoftware/source-sdk-2013/blob/55ed12f8d1eb6887d348be03aee5573d44177ffb/mp/src/game/shared/baseentity_shared.h#L21-L38) flags.

functions.name: OnGround
functions.description:
Returns true if the entity is on the ground, and false if it isn't.

Internally, this checks if <page text="FL_ONGROUND">Enums/FL</page> is set on the entity. This is only updated for players and NPCs, and thus won't inherently work for other entities.

returnValues.description: Whether the entity is on the ground or not.

functions.name: PassesDamageFilter
functions.description:
Tests whether the damage passes the entity filter.

This will call <page>ENTITY:PassesDamageFilter</page> on scripted entities of the type "filter".

<note>This function only works on entities of the type "filter". ( filter_* entities, including base game filter entites )</note>

arguments.name: dmg
arguments.description: The damage info to test

returnValues.description: Whether the damage info passes the entity filter.

functions.name: PassesFilter
functions.description:
Tests whether the entity passes the entity filter.

This will call <page>ENTITY:PassesFilter</page> on scripted entities of the type "filter".

<note>This function only works on entities of the type "filter". ( filter_* entities, including base game filter entites )</note>

arguments.name: caller
arguments.description:
The initiator of the test.

For example the trigger this filter entity is used in.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity to test against the entity filter.

returnValues.description: Whether the entity info passes the entity filter.

functions.name: PhysicsDestroy
functions.description:
Destroys the current physics object of an entity.

<note>Cannot be used on a ragdoll or the world entity.</note>

functions.name: PhysicsFromMesh
functions.description:
Initializes the physics mesh of the entity from a triangle soup defined by a table of vertices. The resulting mesh is hollow, may contain holes, and always has a volume of 0.

While this is very useful for static geometry such as terrain displacements, it is advised to use <page>Entity:PhysicsInitConvex</page> or <page>Entity:PhysicsInitMultiConvex</page> for moving solid objects instead.

<page>Entity:EnableCustomCollisions</page> needs to be called if you want players to collide with the entity correctly.

arguments.name: vertices
arguments.description: A table consisting of <page>Structures/MeshVertex</page> (only the `pos` element is taken into account). Every 3 vertices define a triangle in the physics mesh.

arguments.name: surfaceprop
arguments.description: Physical material from [surfaceproperties.txt](https://github.com/Facepunch/garrysmod/blob/master/garrysmod/scripts/surfaceproperties.txt) or added with <page>physenv.AddSurfaceData</page>.

arguments.name: massCenterOveride
arguments.description: If set, overwrites the center of mass for the created physics object.

returnValues.description: Returns `true` on success, `nil` otherwise.

functions.name: PhysicsInit
functions.description:
Initializes the <page text="physics object">Entity:GetPhysicsObject</page> of the entity using its current <page text="model">Entity:GetModel</page>. Deletes the previous physics object if it existed and the new object creation was successful.

If the entity's current model has no physics mesh associated to it, no physics object will be created and the previous object will still exist, if applicable.

<note>When called clientside, this will not create a valid <page>PhysObj</page> if the model hasn't been <page text="precached">util.PrecacheModel</page> serverside.

If successful, this function will automatically call <page>Entity:SetSolid</page>( solidType ) and <page>Entity:SetSolidFlags</page>( 0 ).</note>

<bug issue="5060">Clientside physics objects are broken and do not move properly in some cases. Physics objects should only created on the server or you will experience incorrect physgun beam position, prediction issues, and other unexpected behavior.

A workaround is available on the <page>Entity:PhysicsInitConvex</page> page.</bug>

arguments.name: solidType
arguments.description:
The solid type of the physics object to create, see <page>Enums/SOLID</page>. Should be `SOLID_VPHYSICS` in most cases.

<note>Using `SOLID_NONE` will only delete the current physics object - it does not create a new one.</note>

arguments.name: massCenterOverride
arguments.description: If set, overwrites the center of mass for the created physics object.

returnValues.description: Returns `true` on success, `false` otherwise.

functions.name: PhysicsInitBox
functions.description:
Makes the physics object of the entity a AABB.

This function will automatically destroy any previous physics objects and do the following:
* <page>Entity:SetSolid</page>( `SOLID_BBOX` )
* <page>Entity:SetMoveType</page>( `MOVETYPE_VPHYSICS` )
* <page>Entity:SetCollisionBounds</page>( `mins`, `maxs` )

<note>If the volume of the resulting box is 0 (the mins and maxs are the same), the mins and maxs will be changed to <page>Global.Vector</page>( -1, -1, -1 ) and <page>Global.Vector</page>( 1, 1, 1 ), respectively.</note>

<bug issue="5060">Clientside physics objects are broken and do not move properly in some cases. Physics objects should only created on the server or you will experience incorrect physgun beam position, prediction issues, and other unexpected behavior.

A workaround is available on the <page>Entity:PhysicsInitConvex</page> page.</bug>

arguments.name: mins
arguments.description: The minimum position of the box. This is automatically ordered with the maxs.

arguments.name: maxs
arguments.description: The maximum position of the box. This is automatically ordered with the mins.

arguments.name: surfaceprop
arguments.description: Physical material from [surfaceproperties.txt](https://github.com/Facepunch/garrysmod/blob/master/garrysmod/scripts/surfaceproperties.txt) or added with <page>physenv.AddSurfaceData</page>.

arguments.name: massCenterOverride
arguments.description: If set, overwrites the center of mass for the created physics object.

returnValues.description: Returns `true` on success, `nil` otherwise. This fails when the game cannot create any more <page>PhysCollide</page>s.

functions.name: PhysicsInitConvex
functions.description:
Initializes the physics mesh of the entity with a convex mesh defined by a table of points. The resulting mesh is the  of all the input points. If successful, the previous physics object will be removed.

This is the standard way of creating moving physics objects with a custom convex shape. For more complex, concave shapes, see <page>Entity:PhysicsInitMultiConvex</page>.

<bug issue="3301">This will crash if given all <page>Global.Vector</page>(0,0,0)s.</bug>

<bug issue="5060">Clientside physics objects are broken and do not move properly in some cases. Physics objects should only created on the server or you will experience incorrect physgun beam position, prediction issues, and other unexpected behavior.

You can use the following workaround for movement, though clientside collisions will still be broken.
```
function ENT:Think()
if ( CLIENT ) then
local physobj = self:GetPhysicsObject()

if ( IsValid( physobj ) ) then
physobj:SetPos( self:GetPos() )
physobj:SetAngles( self:GetAngles() )
end
end
end
```
</bug>

arguments.name: points
arguments.description: A table of eight <page>Vector</page>s, in local coordinates, to be used in the computation of the convex mesh. Order does not matter.

arguments.name: surfaceprop
arguments.description: Physical material from [surfaceproperties.txt](https://github.com/Facepunch/garrysmod/blob/master/garrysmod/scripts/surfaceproperties.txt) or added with <page>physenv.AddSurfaceData</page>.

arguments.name: massCenterOverride
arguments.description: If set, overwrites the center of mass for the created physics object.

returnValues.description: Returns `true` on success, `false` otherwise.

functions.name: PhysicsInitMultiConvex
functions.description:
An advanced version of <page>Entity:PhysicsInitConvex</page> which initializes a physics object from multiple convex meshes. This should be used for physics objects with a custom shape which cannot be represented by a single convex mesh.

If successful, the previous physics object will be removed.

<bug issue="5060">Clientside physics objects are broken and do not move properly in some cases. Physics objects should only created on the server or you will experience incorrect physgun beam position, prediction issues, and other unexpected behavior.

A workaround is available on the <page>Entity:PhysicsInitConvex</page> page.</bug>

arguments.name: vertices
arguments.description: A table consisting of tables of <page>Vector</page>s. Each sub-table defines a set of points to be used in the computation of one convex mesh.

arguments.name: surfaceprop
arguments.description: Physical material from [surfaceproperties.txt](https://github.com/Facepunch/garrysmod/blob/master/garrysmod/scripts/surfaceproperties.txt) or added with <page>physenv.AddSurfaceData</page>.

arguments.name: massCenterOverride
arguments.description: If set, overwrites the center of mass for the created physics object.

returnValues.description: Returns `true` on success, `nil` otherwise.

functions.name: PhysicsInitShadow
functions.description:
Initializes the entity's physics object as a physics shadow. Removes the previous physics object if successful. This is used internally for the Player's and NPC's physics object, and certain HL2 entities such as the crane.

A physics shadow can be used to have static entities that never move by setting both arguments to false.

The created physics object will depend on the entity's solidity `SOLID_NONE` will not create a physics object, `SOLID_BBOX` will create a Axis-Aligned BBox one, `SOLID_OBB` will create Orientated Bounding Box one, and anything else will use the models' physics mesh.

<bug issue="5060">Clientside physics objects are broken and do not move properly in some cases. Physics objects should only created on the server or you will experience incorrect physgun beam position, prediction issues, and other unexpected behavior.

A workaround is available on the <page>Entity:PhysicsInitConvex</page> page.</bug>

arguments.name: allowPhysicsMovement
arguments.description: Whether to allow the physics shadow to move under stress.

arguments.name: allowPhysicsRotation
arguments.description: Whether to allow the physics shadow to rotate under stress.

returnValues.description: Return `true` on success, `nil` otherwise.

functions.name: PhysicsInitSphere
functions.description:
Makes the physics object of the entity a sphere.

This function will automatically destroy any previous physics objects and do the following:
* <page>Entity:SetSolid</page>( `SOLID_BBOX` )
* <page>Entity:SetMoveType</page>( `MOVETYPE_VPHYSICS` )

<bug issue="5060">Clientside physics objects are broken and do not move properly in some cases. Physics objects should only created on the server or you will experience incorrect physgun beam position, prediction issues, and other unexpected behavior.

A workaround is available on the <page>Entity:PhysicsInitConvex</page> page.</bug>

arguments.name: radius
arguments.description: The radius of the sphere.

arguments.name: physmat
arguments.description: Physical material from [surfaceproperties.txt](https://github.com/Facepunch/garrysmod/blob/master/garrysmod/scripts/surfaceproperties.txt) or added with <page>physenv.AddSurfaceData</page>.

returnValues.description: Returns `true` on success, `false` otherwise

functions.name: PhysicsInitStatic
functions.description:
Initializes a static physics object of the entity using its <page text="current model">Entity:GetModel</page>. If successful, the previous physics object is removed.

This is what used by entities such as `func_breakable`, `prop_dynamic`, `item_suitcharger`, `prop_thumper` and `npc_rollermine` while it is in its "buried" state in the Half-Life 2 Campaign.

If the entity's current model has no physics mesh associated to it, no physics object will be created.

<note>This function will automatically call <page>Entity:SetSolid</page>( `solidType` ).</note>

<bug issue="5060">Clientside physics objects are broken and do not move properly in some cases. Physics objects should only created on the server or you will experience incorrect physgun beam position, prediction issues, and other unexpected behavior.

A workaround is available on the <page>Entity:PhysicsInitConvex</page> page.</bug>

arguments.name: solidType
arguments.description: The solid type of the physics object to create, see <page>Enums/SOLID</page>. Should be `SOLID_VPHYSICS` in most cases.

returnValues.description: Returns `true` on success, `false` otherwise. This will fail if the entity's current model has no associated physics mesh.

functions.name: PhysWake
functions.description: Wakes up the entity's physics object

functions.name: PlayScene
functions.description: Makes the entity play a .vcd scene. [All scenes from Half-Life 2](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Half-Life_2_Scenes_List).

arguments.name: scene
arguments.description: Filepath to scene.

arguments.name: delay
arguments.description: Delay in seconds until the scene starts playing.

returnValues.description: Estimated length of the scene.
The scene entity, removing which will stop the scene from continuing to play.

functions.name: PointAtEntity
functions.description: Changes an entities angles so that it faces the target entity.

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: The entity to face.

functions.name: PrecacheGibs
functions.description:
Precaches gibs for the entity's model.

Normally this function should be ran when the entity is spawned, for example the <page>ENTITY:Initialize</page>, after <page>Entity:SetModel</page> is called.

This is required for <page>Entity:GibBreakServer</page> and <page>Entity:GibBreakClient</page> to work.

returnValues.name: gibCount
returnValues.description: The amount of gibs the prop has

functions.name: RagdollSolve
functions.description: Normalizes the ragdoll. This is used alongside Kinect in <page>Entity:SetRagdollBuildFunction</page>, for more info see ragdoll_motion entity.

functions.name: RagdollStopControlling
functions.description: Sets the function to build the ragdoll. This is used alongside Kinect in <page>Entity:SetRagdollBuildFunction</page>, for more info see ragdoll_motion entity.

functions.name: RagdollUpdatePhysics
functions.description: Makes the physics objects follow the set bone positions. This is used alongside Kinect in <page>Entity:SetRagdollBuildFunction</page>, for more info see ragdoll_motion entity.

functions.name: Remove
functions.description: Removes the entity it is used on. The entity will be removed at the start of next tick.

functions.name: RemoveAllDecals
functions.description: Removes all decals from the entities surface.

functions.name: RemoveAllGestures
functions.description:
Removes and stops all gestures.

<note>This function only works on <page>BaseAnimatingOverlay</page> entites!</note>

functions.name: RemoveCallback
functions.description: Removes a callback previously added with <page>Entity:AddCallback</page>

arguments.name: hook
arguments.description: The hook name to remove. See <page>Entity Callbacks</page>

arguments.name: callbackid
arguments.description: The callback id previously retrieved with the return of <page>Entity:AddCallback</page> or <page>Entity:GetCallbacks</page>

functions.name: RemoveCallOnRemove
functions.description: Removes a function previously added via <page>Entity:CallOnRemove</page>.

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: Identifier of the function given to <page>Entity:CallOnRemove</page>.

functions.name: RemoveEffects
functions.description: Removes an engine effect applied to an entity.

arguments.name: effect
arguments.description: The effect to remove, see <page>Enums/EF</page>.

functions.name: RemoveEFlags
functions.description: Removes specified engine flag

arguments.name: flag
arguments.description: The flag to remove, see <page>Enums/EFL</page>

functions.name: RemoveFlags
functions.description: Removes specified flag(s) from the entity

arguments.name: flag
arguments.description: The flag(s) to remove, see <page>Enums/FL</page>

functions.name: RemoveFromMotionController
functions.description:
Removes a <page>PhysObj</page>ect from the entity's motion controller so that <page>ENTITY:PhysicsSimulate</page> will no longer be called for given <page>PhysObj</page>ect.

You must first create a motion controller with <page>Entity:StartMotionController</page>.

<note>Only works on a scripted <page>Entity</page> of anim type</note>

arguments.name: physObj
arguments.description: The <page>PhysObj</page> to remove from the motion controller.

functions.name: RemoveGesture
functions.description:
Removes and stops the gesture with given activity.

<note>This function only works on <page>BaseAnimatingOverlay</page> entites!</note>

arguments.name: activity
arguments.description: The activity remove. See <page>Enums/ACT</page>.

functions.name: RemoveInternalConstraint
functions.description:
Breaks internal Ragdoll constrains, so you can for example separate an arm from the body of a ragdoll and preserve all physics.

The visual mesh will still stretch as if it was properly connected unless the ragdoll model is specifically designed to avoid that.

arguments.name: num
arguments.description: Which constraint to break, values below 0 mean break them all

functions.name: RemoveSolidFlags
functions.description: Removes solid flag(s) from the entity.

arguments.name: flags
arguments.description: The flag(s) to remove, see <page>Enums/FSOLID</page>.

functions.name: RemoveSpawnFlags
functions.description:
Removes a SpawnFlag from the current SpawnFlags of an Entity.

SpawnFlags can easily be found on https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/.

<note>See also <page>Entity:AddSpawnFlags</page>, <page>Entity:SetSpawnFlags</page>

Using <page text="SF Enumerations">Enums/SF</page> won't work, if this function is ran clientside due to the enumerations being defined only Serverside. Use the actual SpawnFlag number.
</note>

arguments.name: flag
arguments.description: The SpawnFlag to remove from the Entity

functions.name: ResetSequence
functions.description:
Plays an animation on the entity. This may not always work on engine entities.

<warning>This will not reset the animation on viewmodels, use <page>Entity:SendViewModelMatchingSequence</page> instead.</warning>

<note>This will not work properly if called directly after calling <page>Entity:SetModel</page>. Consider waiting until the next Tick.

Will not work on players due to the animations being reset every frame by the base gamemode animation system. See <page>GM:CalcMainActivity</page>.

For custom scripted entities you will want to apply example from <page>ENTITY:Think</page> to make animations work.</note>

arguments.name: sequence
arguments.description:
The sequence to play. Also accepts strings.

<note>If set to a string, the function will automatically call <page>Entity:LookupSequence</page> to retrieve the sequence ID as a number.</note>

functions.name: ResetSequenceInfo
functions.description: Reset entity sequence info such as playback rate, ground speed, last event check, etc.

functions.name: Respawn
functions.description:
Makes the entity/weapon respawn.

Only usable on HL2/HL:S pickups and any weapons. Seems to be buggy with weapons.
Very unreliable.

functions.name: RestartGesture
functions.description:
Restarts the entity's animation gesture. If the given gesture is already playing, it will reset it and play it from the beginning.

<note>This function only works on <page>BaseAnimatingOverlay</page> entites.</note>

arguments.name: activity
arguments.description: The activity number to send to the entity. See <page>Enums/ACT</page> and <page>Entity:GetSequenceActivity</page>

arguments.name: addIfMissing
arguments.description: Add/start the gesture to if it has not been yet started.

functions.name: RestoreNetworkVars
functions.description:
Calls the associated `Entity:Set*` function for each network var provided.

<internal>Used for the built-in duplicator, you do not need to call this yourself.</internal>

<note>This function will only work on entities which had <page>Entity:InstallDataTable</page> called on them, which is done automatically for players and all <page>Scripted Entities</page></note>

arguments.name: data
arguments.description: The data from <page>Entity:GetNetworkVars</page>.

functions.name: SelectWeightedSequence
functions.description:
Returns sequence ID corresponding to given activity ID.

Opposite of <page>Entity:GetSequenceActivity</page>.

Similar to <page>Entity:LookupSequence</page>.

See also <page>Entity:SelectWeightedSequenceSeeded</page>.

arguments.name: act
arguments.description: The activity ID, see <page>Enums/ACT</page>.

returnValues.description: The sequence ID

functions.name: SelectWeightedSequenceSeeded
functions.description:
Returns the sequence ID corresponding to given activity ID, and uses the provided seed for random selection. The seed should be the same server-side and client-side if used in a predicted environment.

See <page>Entity:SelectWeightedSequence</page> for a provided-seed version of this function.

arguments.name: act
arguments.description: The activity ID, see <page>Enums/ACT</page>.

arguments.name: seed
arguments.description: The seed to use for randomly selecting a sequence in the case the activity ID has multiple sequences bound to it. <page>Entity:SelectWeightedSequence</page> uses the same seed as <page>util.SharedRandom</page> internally for this.

returnValues.description: The sequence ID

functions.name: SendViewModelMatchingSequence
functions.description:
Sends sequence animation to the view model. It is recommended to use this for view model animations, instead of <page>Entity:ResetSequence</page>.

This function is only usable on view models.

arguments.name: seq
arguments.description: The sequence ID returned by <page>Entity:LookupSequence</page> or  <page>Entity:SelectWeightedSequence</page>.

functions.name: SequenceDuration
functions.description:
Returns length of currently played sequence.

<bug issue="2783">This will return incorrect results for weapons and viewmodels clientside in thirdperson.</bug>

arguments.name: seqid
arguments.description: A sequence ID to return the length specific sequence of instead of the entity's main/currently playing sequence.

returnValues.description: The length of the sequence

functions.name: SetAbsVelocity
functions.description:
Sets the entity's velocity.

<note>Actually binds to CBaseEntity::SetLocalVelocity() which sets the entity's velocity due to movement in the world from forces such as gravity. Does not include velocity from entity-on-entity collision or other world movement.</note>

arguments.name: velocity
arguments.description: The new velocity to set.

functions.name: SetAngles
functions.description:
Sets the angles of the entity.

<note>To set a player's angles, use <page>Player:SetEyeAngles</page> instead.</note>

arguments.name: angles
arguments.description: The new angles.

functions.name: SetAnimation
functions.description: Sets a player's third-person animation. Mainly used by <page>Weapon</page>s to start the player's weapon attack and reload animations.

arguments.name: playerAnim
arguments.description: Player animation, see <page>Enums/PLAYER</page>.

functions.name: SetAnimTime
functions.description: Sets the start time (relative to <page>Global.CurTime</page>) of the current animation, which is used to determine <page>Entity:GetCycle</page>. Should be less than CurTime to play an animation from the middle.

arguments.name: time
arguments.description: The time the animation was supposed to begin.

functions.name: SetAttachment
functions.description:
<deprecated>You should be using <page>Entity:SetParent</page> instead.</deprecated>

Parents the sprite to an attachment on another model.

Works only on `env_sprite` entities.

Despite existing on client, it doesn't actually do anything on client.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity to attach/parent to

arguments.name: attachment
arguments.description: The attachment ID to parent to

functions.name: SetBloodColor
functions.description: Sets the blood color this entity uses.

arguments.name: bloodColor
arguments.description: An integer corresponding to <page>Enums/BLOOD_COLOR</page>.

functions.name: SetBodygroup
functions.description:
Sets the currently active <page text="Sub Model ID">Structures/BodyGroupData#submodels</page> for the Body Group corresponding to the given <page text="Body Group ID">Structures/BodyGroupData#id</page> of the <page text="Entity's">Entity</page> model.
<note>
When used on a Weapon, this will modify its viewmodel.
</note>

arguments.name: bodyGroupId
arguments.description:
The Body Group ID to set the Sub Model ID of.
Body Group IDs start at `0`.

arguments.name: subModelId
arguments.description:
The Sub Model ID to set as active for this Body Group.
Sub Model IDs start at `0`.

functions.name: SetBodyGroups
functions.description:
Sets the <page text="Entity's">Entity</page> active Sub Models via a string of <page text="Sub Model IDs">Structures/BodyGroupData#submodels</page> in order from the first <page text="Body Group ID">Structures/BodyGroupData#id</page> to the last.

This is a convenience function for <page>Entity:SetBodygroup</page>.
<note>
When used on a Weapon, this will modify its viewmodel.
</note>

arguments.name: subModelIds
arguments.description:
The Sub Model IDs to activate for each Body Group on the Entity's model.

The first character corresponds with Body Group ID `0`, the second character coressponds to Body Group ID `1`, etc.

To support Body Groups with more than `0`-`9` options, values above `9` are represented using alphabetical characters starting with `a` and ending with `z`.

functions.name: SetBoneController
functions.description:
Sets the specified value on the bone controller with the given ID of this entity, it's used in HL1 to change the head rotation of NPCs, turret aiming and so on.

<note>This is the precursor of pose parameters, and only works for Half Life 1: Source models supporting it.</note>

arguments.name: boneControllerID
arguments.description:
The ID of the bone controller to set the value to.
Goes from 0 to 3.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The value to set on the specified bone controller.

functions.name: SetBoneMatrix
functions.description:
Sets the bone matrix of given bone to given matrix. See also <page>Entity:GetBoneMatrix</page>.

<note>Despite existing serverside, it does nothing.</note>

arguments.name: boneid
arguments.description: The ID of the bone

arguments.name: matrix
arguments.description: The matrix to set.

functions.name: SetBonePosition
functions.description:
Sets the bone position and angles.

<validate>For changes to happen, this must be called in a <page text="rendering">Render_Order</page> hook.</validate>

arguments.name: bone
arguments.description: The bone ID to manipulate

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The position to set

arguments.name: ang
arguments.description: The angles to set

functions.name: SetCollisionBounds
functions.description:
Sets the collision bounds for the entity, which are used for triggers (<page>Entity:SetTrigger</page>, <page>ENTITY:Touch</page>), and collision (If <page>Entity:SetSolid</page> set as <page text="SOLID_BBOX">Enums/SOLID</page>).

Input bounds are relative to <page>Entity:GetPos</page>!
See also <page>Entity:SetCollisionBoundsWS</page>.

<note>Player collision bounds are reset every frame to player's <page>Player:SetHull</page> values.</note>

arguments.name: mins
arguments.description: The minimum vector of the bounds.

arguments.name: maxs
arguments.description: The maximum vector of the bounds.

functions.name: SetCollisionBoundsWS
functions.description: A convenience function that sets the collision bounds for the entity in world space coordinates by transforming given vectors to entity's local space and passing them to <page>Entity:SetCollisionBounds</page>

arguments.name: vec1
arguments.description: The first vector of the bounds.

arguments.name: vec2
arguments.description: The second vector of the bounds.

functions.name: SetCollisionGroup
functions.description: Sets the entity's collision group.

arguments.name: group
arguments.description: Collision group of the entity, see <page>Enums/COLLISION_GROUP</page>

functions.name: SetColor
functions.description:
Sets the color of an entity. Some entities may need a custom [render mode](Enums/RENDERMODE) set for transparency to work. See example 2.
Entities also must have a proper [render group](Enums/RENDERGROUP) set for transparency to work. When rendering a model manually via Entity:SetNoDraw inside ENTITY:Draw, you may need to use render.SetColorModulation in the render hook (where you call Entity:DrawModel) instead.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The color to set. Uses the <page>Color</page>.

functions.name: SetColor4Part
functions.description:
Sets the color of an entity without usage of a <page>Global.Color</page> object.

<internal>Used internally to implement <page>Entity:SetColor</page>.</internal>

functions.name: SetCreator
functions.description: Sets the creator of the Entity. This is set automatically in Sandbox gamemode when spawning SENTs, but is never used/read by default.

arguments.name: ply
arguments.description: The creator

functions.name: SetCustomCollisionCheck
functions.description:
Marks the entity to call <page>GM:ShouldCollide</page>. Not to be confused with <page>Entity:EnableCustomCollisions</page>.
<note>
Make sure to use <page>Entity:CollisionRulesChanged</page> after changing this value.
Otherwise it can cause crashes.
</note>

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: Enable or disable the custom collision check

functions.name: SetCycle
functions.description:
Sets the progress of the current animation to a specific value between 0 and 1.

<bug issue="3038">Viewmodels overwrite their animation cycle every frame, for prediction/interpolation purposes.</bug>

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The desired cycle value

functions.name: SetDTAngle
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
This is called internally by the <page>Entity:NetworkVar</page> system, you can use this in cases where using NetworkVar is not possible.

Sets the specified angle on the entity's datatable.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: Goes from 0 to 31.

arguments.name: ang
arguments.description: The angle to write on the entity's datatable.

functions.name: SetDTBool
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
This is called internally by the <page>Entity:NetworkVar</page> system, you can use this in cases where using NetworkVar is not possible.

Sets the specified bool on the entity's datatable.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: Goes from 0 to 31.

arguments.name: bool
arguments.description: The boolean to write on the entity's metatable.

functions.name: SetDTEntity
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
This is called internally by the <page>Entity:NetworkVar</page> system, you can use this in cases where using NetworkVar is not possible.

Sets the specified entity on this entity's datatable.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: Goes from 0 to 31.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity to write on this entity's datatable.

functions.name: SetDTFloat
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
This is called internally by the <page>Entity:NetworkVar</page> system, you can use this in cases where using NetworkVar is not possible.

Sets the specified float on the entity's datatable.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: Goes from 0 to 31.

arguments.name: float
arguments.description: The float to write on the entity's datatable.

functions.name: SetDTInt
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
This is called internally by the <page>Entity:NetworkVar</page> system, you can use this in cases where using NetworkVar is not possible.

Sets the specified integer on the entity's datatable.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: Goes from 0 to 31.

arguments.name: integer
arguments.description: The integer to write on the entity's datatable. This will be cast to a 32-bit signed integer internally.

functions.name: SetDTString
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
This is called internally by the <page>Entity:NetworkVar</page> system, you can use this in cases where using NetworkVar is not possible.

Sets the specified string on the entity's datatable.

<note>The length of these strings are capped at 512 characters.</note>

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: Goes from 0 to 3.

arguments.name: str
arguments.description: The string to write on the entity's datatable, can't be more than 512 characters per string.

functions.name: SetDTVector
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
This is called internally by the <page>Entity:NetworkVar</page> system, you can use this in cases where using NetworkVar is not possible.

Sets the specified vector on the entity's datatable.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: Goes from 0 to 31.

arguments.name: vec
arguments.description: The vector to write on the entity's datatable.

functions.name: SetElasticity
functions.description: Sets the elasticity of this entity, used by some flying entities such as the Helicopter NPC to determine how much it should bounce around when colliding.

arguments.name: elasticity
arguments.description: The elasticity to set.

functions.name: SetEntity
functions.description: Allows you to set the Start or End entity attachment for the rope.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description:
The name of the variable to modify.
Accepted names are StartEntity and EndEntity.

arguments.name: entity
arguments.description: The entity to apply to the specific attachment.

functions.name: SetEyeTarget
functions.description: Sets the position an entity's eyes look toward. This works as an override for default behavior. Set to `0,0,0` to disable the override.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: If NPC, the **world position** for the entity to look towards, for Ragdolls, a **local position** in front of their `eyes` attachment.

functions.name: SetFlexScale
functions.description: Sets the scale of all the flexes of this entity. See <page>Entity:SetFlexWeight</page>.

arguments.name: scale
arguments.description: The new flex scale to set to

functions.name: SetFlexWeight
functions.description:
Sets the weight/value of given flex controller.

<note>Only `96` flex controllers can be set! Flex controllers on models with higher amounts will not be accessible.</note>

arguments.name: flex
arguments.description: The ID of the flex to modify weight of.  The range is between `0` and <page>Entity:GetFlexNum</page> - 1.

arguments.name: weight
arguments.description: The new weight to set

functions.name: SetFriction
functions.description:
Sets friction multiplier for this entity when sliding against a surface. Entities default to 1 (100%) and can be higher.

This may not affect all entities, but does work for players (the range is 0 to 10), as well as other entities using <page text="MOVETYPE_STEP ">Enums/MOVETYPE#MOVETYPE_STEP </page>

This only multiplies the friction of the entity, to change the value itself use <page>PhysObj:SetMaterial</page>.

arguments.name: friction
arguments.description: Friction multiplier

functions.name: SetGravity
functions.description:
Sets the gravity multiplier of the entity.
