arguments.description: Name of the shader

functions.name: SetString
functions.description: Sets the specified material value to the specified string, does nothing on a type mismatch.

arguments.name: materialString
arguments.description: The name of the material string.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: The new string.

functions.name: SetTexture
functions.description: Sets the specified material texture to the specified texture, does nothing on a type mismatch.

arguments.name: materialTexture
arguments.description: The name of the keyvalue on the material to store the texture on.

arguments.name: texture
arguments.description: The new texture. This can also be a string, the name of the new texture.

functions.name: SetUndefined
functions.description: Unsets the value for the specified material value.

arguments.name: materialValueName
arguments.description: The name of the material value to be unset.

functions.name: SetVector
functions.description: Sets the specified material vector to the specified vector, does nothing on a type mismatch.

arguments.name: MaterialVector
arguments.description: The name of the material vector.

arguments.name: vec
arguments.description: The new vector.

functions.name: SetVector4D
functions.description: Sets the specified material vector to the specified 4 component vector, does nothing on a type mismatch.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the material vector.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The x component of the new vector.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The y component of the new vector.

arguments.name: z
arguments.description: The z component of the new vector.

arguments.name: w
arguments.description: The w component of the new vector.

functions.name: Width
functions.description: Returns the width of the member texture set for `$basetexture`.

returnValues.description: Width of the base texture.

name: IMesh
description:
Renderable mesh object, can be used to create models on the fly.
The only way to create your own IMesh object is to call <page>Global.Mesh</page>.

<note>
IMeshes only respond to one projected texture.
See the <page>render.RenderFlashlights</page> function and example that solves this problem.
</note>

functions.name: BuildFromTriangles
functions.description:
Builds the mesh from a table mesh vertexes.

When modifying a previously built mesh, your new mesh must match the vertex count!

See <page>Global.Mesh</page> and <page>util.GetModelMeshes</page> for examples.

<warning><page>IMesh</page> appears to have a limit of 65535 vertices. You should split your mesh into multiple meshes when above this limit.

Exceeding the limit may lead to undefined rendering behavior.</warning>

arguments.name: vertexes
arguments.description: A table consisting of <page>Structures/MeshVertex</page>s.

functions.name: Destroy
functions.description: Deletes the mesh and frees the memory used by it.

functions.name: Draw
functions.description: Renders the mesh with the active matrix.

functions.name: IsValid
functions.description: Returns whether this <page>IMesh</page> is valid or not.

returnValues.description: Whether this <page>IMesh</page> is valid or not.

name: IRestore
description:
The object used in the <page>saverestore</page>, mainly in <page>saverestore.AddRestoreHook</page>.

It allows you to read blocks directly from the save game files used by Half-Life 2 save system when such save is loaded.

functions.name: EndBlock
functions.description:
Ends current data block started with <page>IRestore:StartBlock</page> and returns to the parent block.

To avoid all sorts of errors, you **must** end all blocks you start.

functions.name: ReadAngle
functions.description: Reads next bytes from the restore object as an <page>Angle</page>.

returnValues.description: The angle that has been read

functions.name: ReadBool
functions.description: Reads next bytes from the restore object as a <page>boolean</page>.

returnValues.description: The boolean that has been read

functions.name: ReadEntity
functions.description: Reads next bytes from the restore object as an <page>Entity</page>.

returnValues.description: The entity that has been read.

functions.name: ReadFloat
functions.description: Reads next bytes from the restore object as a floating point <page>number</page>.

returnValues.description: The read floating point number.

functions.name: ReadInt
functions.description: Reads next bytes from the restore object as an integer <page>number</page>.

returnValues.description: The read integer number.

functions.name: ReadString
functions.description: Reads next bytes from the restore object as a <page>string</page>.

returnValues.description: The read string.

functions.name: ReadVector
functions.description: Reads next bytes from the restore object as a <page>Vector</page>.

returnValues.description: The read vector.

functions.name: StartBlock
functions.description: Loads next block of data to be read inside current block. Blocks **must** be ended with <page>IRestore:EndBlock</page>.

returnValues.description: The name of the next data block to be read.

name: ISave
description:
The object used in the <page>saverestore</page>, mainly in <page>saverestore.AddSaveHook</page>.

It allows you to write blocks directly into the save game files used by Half-Life 2 save system when such save is being saved.

functions.name: EndBlock
functions.description:
Ends current data block started with <page>ISave:StartBlock</page> and returns to the parent block.

To avoid all sorts of errors, you **must** end all blocks you start.

functions.name: StartBlock
functions.description: Starts a new block of data that you can write to inside current block. Blocks **must** be ended with <page>ISave:EndBlock</page>.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of the new block. Used for determining which block is which, returned by <page>IRestore:StartBlock</page> during game load.

functions.name: WriteAngle
functions.description: Writes an <page>Angle</page> to the save object.

arguments.name: ang
arguments.description: The angle to write.

functions.name: WriteBool
functions.description: Writes a <page>boolean</page> to the save object.

arguments.name: bool
arguments.description: The boolean to write.

functions.name: WriteEntity
functions.description: Writes an <page>Entity</page> to the save object.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity to write.

functions.name: WriteFloat
functions.description: Writes a floating point <page>number</page> to the save object.

arguments.name: float
arguments.description: The floating point number to write.

functions.name: WriteInt
functions.description: Writes an integer <page>number</page> to the save object.

arguments.name: int
arguments.description: The integer number to write.

functions.name: WriteString
functions.description: Writes a **null terminated** <page>string</page> to the save object.

arguments.name: str
arguments.description: The string to write.

functions.name: WriteVector
functions.description: Writes a <page>Vector</page> to the save object.

arguments.name: vec
arguments.description: The vector to write.

name: ITexture
description: An object representing game texture, like a .vtf file. Do not confuse with <page>IMaterial</page>. Returned by <page>IMaterial:GetTexture</page>

functions.name: Download
functions.description: Invokes the generator of the texture. Reloads file based textures from disk and clears render target textures.

functions.name: GetColor
functions.description:
Returns the color of the specified pixel, only works for textures created from PNG files.

<bug issue="2407">The returned color will not have the color metatable.</bug>

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The X coordinate.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The Y coordinate.

returnValues.description: The color of the pixel as a <page>Color</page>.

functions.name: GetMappingHeight
functions.description: Returns the true unmodified height of the texture.

returnValues.description: height

functions.name: GetMappingWidth
functions.description: Returns the true unmodified width of the texture.

returnValues.description: width

functions.name: GetName
functions.description: Returns the name of the texture, in most cases the path.

returnValues.description: name

functions.name: GetNumAnimationFrames
functions.description: Returns the number of animation frames in this texture.

returnValues.description: The number of animation frames in this texture.

functions.name: Height
functions.description: Returns the modified height of the texture, this value may be affected by mipmapping and other factors.

returnValues.description: height

functions.name: IsError
functions.description:
Returns whenever the texture is valid. (i.e. was loaded successfully or not)

<note>The "error" texture is a valid texture, and therefore this function will return false when used on it. Use <page>ITexture:IsErrorTexture</page>, instead.</note>

returnValues.description: Whether the texture was loaded successfully or not.

functions.name: IsErrorTexture
functions.description: Returns whenever the texture is the error texture (pink and black checkerboard pattern).

returnValues.description: Whether the texture is the error texture or not.

functions.name: Width
functions.description: Returns the modified width of the texture, this value may be affected by mipmapping and other factors.

returnValues.description: width

name: IVideoWriter
description: This is returned from <page>video.Record</page>.

functions.name: AddFrame
functions.description: Adds the current framebuffer to the video stream.

arguments.name: frameTime
arguments.description: Usually set to what <page>Global.FrameTime</page> is, or simply 1/fps.

arguments.name: downsample
arguments.description: If true it will downsample the whole screenspace to the videos width and height, otherwise it will just record from the top left corner to the given width and height and therefor not the whole screen.

functions.name: Finish
functions.description: Ends the video recording and dumps it to disk.

functions.name: Height
functions.description: Returns the height of the video stream.

returnValues.description: height

functions.name: SetRecordSound
functions.description: Sets whether to record sound or not.

arguments.name: record
arguments.description: Record.

functions.name: Width
functions.description: Returns the width of the video stream.

returnValues.description: width

name: MarkupObject
description: Object containing parsed markup for later rendering. Created by <page>markup.Parse</page>.

functions.name: Draw
functions.description: Draws the computed markupobject to the screen. See <page>markup.Parse</page>.

arguments.name: xOffset
arguments.description: The X coordinate on the screen.

arguments.name: yOffset
arguments.description: The Y coordinate on the screen.

arguments.name: xAlign
arguments.description: The alignment of the x coordinate within the text using <page>Enums/TEXT_ALIGN</page>

arguments.name: yAlign
arguments.description: The alignment of the y coordinate within the text using <page>Enums/TEXT_ALIGN</page>

arguments.name: alphaoverride
arguments.description: Sets the alpha of all drawn objects to this value.

arguments.name: textAlign
arguments.description: The alignment of the text horizontally using <page>Enums/TEXT_ALIGN</page>

functions.name: GetHeight
functions.description: Gets computed the height of the markupobject.

returnValues.name: Height
returnValues.description: The computed height.

functions.name: GetMaxWidth
functions.description: Gets maximum width for this markup object as defined in <page>markup.Parse</page>.

returnValues.name: maxWidth
returnValues.description: The max width.

functions.name: GetWidth
functions.description: Gets computed the width of the markupobject.

returnValues.name: Width
returnValues.description: The computed width.

functions.name: Size
functions.description: Gets computed the width and height of the markupobject.

returnValues.description: The computed width.
The computed height.

name: NextBot
description:
NextBots are a new system to create NPCs in the Source Engine, utilizing the more powerful <page>navmesh</page> system for navigation over the old node based system.

This page lists all possible functions usable with NextBots.

See <page>NextBot NPC Creation</page> for more information on how to create NextBot NPCs.

functions.name: BecomeRagdoll
functions.description: Become a ragdoll and remove the entity.

arguments.name: info
arguments.description: Damage info passed from an onkilled event

returnValues.description: The created ragdoll, if any.

functions.name: BodyMoveXY
functions.description:
Should only be called in <page>NEXTBOT:BodyUpdate</page>. This sets the `move_x` and `move_y` pose parameters of the bot to fit how they're currently moving, sets the animation speed (<page>Entity:GetPlaybackRate</page>) to suit the ground speed, and calls <page>Entity:FrameAdvance</page>.

<bug issue="3420">This function might cause crashes with some activities.</bug>

functions.name: ClearLastKnownArea
functions.description: Clears this bot's last known area. See <page>NextBot:GetLastKnownArea</page>.

functions.name: FindSpot
functions.description: Like <page>NextBot:FindSpots</page> but only returns a vector.

arguments.name: type
arguments.description: Either `"random"`, `"near"`, `"far"`.

arguments.name: options
arguments.description:
This table should contain the search info.
* <page>string</page> type - The type (Only `hiding` for now)
* <page>Vector</page> pos - the position to search.
* <page>number</page> radius - the radius to search.
* <page>number</page> stepup - the highest step to step up.
* <page>number</page> stepdown - the highest we can step down without being hurt.

returnValues.description: If it finds a spot it will return a vector. If not it will return nil.

functions.name: FindSpots
functions.description: Returns a table of hiding spots.

arguments.name: specs
arguments.description:
This table should contain the search info.
* <page>string</page> type - The type (optional, only `hiding` supported)
* <page>Vector</page> pos - the position to search.
* <page>number</page> radius - the radius to search.
* <page>number</page> stepup - the highest step to step up.
* <page>number</page> stepdown - the highest we can step down without being hurt.

returnValues.description:
An unsorted table of tables containing:
* <page>Vector</page> vector - The position of the hiding spot
* <page>number</page> distance - the distance to that position

functions.name: GetActivity
functions.description: Returns the currently running activity

returnValues.description: The current activity

functions.name: GetFOV
functions.description: Returns the Field of View of the Nextbot NPC, used for its vision functionality, such as <page>NextBot:IsAbleToSee</page>.

returnValues.name: fov
returnValues.description: The current FOV of the nextbot

functions.name: GetLastKnownArea
functions.description: Returns this bots last known area. See also <page>NextBot:ClearLastKnownArea</page>.

returnValues.description: The last area the bot is known to have been in.

functions.name: GetMaxVisionRange
functions.description: Returns the maximum range the nextbot can see other nextbots/players at. See <page>NextBot:IsAbleToSee</page>.

returnValues.description: The current vision range

functions.name: GetRangeSquaredTo
functions.description:
Returns squared distance to an entity or a position.

See also <page>NextBot:GetRangeTo</page>.

arguments.name: to
arguments.description: The position to measure distance to. Can be an entity.

returnValues.description: The squared distance

functions.name: GetRangeTo
functions.description:
Returns the distance to an entity or position.

See also <page>NextBot:GetRangeSquaredTo</page>.

arguments.name: to
arguments.description: The position to measure distance to. Can be an entity.

returnValues.description: The distance

functions.name: GetSolidMask
functions.description: Returns the solid mask for given NextBot.

returnValues.description: The solid mask, see <page>Enums/CONTENTS</page> and <page>Enums/MASK</page>

functions.name: HandleStuck
functions.description:
Called from Lua when the NPC is stuck. This should only be called from the behaviour coroutine - so if you want to override this function and do something special that yields - then go for it.

You should always call self.loco:ClearStuck() in this function to reset the stuck status - so it knows it's unstuck. See <page>CLuaLocomotion:ClearStuck</page>.

functions.name: IsAbleToSee
functions.description:
Returns if the Nextbot NPC can see the give entity or not.

<warning>Using this function creates the nextbot vision interface which will cause a significant performance hit!</warning>

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity to test if we can see

arguments.name: useFOV
arguments.description: Whether to use the Field of View of the Nextbot

returnValues.description: If the nextbot can see or not

functions.name: MoveToPos
functions.description: To be called in the behaviour coroutine only! Will yield until the bot has reached the goal or is stuck

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The position we want to get to

arguments.name: options
arguments.description:
A table containing a bunch of tweakable options.
* <page>number</page> lookahead - Minimum look ahead distance.
* <page>number</page> tolerance - How close we must be to the goal before it can be considered complete.
* <page>boolean</page> draw - Draw the path. Only visible on listen servers and single player.
* <page>number</page> maxage - Maximum age of the path before it times out.
* <page>number</page> repath - Rebuilds the path after this number of seconds.

returnValues.description: Either `"failed"`, `"stuck"`, `"timeout"` or `"ok"` - depending on how the NPC got on

functions.name: PlaySequenceAndWait
functions.description: To be called in the behaviour coroutine only! Plays an animation sequence and waits for it to end before returning.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The sequence name

arguments.name: speed
arguments.description: Playback Rate of that sequence

functions.name: SetFOV
functions.description: Sets the Field of View for the Nextbot NPC, used for its vision functionality, such as <page>NextBot:IsAbleToSee</page>.

arguments.name: fov
arguments.description: The new FOV

functions.name: SetMaxVisionRange
functions.description: Sets the maximum range the nextbot can see other nextbots/players at. See <page>NextBot:IsAbleToSee</page>.

arguments.name: range
arguments.description: The new vision range to set.

functions.name: SetSolidMask
functions.description:
Sets the solid mask for given NextBot.

The default solid mask of a NextBot is <page text="MASK_NPCSOLID">Enums/MASK</page>.

arguments.name: mask
arguments.description: The new mask, see <page>Enums/CONTENTS</page> and <page>Enums/MASK</page>

functions.name: StartActivity
functions.description: Start doing an activity (animation)

arguments.name: activity
arguments.description: One of the <page>Enums/ACT</page>

name: NPC
description: This is a list of all methods only available for NPCs. It is also possible to call <page>Entity</page> functions on NPCs.

functions.name: AddEntityRelationship
functions.description:
Makes the NPC like, hate, feel neutral towards, or fear the entity in question. If you want to setup relationship towards a certain entity `class`, use <page>NPC:AddRelationship</page>.

<note>NPCs do not see <page>NextBot</page>s by default. This can be fixed by adding the <page text="FL_OBJECT">Enums/FL</page> flag to the NextBot.</note>

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: The entity for the relationship to be applied to.

arguments.name: disposition
arguments.description: A <page>Enums/D</page> representing the relationship type.

arguments.name: priority
arguments.description: How strong the relationship is. Higher values mean higher priority over relationships with lower priority.

functions.name: AddRelationship
functions.description:
Changes how an NPC feels towards another NPC.  If you want to setup relationship towards a certain `entity`, use <page>NPC:AddEntityRelationship</page>.

<warning>Avoid using this in <page>GM:OnEntityCreated</page> to prevent crashing due to infinite loops. This function may create an entity with given class and delete it immediately after.</warning>

arguments.name: relationstring
arguments.description:
A string representing how the relationship should be set up.
Should be formatted as `"npc_class `<page>Enums/D</page>` numberPriority"`.

functions.name: AdvancePath
functions.description: Advances the NPC on its path to the next waypoint.

functions.name: AlertSound
functions.description: Force an NPC to play their Alert sound.

functions.name: AutoMovement
functions.description: Executes any movement the current sequence may have.

arguments.name: interval
arguments.description: This is a good place to use <page>Entity:GetAnimTimeInterval</page>.

returnValues.description: `true` if any movement was performed.

functions.name: CapabilitiesAdd
functions.description: Adds a capability to the NPC.

arguments.name: capabilities
arguments.description: Capabilities to add, see <page>Enums/CAP</page>.

functions.name: CapabilitiesClear
functions.description: Removes all of Capabilities the NPC has.

functions.name: CapabilitiesGet
functions.description: Returns the NPC's capabilities along the ones defined on its weapon.

returnValues.description:
The capabilities as a bitflag.
See <page>Enums/CAP</page>

functions.name: CapabilitiesRemove
functions.description: Remove a certain capability.

arguments.name: capabilities
arguments.description: Capabilities to remove, see <page>Enums/CAP</page>

functions.name: Classify
functions.description: Returns the NPC class. Do not confuse with <page>Entity:GetClass</page>!

returnValues.description: See <page>Enums/CLASS</page>

functions.name: ClearBlockingEntity
functions.description: Resets the <page>NPC:GetBlockingEntity</page>.

functions.name: ClearCondition
functions.description: Clears out the specified <page>Enums/COND</page> on this NPC.

arguments.name: condition
arguments.description: The <page>Enums/COND</page> to clear out.

functions.name: ClearEnemyMemory
functions.description: Clears the Enemy from the NPC's memory, effectively forgetting it until met again with either the NPC vision or with <page>NPC:UpdateEnemyMemory</page>.

arguments.name: enemy
arguments.description: The enemy to mark

functions.name: ClearExpression
functions.description: Clears the NPC's current expression which can be set with <page>NPC:SetExpression</page>.

functions.name: ClearGoal
functions.description: Clears the current NPC goal or target.

functions.name: ClearSchedule
functions.description: Stops the current schedule that the NPC is doing.

functions.name: ConditionName
functions.description: Translates condition ID to a string.

arguments.name: cond
arguments.description: The NPCs condition ID, see <page>Enums/COND</page>

returnValues.description: A human understandable string equivalent of that condition.

functions.name: Disposition
functions.description:
Returns the way the NPC "feels" about a given entity. See <page>NPC:AddEntityRelationship</page>.

<note>For `ai` type entities, this will return <page>ENTITY:GetRelationship</page>. If it returns `nil` or for engine NPCs, this will return whatever was last set by <page>NPC:AddEntityRelationship</page>. As a last resort, engine will decide on the disposition based on this NPC's <page>NPC:Classify</page>. </note>

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity to test our disposition towards.

returnValues.description: The NPCs disposition, see <page>Enums/D</page>.
The NPCs disposition priority.

functions.name: DropWeapon
functions.description: Forces the NPC to drop the specified weapon.

arguments.name: weapon
arguments.description: Weapon to be dropped. If unset, will default to the currently equipped weapon.

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: If set, launches the weapon at given position. There is a limit to how far it is willing to throw the weapon. Overrides velocity argument.

arguments.name: velocity
arguments.description: If set and previous argument is unset, launches the weapon with given velocity. If the velocity is higher than 400, it will be clamped to 400.

functions.name: ExitScriptedSequence
functions.description: Makes an NPC exit a scripted sequence, if one is playing.

functions.name: FearSound
functions.description: Force an NPC to play its Fear sound.

functions.name: FoundEnemySound
functions.description: Force an NPC to play its FoundEnemy sound.

functions.name: GetActiveWeapon
functions.description: Returns the weapon the NPC is currently carrying, or <page text="NULL">Global_Variables</page>.

returnValues.description: The NPCs current weapon

functions.name: GetActivity
functions.description: Returns the NPC's current activity.

returnValues.description: Current activity, see <page>Enums/ACT</page>.

functions.name: GetAimVector
functions.description: Returns the aim vector of the NPC. NPC alternative of <page>Player:GetAimVector</page>.

returnValues.description: The aim direction of the NPC.

functions.name: GetArrivalActivity
functions.description: Returns the activity to be played when the NPC arrives at its goal

returnValues.description: The arrival activity. See <page>Enums/ACT</page>.

functions.name: GetArrivalDirection
functions.description: Returns the direction from the NPC origin to its current navigational destination.

returnValues.description: The arrival direction.

functions.name: GetArrivalDistance
functions.description: Returns NPC arrival distance, set by <page>NPC:SetArrivalDistance</page>.

returnValues.name: dist
returnValues.description: The current arrival distance.

functions.name: GetArrivalSequence
functions.description: Returns the sequence to be played when the NPC arrives at its goal.

returnValues.description: Sequence ID to be played, or -1 if there's no sequence.

functions.name: GetArrivalSpeed
functions.description: Returns NPC arrival speed, set by <page>NPC:SetArrivalSpeed</page>.

returnValues.name: speed
returnValues.description: The current arrival peed.

functions.name: GetBestSoundHint
functions.description: Returns the most dangerous/closest sound hint based on the NPCs location and the types of sounds it can sense.

arguments.name: types
arguments.description: The types of sounds to choose from. See <page text="SOUND_ enums">Enums/SOUND</page>

returnValues.description: A table with <page text="SoundHintData">Structures/SoundHintData</page> structure or `nil` if no sound hints are nearby.

functions.name: GetBlockingEntity
functions.description: Returns the entity blocking the NPC along its path.

returnValues.description: Blocking entity

functions.name: GetCurGoalType
functions.description: Returns the goal type for current navigation path.

returnValues.description: The goal type. See <page>Enums/GOALTYPE</page>.

functions.name: GetCurrentSchedule
functions.description: Returns the NPC's current schedule.

returnValues.description: The NPCs schedule, see <page>Enums/SCHED</page> or -1 if we failed for some reason

functions.name: GetCurrentWeaponProficiency
functions.description: Returns how proficient (skilled) an NPC is with its current weapon.

returnValues.description: NPC's proficiency for current weapon. See <page>Enums/WEAPON_PROFICIENCY</page>.

functions.name: GetCurWaypointPos
functions.description: Gets the NPC's current waypoint position (where NPC is currently moving towards), if any is available.

returnValues.description: The position of the current NPC waypoint.

functions.name: GetEnemy
functions.description:
Returns the entity that this NPC is trying to fight.

<bug issue="3132">This returns nil if the NPC has no enemy. You should use <page>Global.IsValid</page> (which accounts for nil and NULL) on the return to verify validity of the enemy.</bug>

returnValues.description: Enemy NPC.

functions.name: GetEnemyFirstTimeSeen
functions.description: Returns the first time an NPC's enemy was seen by the NPC.

arguments.name: enemy
arguments.description: The enemy to check.

returnValues.name: time
returnValues.description: First time the given enemy was seen.

functions.name: GetEnemyLastKnownPos
functions.description:
Returns the last known position of an NPC's enemy.

Similar to <page>NPC:GetEnemyLastSeenPos</page>, but the known position will be a few seconds ahead of the last seen position.

arguments.name: enemy
arguments.description: The enemy to check.

returnValues.name: pos
returnValues.description: The last known position.

functions.name: GetEnemyLastSeenPos
functions.description:
Returns the last seen position of an NPC's enemy.

Similar to <page>NPC:GetEnemyLastKnownPos</page>, but the known position will be a few seconds ahead of the last seen position.

arguments.name: enemy
arguments.description: The enemy to check.

returnValues.name: pos
returnValues.description: The last seen position.

functions.name: GetEnemyLastTimeSeen
functions.description: Returns the last time an NPC's enemy was seen by the NPC.

arguments.name: enemy
arguments.description: The enemy to check.

returnValues.name: time
returnValues.description: Last time the given enemy was seen.

functions.name: GetExpression
functions.description: Returns the expression file the NPC is currently playing.

returnValues.description: The file path of the expression.

functions.name: GetFOV
functions.description: Returns the Field Of View of the NPC. See <page>NPC:SetFOV</page>.

returnValues.name: fov
returnValues.description: The FOV for the NPC in degrees.

functions.name: GetGoalPos
functions.description: Returns the position we are trying to reach, if any.

returnValues.description: The position we are trying to reach.

functions.name: GetGoalTarget
functions.description: Returns the entity we are trying to reach, if any.

returnValues.description: The entity we are trying to reach, or `NULL`.

functions.name: GetHullType
functions.description: Returns NPCs hull type set by <page>NPC:SetHullType</page>.

returnValues.description: Hull type, see <page>Enums/HULL</page>

functions.name: GetIdealActivity
functions.description: Returns the ideal activity the NPC currently wants to achieve.

returnValues.description: The ideal activity. <page>Enums/ACT</page>.

functions.name: GetIdealMoveAcceleration
functions.description: Returns the ideal move acceleration of the NPC.

returnValues.description: The ideal move acceleration.

functions.name: GetIdealMoveSpeed
functions.description: Returns the ideal move speed of the NPC.

returnValues.description: The ideal move speed.

functions.name: GetIdealSequence
functions.description: Returns the ideal sequence the NPC currently wants to achieve.

returnValues.description: The ideal sequence, specific to the NPCs model.

functions.name: GetIdealYaw
functions.description: Returns the ideal yaw (left right rotation) for this NPC at this moment.

returnValues.description: The ideal yaw.

functions.name: GetKnownEnemies
functions.description:
Returns all known enemies this NPC has.

See also <page>NPC:GetKnownEnemyCount</page>

returnValues.description: Table of entities that this NPC knows as enemies.

functions.name: GetKnownEnemyCount
functions.description:
Returns known enemy count of this NPC.

See also <page>NPC:GetKnownEnemies</page>

returnValues.description: Amount of entities that this NPC knows as enemies.

functions.name: GetLastPosition
functions.description:
Returns the last registered or memorized position of the NPC. When using scheduling, the NPC will focus on navigating to the last position via nodes.

See <page>NPC:SetLastPosition</page>.

returnValues.name: position
returnValues.description: Where the NPC's last position was set to.

functions.name: GetLastTimeTookDamageFromEnemy
functions.description: Returns <page>Global.CurTime</page> based time since this NPC last received damage from given enemy. The last damage time is set when <page>NPC:MarkTookDamageFromEnemy</page> is called.

arguments.name: enemy
arguments.description: The enemy to test. Defaults to currently active enemy (<page>NPC:GetEnemy</page>)

returnValues.description: Time since this NPC last received damage from given enemy.

functions.name: GetMaxLookDistance
functions.description: Returns NPCs max view distance. An NPC will not be able to see enemies outside of this distance.

returnValues.name: dist
returnValues.description: The maximum distance the NPC can see at.

functions.name: GetMinMoveCheckDist
functions.description: Returns how far should the NPC look ahead in its route.

returnValues.description: How far the NPC checks ahead of its route.

functions.name: GetMinMoveStopDist
functions.description: Returns how far before the NPC can come to a complete stop.

arguments.name: minResult
arguments.description: The minimum value that will be returned by this function.

returnValues.description: The minimum stop distance.

functions.name: GetMoveDelay
functions.description:
Returns the movement delay for given NPC.

See <page>NPC:SetMoveDelay</page>.

returnValues.description: The movement delay.

functions.name: GetMoveInterval
functions.description: Returns the current timestep the internal NPC motor is working on.

returnValues.description: The current timestep.

functions.name: GetMovementActivity
functions.description: Returns the NPC's current movement activity.

returnValues.description: Current NPC movement activity, see <page>Enums/ACT</page>.

functions.name: GetMovementSequence
functions.description: Returns the index of the sequence the NPC uses to move.

returnValues.description: The movement sequence index

functions.name: GetMoveVelocity
functions.description: Returns the current move velocity of the NPC.

returnValues.description: The current move velocity of the NPC.

functions.name: GetNavType
functions.description: Returns the NPC's navigation type.

returnValues.description: The nav type. See <page>Enums/NAV</page>.

functions.name: GetNearestSquadMember
functions.description: Returns the nearest member of the squad the NPC is in.

returnValues.name: nearest_member
returnValues.description: The nearest member of the squad the NPC is in.

functions.name: GetNextWaypointPos
functions.description: Gets the NPC's next waypoint position, where NPC will be moving after reaching current waypoint, if any is available.

returnValues.description: The position of the next NPC waypoint.

functions.name: GetNPCState
functions.description: Returns the NPC's state.

returnValues.description: The NPC's current state, see <page>Enums/NPC_STATE</page>.

functions.name: GetPathDistanceToGoal
functions.description: Returns the distance the NPC is from Target Goal.

returnValues.description: The number of hammer units the NPC is away from the Goal.

functions.name: GetPathTimeToGoal
functions.description: Returns the amount of time it will take for the NPC to get to its Target Goal.

returnValues.description: The amount of time to get to the target goal.

functions.name: GetShootPos
functions.description:
Returns the shooting position of the NPC, i.e. where their bullets would come from, etc.

If the NPC does not overwrite this, it will return <page>Entity:GetPos</page>.

returnValues.description: The NPC's shooting position.

functions.name: GetSquad
functions.description: Returns the current squad name of the NPC, as set via <page>NPC:SetSquad</page>.

returnValues.name: name
returnValues.description: The new squad name to set.

functions.name: GetStepHeight
functions.description: Returns NPC step height.

returnValues.name: height
returnValues.description: The current step height.

functions.name: GetTarget
functions.description:
Returns the NPC's current target set by <page>NPC:SetTarget</page>.

<bug issue="3132">This returns nil if the NPC has no target. You should use <page>Global.IsValid</page> (which accounts for nil and NULL) on the return to verify validity of the target.</bug>

returnValues.description: Target entity

functions.name: GetTaskStatus
functions.description: Returns the status of the current task.

returnValues.description: The status. See <page>Enums/TASKSTATUS</page>.

functions.name: GetTimeEnemyLastReacquired
functions.description: Returns <page>Global.CurTime</page> based time since the enemy was reacquired, meaning it is currently in Line of Sight of the NPC.

arguments.name: enemy
arguments.description: The enemy to test. Defaults to currently active enemy (<page>NPC:GetEnemy</page>)

returnValues.description: Time enemy was last reacquired.

functions.name: GetViewOffset
functions.description: Returns the view offset of the NPC. Set by <page>NPC:SetViewOffset</page>.

returnValues.description: The view offset of the NPC.

functions.name: GetWeapon
functions.description: Returns a specific weapon the NPC owns.

arguments.name: class
arguments.description: A classname of the weapon to try to get.

returnValues.name: wep
returnValues.description: The weapon for the specified class, or NULL of the NPC doesn't have given weapon.

functions.name: GetWeapons
functions.description: Returns a table of the NPC's weapons.

returnValues.description: A list of the weapons the NPC currently has.

functions.name: Give
functions.description: Used to give a weapon to an already spawned NPC.

arguments.name: weapon
arguments.description: Class name of the weapon to equip to the NPC.

returnValues.description: The weapon entity given to the NPC.

functions.name: HasCondition
functions.description: Returns whether or not the NPC has the given condition.

arguments.name: condition
arguments.description: The condition index, see <page>Enums/COND</page>.

returnValues.description: True if the NPC has the given condition, false otherwise.

functions.name: HasEnemyEluded
functions.description: Polls the enemy memory to check if the given entity has eluded us or not.

arguments.name: enemy
arguments.description: The enemy to test.

returnValues.name: eluded
returnValues.description: If the enemy has eluded us.

functions.name: HasEnemyMemory
functions.description: Polls the enemy memory to check if the NPC has any memory of given enemy.

arguments.name: enemy
arguments.description: The entity to test.

returnValues.name: eluded
returnValues.description: If we have any memory on given enemy.

functions.name: HasObstacles
functions.description: Returns true if the current navigation has an obstacle, this is different from <page>NPC:GetBlockingEntity</page>, this is for virtual navigation obstacles put by AI's local navigation system to prevent movement to the marked area, forcing NPC to steer around, [for example](https://github.com/ValveSoftware/source-sdk-2013/blob/master/mp/src/game/server/hl2/npc_playercompanion.cpp#L2897).

returnValues.description: `true` if the current navigation has an obstacle.

functions.name: IdleSound
functions.description: Force an NPC to play their Idle sound.

functions.name: IgnoreEnemyUntil
functions.description: Makes the NPC ignore given entity/enemy until given time.

arguments.name: enemy
arguments.description: The enemy to ignore.

arguments.name: until
arguments.description: How long to ignore the enemy for. This will be compared to <page>Global.CurTime</page>, so your value should be based on it.

functions.name: IsCurrentSchedule
functions.description: Returns whether or not the NPC is performing the given schedule.

arguments.name: schedule
arguments.description: The schedule number, see <page>Enums/SCHED</page>.

returnValues.description: True if the NPC is performing the given schedule, false otherwise.

functions.name: IsCurWaypointGoal
functions.description: Returns whether the current navigational waypoint is the final one.

returnValues.description: Whether the current navigational waypoint is the final one.

functions.name: IsFacingIdealYaw
functions.description: Returns whether the NPC is facing their ideal yaw. See <page>NPC:SetIdealYaw</page>, <page>NPC:GetIdealYaw</page> and <page>NPC:SetIdealYawAndUpdate</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether the NPC is facing their ideal yaw.

functions.name: IsGoalActive
functions.description: Returns whether the NPC has an active goal.

returnValues.name: act
returnValues.description: Whether the NPC has an active goal or not.

functions.name: IsInViewCone
functions.description: Tests whether a position or an NPC is in the view cone of the NPC.

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: The position to test.

returnValues.description: If the given position is in the view cone.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity to test. Will use the entity's position.

returnValues.description: If the given position is in the view cone.

functions.name: IsMoveYawLocked
functions.description: Returns if the current movement is locked on the Yaw axis.

returnValues.description: Whether the movement is yaw locked or not.

functions.name: IsMoving
functions.description: Returns whether the NPC is moving or not.

returnValues.description: Whether the NPC is moving or not.

functions.name: IsRunningBehavior
functions.description: Checks if the NPC is running an **ai_goal**. ( e.g. An npc_citizen NPC following the Player. )

returnValues.description: Returns true if running an ai_goal, otherwise returns false.

functions.name: IsSquadLeader

name: Panel
description:
This is the base panel for every other [VGUI](vgui) panel.

It contains all of the basic methods, some of which may only work on certain VGUI elements. See also <page>Panel Hooks</page>.

As their functionality is provided at the game's C/C++ level rather than by its Lua script extension, they are unfortunately unavailable for most practical purposes, however, they can still be obtained in a way similar to that provided by the <page>baseclass</page> library:

```
-- Create a new panel type NewPanel that inherits all of its functionality from DLabel,
-- but has a different SetText method than DLabel does - all without the hassle of that
-- old DLabel's default text getting in the way. Fun stuff.

local PANEL = {}

function PANEL:Init()

self:SetText_Base( "" )
self:SetText( "Time for something different!" )

end

function PANEL:Paint( aWide, aTall )

local TextX, TextY = 0, 0
local TextColor = Color( 255, 0, 0, 255 )

surface.SetFont( self:GetFont() or "default" )
surface.SetTextColor( TextColor )
surface.SetTextPos( TextX, TextY )
surface.DrawText( self:GetText() )

end

-- And here we go:
PANEL.SetText_Base = FindMetaTable( "Panel" ).SetText

function PANEL:SetText( aText )

self.Text = tostring( aText )

end

function PANEL:GetText()

return self.Text or ""

end

vgui.Register( "NewPanel", PANEL, "DLabel" )
```

functions.name: ConVarNumberThink
functions.description:
A think hook for <page>Panel</page>s using ConVars as a value. Call it in the Think hook. Sets the panel's value should the convar change.

This function is best for: checkboxes, sliders, number wangs

For a string alternative, see <page>Panel:ConVarStringThink</page>.

<note>Make sure your Panel has a SetValue function, else you may get errors.</note>

functions.name: ConVarStringThink
functions.description:
A think hook for <page text="panels">Panel</page> using ConVars as a value. Call it in the Think hook. Sets the panel's value should the convar change.

This function is best for: text inputs, read-only inputs, dropdown selects

For a number alternative, see <page>Panel:ConVarNumberThink</page>.

<note>Make sure your Panel has a SetValue function, else you may get errors.</note>

functions.name: CopyBase
functions.description: Gets the size, position and dock state of the passed panel object, and applies it to this one.

arguments.name: srcPanel
arguments.description: The panel to copy the boundary and dock settings from.

functions.name: CopyBounds
functions.description: Copies position and size of the panel.

arguments.name: base
arguments.description: The panel to copy size and position from.

functions.name: CopyHeight
functions.description: Copies the height of the panel.

arguments.name: base
arguments.description: Panel to copy the height from.

functions.name: CopyPos
functions.description: Copies the position of the panel.

arguments.name: base
arguments.description: Panel to position the width from.

functions.name: CopySelected
functions.description: Performs the <key>CONTROL</key> + <key>C</key> key combination effect ( Copy selection to clipboard ) on selected text in a <page>TextEntry</page> or <page>RichText</page> based element.

functions.name: CopyWidth
functions.description: Copies the width of the panel.

arguments.name: base
arguments.description: Panel to copy the width from.

functions.name: CursorPos
functions.description:
Returns the cursor position relative to the top left of the panel.

This is equivalent to calling <page>gui.MousePos</page> and then <page>Panel:ScreenToLocal</page>.

<warning>This function uses a cached value for the screen position of the panel, computed at the end of the last VGUI Think/Layout pass.

ie. inaccurate results may be returned if the panel or any of its ancestors have been repositioned outside of <page>PANEL:Think</page> or <page>PANEL:PerformLayout</page> within the last frame.</warning>

returnValues.description: X coordinate of the cursor, relative to the top left of the panel.
Y coordinate of the cursor, relative to the top left of the panel.

functions.name: CutSelected
functions.description: Performs the <key>CONTROL</key> + <key>X</key> (delete text and copy it to clipboard buffer) action on selected text in a <page>TextEntry</page> or <page>RichText</page> based element.

functions.name: DeleteCookie
functions.description: Deletes a cookie value using the panel's cookie name ( <page>Panel:GetCookieName</page> ) and the passed extension.

arguments.name: cookieName
arguments.description: The unique cookie name to delete.

functions.name: DisableLerp
functions.description:
Resets the panel object's <page>Panel:SetPos</page> method and removes its animation table (`Panel.LerpAnim`). This effectively undoes the changes made by <page>Panel:LerpPositions</page>.

In order to use Lerp animation again, you must call <page>Panel:Stop</page> before setting its `SetPosReal` property to `nil`. See the example below.

functions.name: Distance
functions.description: Returns the linear distance from the center of this panel object and another. **Both panels must have the same parent for this function to work properly.**

arguments.name: tgtPanel
arguments.description: The target object with which to compare position.

returnValues.description: The linear (straight-line) distance between the center of the two objects.

functions.name: DistanceFrom
functions.description: Returns the distance between the center of this panel object and a specified point **local to the parent panel**.

arguments.name: posX
arguments.description: The horizontal (x) position in pixels of the point to compare with. Local to the parent panel, or container, not the panel the function is called on.

arguments.name: posY
arguments.description: The vertical (y) position in pixels of the point to compare with. Local to the parent panel, or container, not the panel the function is called on.

returnValues.description: The linear (straight-line) distance between the specified point local to parent panel and the center of this panel object.

functions.name: Dock
functions.description:
Sets the dock type for the panel, making the panel "dock" in a certain direction, modifying it's position and size.

You can set the inner spacing of a panel's docking using <page>Panel:DockPadding</page>, which will affect docked child panels, and you can set the outer spacing of a panel's docking using <page>Panel:DockMargin</page>, which affects how docked siblings are positioned/sized.

You may need to use <page>Panel:SetZPos</page> to ensure child panels (<page>DTextEntry</page>) stay in a specific order.

<note>After using this function, if you want to get the correct panel's bounds (position, size), use <page>Panel:InvalidateParent</page> (use `true` as argument if you need to update immediately)</note>

arguments.name: dockType
arguments.description: Dock type using <page>Enums/DOCK</page>.

functions.name: DockMargin
functions.description:
Sets the dock margin of the panel.

The dock margin is the extra space that will be left around the edge when this element is docked inside its parent element.

arguments.name: marginLeft
arguments.description: The left margin to the parent.

arguments.name: marginTop
arguments.description: The top margin to the parent.

arguments.name: marginRight
arguments.description: The right margin to the parent.

arguments.name: marginBottom
arguments.description: The bottom margin to the parent.

functions.name: DockPadding
functions.description:
Sets the dock padding of the panel.

The dock padding is the extra space that will be left around the edge when child elements are docked inside this element.

arguments.name: paddingLeft
arguments.description: The left padding to the parent.

arguments.name: paddingTop
arguments.description: The top padding to the parent.

arguments.name: paddingRight
arguments.description: The right padding to the parent.

arguments.name: paddingBottom
arguments.description: The bottom padding to the parent.

functions.name: DoModal
functions.description:
Makes the panel "lock" the screen until it is removed. All input will be directed to the given panel.

It will silently fail if used while cursor is not visible.
Call <page>Panel:MakePopup</page> before calling this function.
This must be called on a panel derived from <page>EditablePanel</page>.

functions.name: DragClick
functions.description: <internal></internal> Called by <page>Panel:DragMouseRelease</page> when a user clicks one mouse button whilst dragging with another.

returnValues.description: Always returns `true`.

functions.name: DragHover
functions.description: <internal></internal> Called by <page>dragndrop.HoverThink</page> to perform actions on an object that is dragged and hovered over another.

arguments.name: HoverTime
arguments.description: If this time is greater than 0.1, <page>PANEL:DragHoverClick</page> is called, passing it as an argument.

functions.name: DragHoverEnd
functions.description: <internal></internal> Called to end a drag and hover action. This resets the panel's <page>PANEL:PaintOver</page> method, and is primarily used by <page>dragndrop.StopDragging</page>.

functions.name: DragMousePress
functions.description: Called to inform the <page>dragndrop</page> that a mouse button is being held down on a panel object.

arguments.name: mouseCode
arguments.description: The code for the mouse button pressed, passed by, for example, <page>PANEL:OnMousePressed</page>. See the <page>Enums/MOUSE</page>.

functions.name: DragMouseRelease
functions.description: Called to inform the <page>dragndrop</page> that a mouse button has been depressed on a panel object.

arguments.name: mouseCode
arguments.description: The code for the mouse button pressed, passed by, for example, <page>PANEL:OnMouseReleased</page>. See the <page>Enums/MOUSE</page>.

returnValues.description: `true` if an object was being dragged, otherwise `false`.

functions.name: DrawDragHover
functions.description: <internal></internal> Called to draw the drop target when an object is being dragged across another. See <page>Panel:SetDropTarget</page>.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The x coordinate of the top-left corner of the drop area.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The y coordinate of the top-left corner of the drop area.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The width of the drop area.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: The height of the drop area.

functions.name: DrawFilledRect
functions.description:
Draws a coloured rectangle to fill the panel object this method is called on. The colour is set using <page>surface.SetDrawColor</page>. This should only be called within the object's <page>PANEL:Paint</page> or <page>PANEL:PaintOver</page> hooks, as a shortcut for <page>surface.DrawRect</page>.


<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>

functions.name: DrawOutlinedRect
functions.description:
Draws a hollow rectangle the size of the panel object this method is called on, with a border width of 1 px. The border colour is set using <page>surface.SetDrawColor</page>. This should only be called within the object's <page>PANEL:Paint</page> or <page>PANEL:PaintOver</page> hooks, as a shortcut for <page>surface.DrawOutlinedRect</page>.


<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>

functions.name: DrawSelections
functions.description: Used to draw the magenta highlight colour of a panel object when it is selected. This should be called in the object's <page>PANEL:PaintOver</page> hook. Once this is implemented, the highlight colour will be displayed only when the object is selectable and selected. This is achieved using <page>Panel:SetSelectable</page> and <page>Panel:SetSelected</page> respectively.

functions.name: DrawTextEntryText
functions.description:
Used to draw the text in a <page>DTextEntry</page> within a derma skin. This is usually called within the <page>SKIN:PaintTextEntry</page> skin hook.
<note>Will silently fail if any of arguments are not given.</note>

<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: textCol
arguments.description: The colour of the main text.

arguments.name: highlightCol
arguments.description: The colour of the selection highlight (when selecting text).

arguments.name: cursorCol
arguments.description: The colour of the text cursor (or caret).

functions.name: DrawTexturedRect
functions.description:
Draws a textured rectangle to fill the panel object this method is called on. The texture is set using <page>surface.SetTexture</page> or <page>surface.SetMaterial</page>. This should only be called within the object's <page>PANEL:Paint</page> or <page>PANEL:PaintOver</page> hooks, as a shortcut for <page>surface.DrawTexturedRect</page>.


<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>

functions.name: Droppable
functions.description:
Makes this panel droppable. This is used with <page>Panel:Receiver</page> to create drag and drop events.

Can be called multiple times with different names allowing to be dropped onto different receivers.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of your droppable panel

returnValues.description: Blank table stored on the panel itself under pnl.m_DragSlot[ name ]. Is reset every time this function is called and does not appear to be used or exposed anywhere else.

functions.name: EndBoxSelection
functions.description: Completes a box selection. If the end point of the selection box is within the selection canvas, mouse capture is disabled for the panel object, and the selected state of each child object within the selection box is toggled.

returnValues.description: Whether the end point of the selection box was within the selection canvas.

functions.name: Exec
functions.description: <internal></internal> Used to run commands within a <page>DHTML</page> window.

arguments.name: cmd
arguments.description: The command to be run.

functions.name: Find
functions.description: Finds a panel in its children(and sub children) with the given name.

arguments.name: panelName
arguments.description: The name of the panel that should be found.

returnValues.description: foundPanel

functions.name: FocusNext
functions.description: Focuses the next panel in the focus queue.

functions.name: FocusPrevious
functions.description: Focuses the previous panel in the focus queue.

functions.name: GetAlpha
functions.description: Returns the alpha multiplier for this panel.

returnValues.description: alphaMul

functions.name: GetBGColor
functions.description:
Returns the background color of a panel such as a <page>RichText</page>, <page>Label</page> or <page>DColorCube</page>.

<note>This doesn't apply to all VGUI elements and its function varies between them</note>

returnValues.name: color
returnValues.description: The <page>Color</page> structure

functions.name: GetBounds
functions.description:
Returns the position and size of the panel.

This is equivalent to calling <page>Panel:GetPos</page> and <page>Panel:GetSize</page> together.

returnValues.description: The x coordinate of the panel, relative to its parent's top left.
The y coordinate of the panel, relative to its parent's top left.
The width of the panel.
The height of the panel.

functions.name: GetCaretPos
functions.description: Returns the position/offset of the caret (or text cursor) in a text-based panel object.

returnValues.description: The caret position/offset from the start of the text. A value of `0` means the caret sits before the first character.

functions.name: GetChild
functions.description: Gets a child by its index. For use with <page>Panel:ChildCount</page>.

arguments.name: childIndex
arguments.description:
The index of the child to get.

<note>This index starts at 0, except when you use this on a <page>DMenu</page>.</note>

functions.name: GetChildPosition
functions.description: Gets a child object's position relative to this panel object. The number of levels is not relevant; the child may have many parents between itself and the object on which the method is called.

arguments.name: pnl
arguments.description: The panel to get the position of.

returnValues.description: The horizontal (x) position of the child relative to this panel object.
The vertical (y) position of the child relative to this panel object.

functions.name: GetChildren
functions.description: Returns a table with all the child panels of the panel.

returnValues.description: All direct children of this panel.

functions.name: GetChildrenInRect
functions.description: Returns a table of all visible, selectable children of the panel object that lie at least partially within the specified rectangle.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The horizontal (x) position of the top-left corner of the rectangle, relative to the panel object.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The vertical (y) position of the top-left corner of the rectangle, relative to the panel object.

arguments.name: w
arguments.description: The width of the rectangle.

arguments.name: h
arguments.description: The height of the rectangle.

returnValues.description: A table of panel objects that lie at least partially within the specified rectangle.

functions.name: GetClassName
functions.description: Returns the class name of the panel. This would be the class name of the base engine-level panel, not Lua classname. The latter is stored usually in <page>Panel:GetName</page>.

returnValues.description: The panel's class name.

functions.name: GetClosestChild
functions.description: Returns the child of this panel object that is closest to the specified point. The point is relative to the object on which the method is called. The distance the child is from this point is also returned.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The horizontal (x) position of the point.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The vertical (y) position of the point.

returnValues.description: The child object that was closest to the specified point.
The distance that this child was from the point.

functions.name: GetContentSize
functions.description:
Gets the size of the content/children within a panel object.

Only works with <page>Label</page> derived panels by default such as <page>DLabel</page>.


Will also work on any panel that manually implements this method.

returnValues.description: The content width of the object.
The content height of the object.

functions.name: GetCookie
functions.description:
Gets the value of a cookie stored by the panel object. This can also be done with <page>cookie.GetString</page>, using the panel's cookie name, a fullstop, and then the actual name of the cookie.

Make sure the panel's cookie name has not changed since writing, or the cookie will not be accessible. This can be done with <page>Panel:GetCookieName</page> and <page>Panel:SetCookieName</page>.

arguments.name: cookieName
arguments.description: The name of the cookie from which to retrieve the value.

arguments.name: default
arguments.description: The default value to return if the cookie does not exist.

returnValues.description: The value of the stored cookie, or the default value should the cookie not exist.

functions.name: GetCookieName
functions.description: Gets the name the panel uses to store cookies. This is set with <page>Panel:SetCookieName</page>.

returnValues.description:
The name the panel uses when reading or writing cookies. The format used is as follows:
```
panelCookieName.individualCookieName
```

functions.name: GetCookieNumber
functions.description:
Gets the value of a cookie stored by the panel object, as a number. This can also be done with <page>cookie.GetNumber</page>, using the panel's cookie name, a fullstop, and then the actual name of the cookie.

Make sure the panel's cookie name has not changed since writing, or the cookie will not be accessible. This can be done with <page>Panel:GetCookieName</page> and <page>Panel:SetCookieName</page>.

arguments.name: cookieName
arguments.description: The name of the cookie from which to retrieve the value.

arguments.name: default
arguments.description: The default value to return if the cookie does not exist.

returnValues.description: The number value of the stored cookie, or the default value should the cookie not exist.

functions.name: GetDock
functions.description: Returns a dock enum for the panel's current docking type.

returnValues.description: The dock enum for the panel. See <page>Enums/DOCK</page>.

functions.name: GetDockMargin
functions.description: Returns the docked margins of the panel. (set by <page>Panel:DockMargin</page>)

returnValues.description: Left margin.
Top margin.
Right margin.
Bottom margin.

functions.name: GetDockPadding
functions.description: Returns the docked padding of the panel. (set by <page>Panel:DockPadding</page>)

returnValues.description: Left padding.
Top padding.
Right padding.
Bottom padding.

functions.name: GetFGColor
functions.description:
Returns the foreground color of the panel.

For a <page>Label</page> or <page>RichText</page>, this is the color of its text.

<note>This doesn't apply to all VGUI elements (such as <page>DLabel</page>) and its function varies between them</note>

returnValues.name: color
returnValues.description: A color structure. See <page>Color</page>

functions.name: GetFont
functions.description:
Returns the name of the font that the panel renders its text with.

This is the same font name set with <page>Panel:SetFontInternal</page>.

<note>Only works on <page>Label</page> and <page>TextEntry</page> and their derived panels by default (such as <page>DLabel</page> and <page>DTextEntry</page>), and on any panel that manually implemented the <page>Panel:GetFont</page> method.</note>

returnValues.description: The font name.

functions.name: GetHTMLMaterial
functions.description: Returns the panel's HTML material. Only works with <page>Awesomium</page>, <page>HTML</page> and <page>DHTML</page> panels that have been fully loaded.

returnValues.description: The HTML material used by the panel. Typically starts with `__vgui_texture_` followed by an incremental number.

functions.name: GetLineHeight
functions.description: Returns the height of a single line of a <page>RichText</page> panel.

returnValues.description: The line height.

functions.name: GetMaximumCharCount
functions.description:
Returns the current maximum character count.

This function will only work on <page>RichText</page> and <page>TextEntry</page> panels and their derivatives.

returnValues.name: maxChar
returnValues.description: The maximum amount of characters this panel is allowed to contain.

functions.name: GetName
functions.description: Returns the internal name of the panel. Can be set via <page>Panel:SetName</page>.

returnValues.description: The previously set internal name of the panel.

functions.name: GetNumLines
functions.description:
Returns the number of lines in a <page>RichText</page> or a <page>TextEntry</page>.

You must wait a couple frames before calling this after using <page>Panel:AppendText</page> or <page>Panel:SetText</page>, otherwise it will return the number of text lines before the text change.

returnValues.description: The number of lines.

functions.name: GetParent
functions.description: Returns the parent of the panel, returns nil if there is no parent.

returnValues.description: The parent of given panel

functions.name: GetPos
functions.description:
Returns the position of the panel relative to its <page>Panel:GetParent</page>.

If you require the panel's position **and** size, consider using <page>Panel:GetBounds</page> instead.

If you need the position in screen space, see <page>Panel:LocalToScreen</page>.

See also <page>Panel:GetX</page> and <page>Panel:GetY</page>.

returnValues.description: X coordinate, relative to this panels parents top left corner.
Y coordinate, relative to this panels parents top left corner.

functions.name: GetScrollStartIndexes
functions.description: Returns the vertical and horizontal start indexes of a <page>TextEntry</page>'s visible text. This is useful when the panel is scrolled.

returnValues.name: horizontalIndex
returnValues.description: The horizontal start index. (characters)

returnValues.name: verticalIndex
returnValues.description: The vertical start index. (lines)

functions.name: GetSelectedChildren
functions.description: Returns a table of all children of the panel object that are selected. This is recursive, and the returned table will include tables for any child objects that also have children. This means that not all first-level members in the returned table will be of type <page>Panel</page>.

returnValues.description: A table of any child objects that are selected, including tables for children of the child objects (These tables may also contain table members, as the method is recursive).

functions.name: GetSelectedTextRange
functions.description:
Returns the currently selected range of text.

This function will only work on <page>RichText</page> and <page>TextEntry</page> panels and their derivatives.

returnValues.name: start
returnValues.description: The start of the range. If no text is selected it may be 0 and/or equal to the end range.

returnValues.name: endrange
returnValues.description: The end of the range. If no text is selected it may be 0 and/or equal to the start range.

functions.name: GetSelectionCanvas
functions.description: Returns the panel object (`self`) if it has been enabled as a selection canvas. This is achieved using <page>Panel:SetSelectionCanvas</page>.

returnValues.description: The panel object this method was called on if enabled as a selection canvas, otherwise `nil`.

functions.name: GetSize
functions.description:
Returns the size of the panel.

If you require both the panel's position and size, consider using <page>Panel:GetBounds</page> instead.

returnValues.description: width
height

functions.name: GetSkin
functions.description: Returns the table for the derma skin currently being used by this panel object.

returnValues.description: The derma skin table currently being used by this object.

functions.name: GetTable
functions.description: Returns the internal Lua table of the panel.

returnValues.description: A table containing all the members of given panel object.

functions.name: GetTall
functions.description:
Returns the height of the panel.

See <page>Panel:GetWide</page> for the width of the panel. See also <page>Panel:GetSize</page> for a function that returns both.

returnValues.description: height

functions.name: GetText
functions.description:
Returns the panel's text (where applicable).

This method returns a maximum of 1023 bytes, except for <page>DTextEntry</page>.

returnValues.description: The panel's text.

functions.name: GetTextInset
functions.description: Gets the left and top text margins of a text-based panel object, such as a <page>DButton</page> or <page>DLabel</page>. This is set with <page>Panel:SetTextInset</page>.

returnValues.description: The left margin of the text, in pixels.
The top margin of the text, in pixels.

functions.name: GetTextSize
functions.description: Gets the size of the text within a <page>Label</page> derived panel.

returnValues.description: The width of the text in the DLabel.
The height of the text in the DLabel.

functions.name: GetTooltip
functions.description: Returns the tooltip text that was set with <page>PANEL:SetTooltip</page>.

returnValues.name: tooltip
returnValues.description: The tooltip text, if it was set.

functions.name: GetTooltipDelay
functions.description:
Returns the tooltip delay (time between hovering over the panel, and the tooltip showing up) that was set with <page>Panel:SetTooltipDelay</page>, or nothing if it was not set.

If the delay is not explicitly set by this function, it will fallback to the value of the `tooltip_delay` <page>ConVar</page>, which is `0.5` by default.

returnValues.name: tooltip
returnValues.description: The tooltip delay in seconds, if it was set.

functions.name: GetTooltipPanel
functions.description: Returns the tooltip panel that was set with <page>PANEL:SetTooltipPanel</page>.

returnValues.name: tooltip
returnValues.description: The tooltip panel, if it was set.

functions.name: GetValidReceiverSlot
functions.description: Gets valid receiver slot of currently dragged panel.

returnValues.description: The panel this was called on if a valid receiver slot exists, otherwise false.
The slot table.

functions.name: GetValue
functions.description:
Returns the value the panel holds.

In engine is only implemented for <page>CheckButton</page>, <page>Label</page> and <page>TextEntry</page> as a string.

<note>This function is limited to 8092 Bytes. If using <page>DTextEntry</page>, use <page>Panel:GetText</page> for unlimited bytes.</note>

returnValues.description: The value the panel holds.

functions.name: GetWide
functions.description:
Returns the width of the panel.

See <page>Panel:GetTall</page> for the height of the panel. See also <page>Panel:GetSize</page> for a function that returns both.

returnValues.description: width

functions.name: GetX
functions.description:
Returns the X position of the panel relative to its <page>Panel:GetParent</page>.

Uses <page>Panel:GetPos</page> internally.

returnValues.description: X coordinate.

functions.name: GetY
functions.description:
Returns the Y position of the panel relative to its <page>Panel:GetParent</page>.

Uses <page>Panel:GetPos</page> internally.

returnValues.description: Y coordinate.

functions.name: GetZPos
functions.description: Returns the Z position of the panel.

returnValues.description: The Z order position of the panel.

functions.name: GoBack
functions.description: Goes back one page in the HTML panel's history if available.

functions.name: GoForward
functions.description: Goes forward one page in the HTML panel's history if available.

functions.name: GoToHistoryOffset
functions.description: Goes to the page in the HTML panel's history at the specified relative offset.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: The offset in the panel's back/forward history, relative to the current page, that you would like to skip to. Because this is relative, 0 = current page while negative goes back and positive goes forward. For example, -2 will go back 2 pages in the history.

functions.name: GotoTextEnd
functions.description: Causes a <page>RichText</page> element to scroll to the bottom of its text.

functions.name: GotoTextStart
functions.description: Causes a <page>RichText</page> element to scroll to the top of its text.

functions.name: GWEN_SetCheckboxText
functions.description: <internal></internal> Used by <page>Panel:ApplyGWEN</page> to apply the `CheckboxText` property to a <page>DCheckBoxLabel</page>. This does exactly the same as <page>Panel:GWEN_SetText</page>, but exists to cater for the seperate GWEN properties.

arguments.name: txt
arguments.description: The text to be applied to the DCheckBoxLabel.

functions.name: GWEN_SetControlName
functions.description: <internal></internal> Used by <page>Panel:ApplyGWEN</page> to apply the `ControlName` property to a panel. This calls <page>Panel:SetName</page>.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The new name to apply to the panel.

functions.name: GWEN_SetDock
functions.description: <internal></internal> Used by <page>Panel:ApplyGWEN</page> to apply the `Dock` property to a  panel object. This calls <page>Panel:Dock</page>.

arguments.name: dockState
arguments.description:
The dock mode to pass to the panel's `Dock` method. This reads a string and applies the approriate <page>Enums/DOCK</page>.
* `Right`: Dock right.
* `Left`: Dock left.
* `Bottom`: Dock at the bottom.
* `Top`: Dock at the top.
* `Fill`: Fill the parent panel.

functions.name: GWEN_SetHorizontalAlign
functions.description: <internal></internal> Used by <page>Panel:ApplyGWEN</page> to apply the `HorizontalAlign` property to a  panel object. This calls <page>Panel:SetContentAlignment</page>.

arguments.name: hAlign
arguments.description:
The alignment, as a string, to pass to <page>Panel:SetContentAlignment</page>. Accepts:
* `Right`: Align mid-right.
* `Left`: Align mid-left.
* `Center`: Align mid-center.

functions.name: GWEN_SetMargin
functions.description: <internal></internal> Used by <page>Panel:ApplyGWEN</page> to apply the `Margin` property to a  panel object. This calls <page>Panel:DockMargin</page>.

arguments.name: margins
arguments.description:
A four-membered table containing the margins as numbers:
* <page>number</page> left - The left margin.
* <page>number</page> top - The top margin.
* <page>number</page> right - The right margin.
* <page>number</page> bottom - The bottom margin.

functions.name: GWEN_SetMax
functions.description: <internal></internal> Used by <page>Panel:ApplyGWEN</page> to apply the `Max` property to a  <page>DNumberWang</page>, <page>Slider</page>, <page>DNumSlider</page> or <page>DNumberScratch</page>. This calls `SetMax` on one of the previously listed methods.

arguments.name: maxValue
arguments.description: The maximum value the element is to permit.

functions.name: GWEN_SetMin
functions.description: <internal></internal> Used by <page>Panel:ApplyGWEN</page> to apply the `Min` property to a  <page>DNumberWang</page>, <page>Slider</page>, <page>DNumSlider</page> or <page>DNumberScratch</page>. This calls `SetMin` on one of the previously listed methods.

arguments.name: minValue
arguments.description: The minimum value the element is to permit.

functions.name: GWEN_SetPosition
functions.description: <internal></internal> Used by <page>Panel:ApplyGWEN</page> to apply the `Position` property to a  panel object. This calls <page>Panel:SetPos</page>.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description:
A two-membered table containing the x and y coordinates as numbers:
* <page>number</page> x - The x coordinate.
* <page>number</page> y - The y coordinate.

functions.name: GWEN_SetSize
functions.description: <internal></internal> Used by <page>Panel:ApplyGWEN</page> to apply the `Size` property to a  panel object. This calls <page>Panel:SetSize</page>.

arguments.name: size
arguments.description:
A two-membered table containing the width and heights as numbers:
* <page>number</page> w - The width.
* <page>number</page> h - The height.

functions.name: GWEN_SetText
functions.description: <internal></internal> Used by <page>Panel:ApplyGWEN</page> to apply the `Text` property to a panel.

arguments.name: txt
arguments.description: The text to be applied to the panel.

functions.name: HasChildren
functions.description: Returns whenever the panel has child panels.

returnValues.description: hasChilds

functions.name: HasFocus
functions.description: Returns if the panel is focused.

returnValues.description: hasFocus

functions.name: HasHierarchicalFocus
functions.description: Returns if the panel or any of its children(sub children and so on) has the focus.

returnValues.description: hasHierarchicalFocus

functions.name: HasParent
functions.description: Returns whether the panel is a descendent of the given panel.

returnValues.description: True if the panel is contained within parentPanel.

functions.name: Hide
functions.description: Makes a panel invisible.

functions.name: InsertClickableTextEnd
functions.description: Marks the end of a clickable text segment in a <page>RichText</page> element, started with <page>Panel:InsertClickableTextStart</page>.

functions.name: InsertClickableTextStart
functions.description:
Starts the insertion of clickable text for a <page>RichText</page> element. Any text appended with <page>Panel:AppendText</page> between this call and <page>Panel:InsertClickableTextEnd</page> will become clickable text.

The hook <page>PANEL:OnTextClicked</page> is called when the text is clicked.

<note>The clickable text is a separate Derma panel which will not inherit the current font from the `RichText`.</note>

arguments.name: signalValue
arguments.description: The text passed as the action signal's value.

functions.name: InsertColorChange
functions.description: Inserts a color change in a <page>RichText</page> element, which affects the color of all text added with <page>Panel:AppendText</page> until another color change is applied.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: The red value `(0 - 255)`.

arguments.name: g
arguments.description: The green value `(0 - 255)`.

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: The blue value `(0 - 255)`.

arguments.name: a
arguments.description: The alpha value `(0 - 255)`.

functions.name: InsertFade
functions.description:
Begins a text fade for a <page>RichText</page> element where the last appended text segment is fully faded out after a specific amount of time, at a specific speed.

The alpha of the text at any given time is determined by the text's base alpha * ((`sustain` - <page>Global.CurTime</page>) / `length`) where <page>Global.CurTime</page> is added to `sustain` when this method is called.

arguments.name: sustain
arguments.description: The number of seconds the text remains visible.

arguments.name: length
arguments.description:
The number of seconds it takes the text to fade out.

If set **lower** than `sustain`, the text will not begin fading out until (`sustain` - `length`) seconds have passed.

If set **higher** than `sustain`, the text will begin fading out immediately at a fraction of the base alpha.

If set to **-1**, the text doesn't fade out.

functions.name: InvalidateChildren
functions.description: Invalidates the layout of this panel object and all its children. This will cause these objects to re-layout immediately, calling <page>PANEL:PerformLayout</page>. If you want to perform the layout in the next frame, you will have loop manually through all children, and call <page>Panel:InvalidateLayout</page> on each.

arguments.name: recursive
arguments.description: If `true`, the method will recursively invalidate the layout of all children. Otherwise, only immediate children are affected.

functions.name: InvalidateLayout
functions.description:
Causes the panel to re-layout in the next frame. During the layout process  <page>PANEL:PerformLayout</page> will be called on the target panel.
