You should avoid calling this function every frame.

<bug issue="2574">Using this on a panel after clicking on a docked element will cause docked elements to reorient themselves incorrectly. This can be fixed by assigning a unique <page>Panel:SetZPos</page> to each docked element.</bug>

arguments.name: layoutNow
arguments.description: If true the panel will re-layout instantly and not wait for the next frame.

functions.name: InvalidateParent
functions.description:
Calls <page>Panel:InvalidateLayout</page> on the panel's <page text="parent">Panel:GetParent</page>. This function will silently fail if the panel has no parent.

This will cause the parent panel to re-layout, calling <page>PANEL:PerformLayout</page>.

Internally sets `LayingOutParent` to `true` on this panel, and will silently fail if it is already set.

arguments.name: layoutNow
arguments.description: If `true`, the re-layout will occur immediately, otherwise it will be performed in the next frame.

functions.name: IsChildHovered
functions.description: Determines whether the mouse cursor is hovered over one of this panel object's children. This is a reverse process using <page>vgui.GetHoveredPanel</page>, and looks upward to find the parent.

arguments.name: immediate
arguments.description: Set to true to check only the immediate children of given panel ( first level )

returnValues.description: Whether or not one of this panel object's children is being hovered over.

functions.name: IsDraggable
functions.description: Returns whether this panel is draggable ( if user is able to drag it ) or not.

returnValues.description: Whether this panel is draggable ( if user is able to drag it ) or not.

functions.name: IsDragging
functions.description: Returns whether this panel is currently being dragged or not.

returnValues.description: Whether this panel is currently being dragged or not.

functions.name: IsEnabled
functions.description:
Returns whether the the panel is enabled or disabled.

See <page>Panel:SetEnabled</page> for a function that makes the panel enabled or disabled.

returnValues.description: Whether the panel is enabled or disabled.

functions.name: IsHovered
functions.description:
Returns whether the mouse cursor is hovering over this panel or not

Uses <page>vgui.GetHoveredPanel</page> internally.

Requires <page>Panel:SetMouseInputEnabled</page> to be set to true.

returnValues.description: true if the panel is hovered

functions.name: IsKeyboardInputEnabled
functions.description: Returns true if the panel can receive keyboard input.

returnValues.description: keyboardInputEnabled

functions.name: IsLoading
functions.description:
Determines whether or not a <page>HTML</page> or <page>DHTML</page> element is currently loading a page.

<note>Before calling <page>Panel:SetHTML</page> or <page>DHTML:OpenURL</page>, the result seems to be `false` with the Awesomium web renderer and `true` for the Chromium web renderer. This difference can be used to determine the available HTML5 capabilities.</note>
<note>On Awesomium, the result remains `true` until the root document is loaded and when in-page content is loading (when adding pictures, frames, etc.). During this state, the HTML texture is not refreshed and the panel is not painted (it becomes invisible).

On Chromium, the value is only `true` when the root document is not ready. The rendering is not suspended when in-page elements are loading.</note>

returnValues.description: Whether or not the (D)HTML object is loading.

functions.name: IsMarkedForDeletion
functions.description: Returns if the panel is going to be deleted in the next frame.

returnValues.description: markedForDeletion

functions.name: IsModal
functions.description: Returns whether the panel was made modal or not. See <page>Panel:DoModal</page>.

returnValues.description: True if the panel is modal.

functions.name: IsMouseInputEnabled
functions.description: Returns true if the panel can receive mouse input.

returnValues.description: mouseInputEnabled

functions.name: IsMultiline
functions.description: Determines whether or not a <page>TextEntry</page> panel is in multi-line mode. This is set with <page>Panel:SetMultiline</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether the object is in multi-line mode or not.

functions.name: IsOurChild
functions.description: Returns whether the panel contains the given panel, recursively.

returnValues.description: True if the panel contains childPanel.

functions.name: IsPopup
functions.description: Returns if the panel was made popup or not. See <page>Panel:MakePopup</page>

returnValues.description: `true` if the panel was made popup.

functions.name: IsSelectable
functions.description: Determines if the panel object is selectable (like icons in the Spawn Menu, holding <key>Shift</key>). This is set with <page>Panel:SetSelectable</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether the panel is selectable or not.

functions.name: IsSelected
functions.description: Returns if the panel object is selected (like icons in the Spawn Menu, holding <key>Shift</key>). This can be set in Lua using <page>Panel:SetSelected</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether the panel object is selected or not. Always returns false if the object is not selectable. This can be modified using <page>Panel:SetSelectable</page>.

functions.name: IsSelectionCanvas
functions.description: Determines if the panel object is a selection canvas or not. This is set with <page>Panel:SetSelectionCanvas</page>.

returnValues.description: The value (if any) set by <page>Panel:SetSelectionCanvas</page>.

functions.name: IsValid
functions.description: Returns if the panel is valid and not marked for deletion.

returnValues.description: True if the object is valid.

functions.name: IsVisible
functions.description: Returns if the panel is visible. This will **NOT** take into account visibility of the parent.

returnValues.description: `true` if the panel ls visible, `false` otherwise.

functions.name: IsWorldClicker
functions.description: Returns if a panel allows world clicking set by <page>Panel:SetWorldClicker</page>.

returnValues.description: If the panel allows world clicking.

functions.name: KillFocus
functions.description: Remove the focus from the panel.

functions.name: LerpPositions
functions.description:
Redefines the panel object's <page>Panel:SetPos</page> method to operate using frame-by-frame linear interpolation (<page>Global.Lerp</page>). When the panel's position is changed, it will move to the target position at the speed defined. You can undo this with <page>Panel:DisableLerp</page>.

Unlike the other panel animation functions, such as <page>Panel:MoveTo</page>, this animation method will not operate whilst the game is paused. This is because it relies on <page>Global.FrameTime</page>.

arguments.name: speed
arguments.description:
The speed at which to move the panel. This is affected by the value of `easeOut`. Recommended values are:
* **0.1 - 10** when `easeOut` is `false`.
* **0.1 - 1** when `easeOut` is `true`.

arguments.name: easeOut
arguments.description: This causes the panel object to 'jump' at the target, slowing as it approaches. This affects the `speed` value significantly, see above.

functions.name: LoadControlsFromFile
functions.description:
<deprecated></deprecated>
<internal></internal>
Similar to <page>Panel:LoadControlsFromString</page> but loads controls from a file.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: The path to load the controls from.

functions.name: LoadControlsFromString
functions.description:
<deprecated></deprecated>
<internal></internal>
Loads controls(positions, etc) from given data. This is what the default options menu uses.

arguments.name: data
arguments.description: The data to load controls from. Format unknown.

functions.name: LoadGWENFile
functions.description:
Loads a .gwen file (created by GWEN Designer) and calls <page>Panel:LoadGWENString</page> with the contents of the loaded file.

Used to load panel controls from a file.

arguments.name: filename
arguments.description: The file to open. The path is relative to garrysmod/garrysmod/.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description:
The path used to look up the file.

* "GAME" Structured like base folder (garrysmod/), searches all the mounted content (main folder, addons, mounted games etc)
* "LUA" or "lsv" - All Lua folders (lua/) including gamesmodes and addons
* "DATA" Data folder (garrysmod/data)
* "MOD" Strictly the game folder (garrysmod/), ignores mounting.

functions.name: LoadGWENString
functions.description: Loads controls for the panel from a JSON string.

arguments.name: str
arguments.description: JSON string containing information about controls to create.

functions.name: LoadTGAImage
functions.description: Sets a new image to be loaded by a <page>TGAImage</page>.

arguments.name: imageName
arguments.description: The file path.

arguments.name: strPath
arguments.description:
The PATH to search in. See <page>File Search Paths</page>.

This isn't used internally.

functions.name: LocalCursorPos
functions.description: Returns the cursor position local to the position of the panel (usually the upper-left corner).

returnValues.description: The x coordinate
The y coordinate

functions.name: LocalToScreen
functions.description:
Takes X and Y coordinates relative to the panel and returns their corresponding positions relative to the screen.

See also <page>Panel:ScreenToLocal</page>.

<warning>This function uses a cached value for the screen position of the panel, computed at the end of the last VGUI Think/Layout pass, so inaccurate results may be returned if the panel or any of its ancestors have been re-positioned outside of <page>PANEL:Think</page> or <page>PANEL:PerformLayout</page> within the last frame.</warning>

<note>If the panel uses <page>Panel:Dock</page>, this function will return 0, 0 when the panel was created. The position will be updated in the next frame.</note>

arguments.name: posX
arguments.description: The X coordinate of the position on the panel to translate.

arguments.name: posY
arguments.description: The Y coordinate of the position on the panel to translate.

returnValues.description: The X coordinate relative to the screen.
The Y coordinate relative to the screen.

functions.name: MakePopup
functions.description:
Focuses the panel and enables it to receive input.

This automatically calls <page>Panel:SetMouseInputEnabled</page> and <page text="Panel:SetKeyboardInputEnabled">Panel:SetKeyboardInputEnabled(lowercase)</page> and sets them to `true`.

<note>Panels derived from <page>Panel</page> will not work properly with this function. Due to this, any children will not be intractable with keyboard. Derive from <page>EditablePanel</page> instead.

For non gui related mouse focus, you can use <page>gui.EnableScreenClicker</page>.</note>

functions.name: MouseCapture
functions.description: Allows the panel to receive mouse input even if the mouse cursor is outside the bounds of the panel.

arguments.name: doCapture
arguments.description: Set to true to enable, set to false to disable.

functions.name: MoveAbove
functions.description: Places the panel above the passed panel with the specified offset.

arguments.name: panel
arguments.description: Panel to position relatively to.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: The align offset.

functions.name: MoveBelow
functions.description: Places the panel below the passed panel with the specified offset.

arguments.name: panel
arguments.description: Panel to position relatively to.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: The align offset.

functions.name: MoveBy
functions.description: Moves the panel by the specified coordinates using animation.

arguments.name: moveX
arguments.description: The number of pixels to move by in the horizontal (x) direction.

arguments.name: moveY
arguments.description: The number of pixels to move by in the vertical (y) direction.

arguments.name: time
arguments.description: The time (in seconds) in which to perform the animation.

arguments.name: delay
arguments.description: The delay (in seconds) before the animation begins.

arguments.name: ease
arguments.description: The easing of the start and/or end speed of the animation. See <page>Panel:NewAnimation</page> for how this works.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description:
The function to be called once the animation is complete.
<callback>
<arg type="table" name="animData">The <page>Structures/AnimationData</page> that was used.</arg>
<arg type="Panel" name="targetPanel">The panel object that was animated.</arg>
</callback>

functions.name: MoveLeftOf
functions.description: Places the panel left to the passed panel with the specified offset.

arguments.name: panel
arguments.description: Panel to position relatively to.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: The align offset.

functions.name: MoveRightOf
functions.description: Places the panel right to the passed panel with the specified offset.

arguments.name: panel
arguments.description: Panel to position relatively to.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: The align offset.

functions.name: MoveTo
functions.description:
Moves the panel to the specified position using animation.
<note>Setting the ease argument to 0 will result in the animation happening instantly, this applies to all MoveTo/SizeTo functions</note>

arguments.name: posX
arguments.description: The target x coordinate of the panel.

arguments.name: posY
arguments.description: The target y coordinate of the panel.

arguments.name: time
arguments.description: The time to perform the animation within.

arguments.name: delay
arguments.description: The delay before the animation starts.

arguments.name: ease
arguments.description: The easing of the start and/or end speed of the animation. See <page>Panel:NewAnimation</page> for how this works.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description:
The function to be called once the animation finishes.
<callback>
<arg type="table" name="animData">The <page>Structures/AnimationData</page> that was used.</arg>
<arg type="Panel" name="targetPanel">The panel object that was animated.</arg>
</callback>

functions.name: MoveToAfter
functions.description: Moves this panel object in front of the specified sibling (child of the same parent) in the render order, and shuffles up the Z-positions of siblings now behind.

arguments.name: siblingPanel
arguments.description: The panel to move this one in front of. Must be a child of the same parent panel.

returnValues.description: `false` if the passed panel is not a sibling, otherwise `nil`.

functions.name: MoveToBack
functions.description: Moves the panel object behind all other panels on screen. If the panel has been made a pop-up with <page>Panel:MakePopup</page>, it will still draw in front of any panels that haven't.

functions.name: MoveToBefore
functions.description: Moves this panel object behind the specified sibling (child of the same parent) in the render order, and shuffles up the <page>Panel:SetZPos</page> of siblings now in front.

arguments.name: siblingPanel
arguments.description: The panel to move this one behind. Must be a child of the same parent panel.

returnValues.description: `false` if the passed panel is not a sibling, otherwise `nil`.

functions.name: MoveToFront
functions.description: Moves the panel in front of all other panels on screen. Unless the panel has been made a pop-up using <page>Panel:MakePopup</page>, it will still draw behind any that have.

functions.name: NewAnimation
functions.description:
Creates a new animation for the panel object.

Methods that use this function:
* <page>Panel:MoveTo</page>
* <page>Panel:SizeTo</page>
* <page>Panel:SlideUp</page>
* <page>Panel:SlideDown</page>
* <page>Panel:ColorTo</page>
* <page>Panel:AlphaTo</page>
* <page>Panel:MoveBy</page>
* <page>Panel:LerpPositions</page>

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: The length of the animation in seconds.

arguments.name: delay
arguments.description: The delay before the animation starts.

arguments.name: ease
arguments.description:
The power/index to use for easing.
* Positive values greater than 1 will ease in; the higher the number, the sharper the curve's gradient (less linear).
* A value of 1 removes all easing.
* Positive values between 0 and 1 ease out; values closer to 0 increase the curve's gradient (less linear).
* A value of 0 will break the animation and should be avoided.
* Any value less than zero will ease in/out; the value has no effect on the gradient.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description:
The function to be called when the animation ends.

<callback>
<arg type="table" name="animData">The <page>Structures/AnimationData</page> that was used.</arg>
<arg type="Panel" name="targetPanel">The panel object that was animated.</arg>
</callback>

returnValues.description:
Partially filled <page>Structures/AnimationData</page> with the following members:
* <page>number</page> **EndTime** - Equal to `length` and `delay` arguments added together, plus either the <page>Global.SysTime</page> if there is no other animation queued or the end time of the last animation in the queue.
* <page>number</page> **StartTime** - Equal to the `delay` argument, plus either the <page>Global.SysTime</page> if there is no other animation queued or the end time of the last animation in the queue.
* <page>number</page> **Ease** - Equal to the `ease` argument.
* <page>function</page> **OnEnd** - Equal to the `callback` argument.

functions.name: NewObject
functions.description: <internal></internal>

functions.name: NewObjectCallback
functions.description: <internal></internal>

functions.name: NoClipping
functions.description:
Sets whether this panel's drawings should be clipped within the parent panel's bounds.

<note>
This only disabled clipping for the Paint Related functions (as far as i can tell at the current moment, more testing should be done) so things like the text of a <page>DLabel</page> will still be clipped to the parent.

To fully disable the clipping of any children see <page>Global.DisableClipping</page>.
</note>

arguments.name: noclip
arguments.description: Whether to disable clipping or not. True to disable clipping, false to enable clipping.

functions.name: NumSelectedChildren
functions.description: Returns the number of children of the panel object that are selected. This is equivalent to calling <page>Panel:IsSelected</page> on all child objects and counting the number of returns that are `true`.

returnValues.description: The number of child objects that are currently selected. This does not include the parent object you are calling the method from.

functions.name: OpenURL
functions.description:
Instructs a HTML control to download and parse a HTML script using the passed URL.

This function can only be used on [HTML](HTML) panel and its derivatives.

arguments.name: URL
arguments.description:
URL to open. It has to start or be one of the following:
* `http://`
* `https://`
* `asset://`
* `about:blank`
* `chrome://credits/`

functions.name: PaintAt
functions.description:
Paints a ghost copy of the panel at the given position.
<warning>
This function sets Z pos of panel's children (<page>PANEL:SetZPos</page>)
</warning>

arguments.name: posX
arguments.description: The x coordinate to draw the panel from.

arguments.name: posY
arguments.description: The y coordinate to draw the panel from.

functions.name: PaintManual
functions.description: Paints the panel at its current position. To use this you must call <page>Panel:SetPaintedManually</page>(true).

arguments.name: unclamp
arguments.description: If set, overrides panels' clipping so that it can render fully when its size is larger than the game's resolution.

functions.name: ParentToHUD
functions.description:
Parents the panel to the HUD.
Makes it invisible on the escape-menu and disables controls.

functions.name: Paste
functions.description:
<deprecated>Due to privacy concerns, this function has been disabled</deprecated>

Only works for TextEntries.

Pastes the contents of the clipboard into the TextEntry.

<note>Tab characters will be dropped from the pasted text</note>

functions.name: PositionLabel
functions.description: Sets the width and position of a <page>DLabel</page> and places the passed panel object directly to the right of it. Returns the `y` value of the bottom of the tallest object. The panel on which this method is run is not relevant; only the passed objects are affected.

arguments.name: lblWidth
arguments.description: The width to set the label to.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The horizontal (x) position at which to place the label.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The vertical (y) position at which to place the label.

arguments.name: lbl
arguments.description: The label to resize and position.

arguments.name: panelObj
arguments.description: The panel object to place to the right of the label.

returnValues.description: The distance from the top of the parent panel to the bottom of the tallest object (the `y` position plus the height of the label or passed panel, depending on which is tallest).

functions.name: Prepare
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
Installs Lua defined functions into the panel.

functions.name: Queue
functions.description: Enables the queue for panel animations. If enabled, the next new animation will begin after all current animations have ended. This must be called before <page>Panel:NewAnimation</page> to work, and only applies to the next new animation. If you want to queue many, you must call this before each.

functions.name: RebuildSpawnIcon
functions.description: Causes a <page>SpawnIcon</page> to rebuild its model image.

functions.name: RebuildSpawnIconEx
functions.description:
Re-renders a spawn icon with customized cam data.

<page>Global.PositionSpawnIcon</page> can be used to easily calculate the necessary camera parameters.

<note>This function does **not** accept the standard <page>Structures/CamData</page>.</note>

arguments.name: data
arguments.description:
A four-membered table containing the information needed to re-render:
* <page>Vector</page> cam_pos - The relative camera position the model is viewed from.
* <page>Angle</page> cam_ang - The camera angle the model is viewed from.
* <page>number</page> cam_fov - The camera's field of view (FOV).
* <page>Entity</page> ent - The entity object of the model.
See the example below for how to retrieve these values.

functions.name: Receiver
functions.description: Allows the panel to receive drag and drop events. Can be called multiple times with different names to receive multiple different draggable panel events.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of DnD panels to receive. This is set on the drag'n'drop-able panels via  <page>Panel:Droppable</page>

arguments.name: func
arguments.description:
This function is called whenever a panel with valid name is hovering above and dropped on this panel.

<callback>
<arg type="Panel" name="pnl">The receiver panel</arg>
<arg type="table" name="tbl">A table of panels dropped onto receiver panel</arg>
<arg type="boolean" name="dropped">False if hovering over, true if dropped onto</arg>
<arg type="number" name="menuIndex">Index of clicked menu item from third argument of <page>Panel:Receiver</page></arg>
<arg type="number" name="x">Cursor pos, relative to the receiver</arg>
<arg type="number" name="y">Cursor pos, relative to the receiver</arg>
</callback>

arguments.name: menu
arguments.description: A table of strings that will act as a menu if drag'n'drop was performed with a right click

functions.name: Refresh
functions.description: Refreshes the HTML panel's current page.

arguments.name: ignoreCache
arguments.description: If true, the refresh will ignore cached content similar to "ctrl+f5" in most browsers.

functions.name: Remove
functions.description:
Marks a panel for deletion so it will be deleted on the next frame.

This will not mark child panels for deletion this frame, but they will be marked and deleted in the next frame.

See also <page>Panel:IsMarkedForDeletion</page>

Will automatically call <page>Panel:InvalidateParent</page>.

functions.name: RequestFocus
functions.description: Attempts to obtain focus for this panel.

functions.name: ResetAllFades
functions.description: Resets all text fades in a <page>RichText</page> element made with <page>Panel:InsertFade</page>.

arguments.name: hold
arguments.description: True to reset fades, false otherwise.

arguments.name: expiredOnly
arguments.description: Any value equating to `true` will reset fades only on text segments that are completely faded out.

arguments.name: newSustain
arguments.description: The new sustain value of each faded text segment. Set to -1 to keep the old sustain value.

functions.name: RunJavascript
functions.description:
Executes a string as JavaScript code on a web document panel.

<note>This function does **NOT** allow you to pass variables from JavaScript (JS) to Lua context.
If you wish to pass/return values from JS to Lua, you may want to use <page>DHTML:AddFunction</page> function to accomplish that job.</note>

<note>The Awesomium web renderer automatically delays the code execution if the document is not ready, but the Chromium web renderer does not!

This means that with Chromium, you cannot JavaScript run code immediatly after calling <page>Panel:SetHTML</page> or <page>Panel:OpenURL</page>. You should wait for the events <page>PANEL:OnDocumentReady</page> or <page>PANEL:OnFinishLoadingDocument</page> to be triggered before proceeding, otherwise you may manipulate an empty / incomplete document.</note>

arguments.name: js
arguments.description: Specify JavaScript code to be executed.

functions.name: SaveUndoState
functions.description:
Saves the current state (caret position and the text inside) of a <page>TextEntry</page> as an undo state.

See also <page>Panel:Undo</page>.

functions.name: ScreenToLocal
functions.description:
Translates global screen coordinate to coordinates relative to the panel.

See also <page>Panel:LocalToScreen</page>.

<warning>This function uses a cached value for the screen position of the panel, computed at the end of the last VGUI Think/Layout pass, so inaccurate results may be returned if the panel or any of its ancestors have been re-positioned outside of <page>PANEL:Think</page> or <page>PANEL:PerformLayout</page> within the last frame.</warning>

arguments.name: screenX
arguments.description: The x coordinate of the screen position to be translated.

arguments.name: screenY
arguments.description: The y coordinate of the screed position be to translated.

returnValues.description: Relativeposition X
Relativeposition Y

functions.name: SelectAll
functions.description:
Selects all items within a panel or object. For text-based objects, selects all text.

<note>Only works on <page>RichText</page> and <page>TextEntry</page> and their derived panels by default (such as <page>DTextEntry</page>), and on any panel that manually reimplemented this method.</note>

functions.name: SelectAllOnFocus
functions.description: If called on a <page>TextEntry</page>, clicking the text entry for the first time will automatically select all of the text ready to be copied by the user.

functions.name: SelectAllText
functions.description:
<deprecated>Duplicate of <page>Panel:SelectAll</page>.</deprecated>

Selects all the text in a panel object. Will not select non-text items; for this, use <page>Panel:SelectAll</page>.

arguments.name: resetCursorPos
arguments.description: Reset cursor pos?

functions.name: SelectNone
functions.description:
Deselects all items in a panel object. For text-based objects, this will deselect all text.

<note>Only works on <page>RichText</page> and <page>TextEntry</page> and their derived panels by default (such as <page>DTextEntry</page>), and on any panel that manually reimplemented this method.</note>

functions.name: SetAchievement
functions.description: Sets the achievement to be displayed by <page>AchievementIcon</page>.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: Achievement number ID

functions.name: SetAllowNonAsciiCharacters
functions.description:
Configures a <page>TextEntry</page> to allow user to type characters that are not included in the US-ASCII (7-bit ASCII) character set.

Characters not included in US-ASCII are multi-byte characters in UTF-8. They can be accented characters, non-Latin characters and special characters.

arguments.name: allowed
arguments.description: Set to true in order not to restrict input characters.

functions.name: SetAlpha
functions.description: Sets the alpha multiplier for the panel

arguments.name: alpha
arguments.description: The alpha value in the range of 0-255.

functions.name: SetAnimationEnabled
functions.description: Enables or disables animations for the panel object by overriding the <page>PANEL:AnimationThink</page> hook to nil and back.

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: Whether to enable or disable animations.

functions.name: SetAutoDelete
functions.description: Sets whenever the panel should be removed if the parent was removed.

arguments.name: autoDelete
arguments.description: Whenever to delete if the parent was removed or not.

functions.name: SetBGColor
functions.description:
Sets the background color of a panel such as a <page>RichText</page>, <page>Label</page>, <page>DColorCube</page> or the base <page>Panel</page>.

For many panels, such as <page>DLabel</page> and <page>Panel</page>, you must use <page>Panel:SetPaintBackgroundEnabled</page>( true ) for the background to appear.

Please note that for most panels the engine will overwrite the foreground and background colors a frame after panel creation via the <page>PANEL:ApplySchemeSettings</page> hook, so you may want to set the color in that hook instead.

See <page>Panel:SetFGColor</page> for the foreground color.

<note>This doesn't apply to all VGUI elements and its function varies between them</note>

arguments.name: r or color
arguments.description: The red channel of the color, or a <page>Color</page>. If you pass the latter, the following three arguments are ignored.

arguments.name: g
arguments.description: The green channel of the color.

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: The blue channel of the color.

arguments.name: a
arguments.description: The alpha channel of the color.

functions.name: SetBGColorEx
functions.description: <internal></internal>Sets the background color of the panel.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: The red channel of the color.

arguments.name: g
arguments.description: The green channel of the color.

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: The blue channel of the color.

arguments.name: a
arguments.description: The alpha channel of the color.

functions.name: SetCaretPos
functions.description: Sets the position of the caret (or text cursor) in a text-based panel object.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: Caret position/offset from the start of text. A value of `0` places the caret before the first character.

functions.name: SetContentAlignment
functions.description:
Sets the alignment of the contents.

<note>This function only works on <page>Label</page> panels and its derivatives.</note>

arguments.name: alignment
arguments.description:
The direction of the content, based on the number pad. 1: **bottom-left**
2: **bottom-center**
3: **bottom-right**
4: **middle-left**
5: **center**
6: **middle-right**
7: **top-left**
8: **top-center**
9: **top-right**

functions.name: SetConVar
functions.description:
<warning>This function does not exist on all panels</warning>
<warning>This function cannot interact with serverside convars unless you are host</warning>
<note>Blocked convars will not work with this, see <page>Blocked ConCommands</page></note>

Sets this panel's convar. When the convar changes this panel will update automatically.

For developer implementation, see <page>Global.Derma_Install_Convar_Functions</page>.

arguments.name: convar
arguments.description: The console variable to check.

functions.name: SetCookie
functions.description:
Stores a string in the named cookie using <page>Panel:GetCookieName</page> as prefix.

You can also retrieve and modify this cookie by using the <page>cookie</page>. Cookies are stored in this format:

```
panelCookieName.cookieName
```


<warning>The panel's cookie name MUST be set for this function to work. See <page>Panel:SetCookieName</page>.</warning>

arguments.name: cookieName
arguments.description: The unique name used to retrieve the cookie later.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The value to store in the cookie. This can be retrieved later as a <page>string</page> or <page>number</page>.

functions.name: SetCookieName
functions.description: Sets the panel's cookie name. Calls <page>PANEL:LoadCookies</page> if defined.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The panel's cookie name. Used as prefix for <page>Panel:SetCookie</page>, therefore should be a unique value.

functions.name: SetCursor
functions.description: Sets the appearance of the cursor. You can find a list of all available cursors with image previews [here](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Cursors).

arguments.name: cursor
arguments.description:
The cursor to be set. Can be one of the following:

* [arrow](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Cursors#:~:text=arrow)
* [beam](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Cursors#:~:text=beam)
* [hourglass](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Cursors#:~:text=hourglass)
* [waitarrow](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Cursors#:~:text=waitarrow)
* [crosshair](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Cursors#:~:text=crosshair)
* [up](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Cursors#:~:text=up)
* [sizenwse](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Cursors#:~:text=sizenwse)
* [sizenesw](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Cursors#:~:text=sizenesw)
* [sizewe](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Cursors#:~:text=sizewe)
* [sizens](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Cursors#:~:text=sizens)
* [sizeall](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Cursors#:~:text=sizeall)
* [no](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Cursors#:~:text=no)
* [hand](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Cursors#:~:text=hand)
* [blank](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Cursors#:~:text=blank)

Set to anything else to set it to "none", the default fallback. Do note that a value of "none" does not, as one might assume, result in no cursor being drawn - hiding the cursor requires a value of "blank" instead.

functions.name: SetDragParent
functions.description:
Sets the drag parent.

Drag parent means that when we start to drag this panel, we'll really start dragging the defined parent.

arguments.name: parent
arguments.description: The panel to set as drag parent.

functions.name: SetDrawLanguageID
functions.description:
Sets the visibility of the language selection box when typing in non-English mode.

See <page>Panel:SetDrawLanguageIDAtLeft</page> for a function that changes the position of the language selection box.

arguments.name: visible
arguments.description: true to make it visible, false to hide it.

functions.name: SetDrawLanguageIDAtLeft
functions.description:
Sets where to draw the language selection box.

See <page>Panel:SetDrawLanguageID</page> for a function that hides or shows the language selection box.

arguments.name: left
arguments.description: true = left, false = right

functions.name: SetDrawOnTop
functions.description:
Makes the panel render in front of all others, including the spawn menu and main menu.

Priority is given based on the last call, so of two panels that call this method, the second will draw in front of the first.

<note>This only makes the panel **draw** above other panels. If there's another panel that would have otherwise covered it, users will not be able to interact with it.

Completely disregards <page>PANEL:ParentToHUD</page>.</note>

<warning>This does not work when using <page>PANEL:SetPaintedManually</page> or <page>PANEL:PaintAt</page>.</warning>

arguments.name: drawOnTop
arguments.description: Whether or not to draw the panel in front of all others.

functions.name: SetDropTarget
functions.description:
Sets the target area for dropping when an object is being dragged around this panel using the <page>dragndrop</page>.

This draws a target box of the specified size and position, until <page>Panel:DragHoverEnd</page> is called. It uses <page>Panel:DrawDragHover</page> to draw this area.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The x coordinate of the top-left corner of the drop area.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The y coordinate of the top-left corner of the drop area.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The width of the drop area.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: The height of the drop area.

functions.name: SetEnabled
functions.description:
Sets the enabled state of a disable-able panel object, such as a <page>DButton</page> or <page>DTextEntry</page>.

See <page>Panel:IsEnabled</page> for a function that retrieves the "enabled" state of a panel.

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: Whether to enable or disable the panel object.

functions.name: SetExpensiveShadow
functions.description:
Adds a shadow falling to the bottom right corner of the panel's text.

<note>This works only on  panels that derive from <page>Label</page>.</note>

arguments.name: distance
arguments.description: The distance of the shadow from the panel.

arguments.name: Color
arguments.description: The color of the shadow. Uses the <page>Color</page>.

functions.name: SetFGColor
functions.description:
Sets the foreground color of a panel.

For a <page>Label</page> or <page>RichText</page>, this is the color of its text.

This function calls <page>Panel:SetFGColorEx</page> internally.

Please note that for most panels the engine will overwrite the foreground and background colors a frame after panel creation via the <page>PANEL:ApplySchemeSettings</page> hook, so you may want to set the color in that hook instead.

See <page>Panel:SetBGColor</page> for the background color.

<note>This doesn't apply to all VGUI elements (such as <page>DLabel</page>) and its function varies between them</note>

arguments.name: r or color
arguments.description: The red channel of the color, or a <page>Color</page>. If you pass the latter, the following three arguments are ignored.

arguments.name: g
arguments.description: The green channel of the color.

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: The blue channel of the color.

arguments.name: a
arguments.description: The alpha channel of the color.

functions.name: SetFGColorEx
functions.description:
<internal></internal>Sets the foreground color of the panel.

For labels, this is the color of their text.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: The red channel of the color.

arguments.name: g
arguments.description: The green channel of the color.

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: The blue channel of the color.

arguments.name: a
arguments.description: The alpha channel of the color.

functions.name: SetFocusTopLevel
functions.description: Sets the panel that owns this FocusNavGroup to be the root in the focus traversal hierarchy. This function will only work on EditablePanel class panels and its derivatives.

functions.name: SetFontInternal
functions.description:
Sets the font used to render this panel's text. This works for <page>Label</page>, <page>TextEntry</page> and <page>RichText</page>, but it's a better idea to use their local `SetFont` (<page>DTextEntry:SetFont</page>, <page>DLabel:SetFont</page>) methods when available.

To retrieve the font used by a panel, call <page>Panel:GetFont</page>.

arguments.name: fontName
arguments.description:
The name of the font.

See <page text="here">Default_Fonts</page> for a list of existing fonts.
Alternatively, use <page>surface.CreateFont</page> to create your own custom font.

functions.name: SetHeight
functions.description:
Sets the height of the panel.

Calls <page>PANEL:OnSizeChanged</page> and marks this panel for layout (<page>Panel:InvalidateLayout</page>).


See also <page>Panel:SetSize</page>.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: The height to be set.

functions.name: SetHTML
functions.description: Allows you to set HTML code within a panel.

arguments.name: HTML
arguments.description: The HTML code to set.

functions.name: SetKeyboardInputEnabled
functions.description: Allows or disallows the panel to receive keyboard focus and input. This is recursively applied to all children.

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: Whether keyboard input should be enabled for this panel.

functions.name: SetKeyBoardInputEnabled
functions.description: <deprecated>Alias of <page text="Panel:SetKeyboardInputEnabled">Panel:SetKeyboardInputEnabled(lowercase)</page></deprecated>Enables or disables the keyboard input for the panel.

arguments.name: keyboardInput
arguments.description: Whether to enable or disable keyboard input.

functions.name: SetLineHeight
functions.description: Sets the height of a single line of a <page>RichText</page> panel.

returnValues.name: height
returnValues.description: The new line height. Values below zero mean no override.

functions.name: SetMaximumCharCount
functions.description:
Sets the maximum character count this panel should have.

This function will only work on <page>RichText</page> and <page>TextEntry</page> panels and their derivatives.

arguments.name: maxChar
arguments.description: The new maximum amount of characters this panel is allowed to contain.

functions.name: SetMinimumSize
functions.description:
Sets the minimum dimensions of the panel or object.

You can restrict either or both values.

Calling the function without arguments will remove the minimum size.

arguments.name: minW
arguments.description: The minimum width of the object.

arguments.name: minH
arguments.description: The minimum height of the object.

functions.name: SetModel
functions.description:
Sets the model to be displayed by <page>SpawnIcon</page>.

<note>This must be called after setting size if you wish to use a different size spawnicon</note>

arguments.name: ModelPath
arguments.description: The path of the model to set

arguments.name: skin
arguments.description: The skin to set

arguments.name: bodygroups
arguments.description: The body groups to set. Each single-digit number in the string represents a separate bodygroup, **This argument must be 9 characters in total**.

functions.name: SetMouseInputEnabled
functions.description:
Enables or disables the mouse input for the panel.
<note>Panels parented to the context menu will not be clickable unless <page text="Panel:SetKeyboardInputEnabled">Panel:SetKeyboardInputEnabled(lowercase)</page> is enabled or <page>Panel:MakePopup</page> has been called. If you want the panel to have mouse input but you do not want to prevent players from moving, set <page text="Panel:SetKeyboardInputEnabled">Panel:SetKeyboardInputEnabled(lowercase)</page> to false immediately after calling <page>Panel:MakePopup</page>.</note>

arguments.name: mouseInput
arguments.description: Whenever to enable or disable mouse input.

functions.name: SetMultiline
functions.description: Enables or disables the multi-line functionality of <page>TextEntry</page> panel and its derivatives.

arguments.name: multiline
arguments.description: Whether to enable multiline or not.

functions.name: SetName
functions.description: Sets the internal name of the panel. Can be retrieved with <page>Panel:GetName</page>.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The new name of the panel.

functions.name: SetOpenLinksExternally
functions.description: Set to true to open links in an external browser. This only functions on the `x86-64` beta.

functions.name: SetPaintBackgroundEnabled
functions.description: Sets whether the default background of the panel should be drawn or not. It's color is usually set by <page>Panel:SetBGColor</page>.

arguments.name: paintBackground
arguments.description: Whether to draw the background or not.

functions.name: SetPaintBorderEnabled
functions.description: Sets whether the default border of the panel should be drawn or not.

arguments.name: paintBorder
arguments.description: Whether to draw the border or not.

functions.name: SetPaintedManually
functions.description: Enables or disables painting of the panel manually with <page>Panel:PaintManual</page>.

arguments.name: paintedManually
arguments.description: True if the panel should be painted manually.

functions.name: SetParent
functions.description:
Sets the parent of the panel.
<note>Panels parented to the context menu will not be clickable unless <page>Panel:SetMouseInputEnabled</page> and <page text="Panel:SetKeyboardInputEnabled">Panel:SetKeyboardInputEnabled(lowercase)</page> are both true or <page>Panel:MakePopup</page> has been called. If you want the panel to have mouse input but you do not want to prevent players from moving, set <page text="Panel:SetKeyboardInputEnabled">Panel:SetKeyboardInputEnabled(lowercase)</page> to false immediately after calling <page>Panel:MakePopup</page>.</note>

arguments.name: parent
arguments.description: The new parent of the panel.

functions.name: SetPlayer
functions.description: Used by <page>AvatarImage</page> to load an avatar for given player.

arguments.name: player
arguments.description: The player to use avatar of.

arguments.name: size
arguments.description: The size of the avatar to use. Acceptable sizes are `32`, `64`, `184`. Non matching sizes will be clamped down to the highest valid number.

functions.name: SetPopupStayAtBack
functions.description: If this panel object has been made a popup with <page>Panel:MakePopup</page>, this method will prevent it from drawing in front of other panels when it receives input focus.

arguments.name: stayAtBack
arguments.description: If `true`, the popup panel will not draw in front of others when it gets focus, for example when it is clicked.

functions.name: SetPos
functions.description:
Sets the position of the panel's top left corner.

This will trigger <page>PANEL:PerformLayout</page>. You should avoid calling this function in <page>PANEL:PerformLayout</page> to avoid infinite loops.

See also <page>Panel:SetX</page> and <page>Panel:SetY</page>.

<note>If you wish to position and re-size panels without much guesswork and have them look good on different screen resolutions, you may find <page>Panel:Dock</page> useful</note>

arguments.name: posX
arguments.description: The x coordinate of the position.

arguments.name: posY
arguments.description: The y coordinate of the position.

functions.name: SetRenderInScreenshots
functions.description: Sets whenever the panel should be rendered in the next screenshot.

arguments.name: renderInScreenshot
arguments.description: Whether to render in the screenshot or not.

functions.name: SetSelectable
functions.description: Sets whether the panel object can be selected or not (like icons in the Spawn Menu, holding <key>Shift</key>). If enabled, this will affect the function of a <page>DButton</page> whilst <key>Shift</key> is pressed. <page>Panel:SetSelected</page> can be used to select/deselect the object.

arguments.name: selectable
arguments.description: Whether the panel object should be selectable or not.

functions.name: SetSelected
functions.description: Sets the selected state of a selectable panel object. This functionality is set with <page>Panel:SetSelectable</page> and checked with <page>Panel:IsSelectable</page>.

arguments.name: selected
arguments.description: Whether the object should be selected or deselected. <page>Panel:IsSelected</page> can be used to determine the selected state of the object.

functions.name: SetSelectionCanvas
functions.description: Enables the panel object for selection (much like the spawn menu).

arguments.name: set
arguments.description: Whether to enable selection.

functions.name: SetSize
functions.description:
Sets the size of the panel.

Calls <page>PANEL:OnSizeChanged</page> and marks this panel for layout (<page>Panel:InvalidateLayout</page>).


See also <page>Panel:SetWidth</page> and <page>Panel:SetHeight</page>.

<note>If you wish to position and re-size panels without much guesswork and have them look good on different screen resolutions, you may find <page>Panel:Dock</page> useful</note>

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The width of the panel.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: The height of the panel.

functions.name: SetSkin
functions.description: Sets the derma skin that the panel object will use, and refreshes all panels with <page>derma.RefreshSkins</page>.

arguments.name: skinName
arguments.description: The name of the skin to use. The default derma skin is `Default`.

functions.name: SetSpawnIcon
functions.description:
Sets the `.png` image to be displayed on a  <page>SpawnIcon</page> or the panel it is based on - <page>ModelImage</page>.

Only `.png` images can be used with this function.

arguments.name: icon
arguments.description: A path to the .png material, for example one of the <page>Silkicons</page> shipped with the game.

functions.name: SetSteamID
functions.description: Used by <page>AvatarImage</page> panels to load an avatar by its 64-bit Steam ID (community ID).

arguments.name: steamid
arguments.description: The 64bit SteamID of the player to load avatar of

arguments.name: size
arguments.description: The size of the avatar to use. Acceptable sizes are 32, 64, 184.

functions.name: SetTabPosition
functions.description: When TAB is pressed, the next selectable panel in the number sequence is selected.

functions.name: SetTall
functions.description: Sets height of a panel. An alias of <page>Panel:SetHeight</page>.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: Desired height to set

functions.name: SetTerm
functions.description:
Removes the panel after given time in seconds.
<note>This function will not work if <page>PANEL:AnimationThink</page> is overridden, unless <page>Panel:AnimationThinkInternal</page> is called every frame.</note>

arguments.name: delay
arguments.description: Delay in seconds after which the panel should be removed.

functions.name: SetText
functions.description:
Sets the text value of a panel object containing text, such as a <page>Label</page>, <page>TextEntry</page> or  <page>RichText</page> and their derivatives, such as <page>DLabel</page>, <page>DTextEntry</page> or <page>DButton</page>.

<warning>When used on a <page>Label</page> or its derivatives ( <page>DLabel</page> and <page>DButton</page> ), it will automatically call <page>Panel:InvalidateLayout</page>, meaning that you should avoid running this function every frame on these panels to avoid unnecessary performance loss.</warning>

<warning><page>Label</page> & its derivatives has hard length limit, maximum 1023 ascii characters.</warning>

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: The text value to set.

functions.name: SetTextInset
functions.description: Sets the left and top text margins of a text-based panel object, such as a <page>DButton</page> or <page>DLabel</page>.

arguments.name: insetX
arguments.description: The left margin for the text, in pixels. This will only affect centered text if the margin is greater than its x-coordinate.

arguments.name: insetY
arguments.description: The top margin for the text, in pixels.

functions.name: SetTextSelectionColors
functions.description: Sets text selection colors of a <page>RichText</page> element.

arguments.name: textColor
arguments.description: The <page>Global.Color</page> to set for selected text.

arguments.name: backgroundColor
arguments.description: The <page>Global.Color</page> to set for selected text background.

functions.name: SetToFullHeight
functions.description:
Sets the height of a <page>RichText</page> element to accommodate the text inside.

<note>This function internally relies on <page>Panel:GetNumLines</page>, so it should be called at least a couple frames after modifying the text using <page>Panel:AppendText</page></note>

functions.name: SetTooltip
functions.description: Sets the tooltip to be displayed when a player hovers over the panel object with their cursor.

arguments.name: str
arguments.description: The text to be displayed in the tooltip. Set `nil` to disable it.

functions.name: SetTooltipDelay
functions.description:
Sets the tooltip delay. (time between hovering over the panel, and the tooltip showing up)

Can be retrieved with <page>Panel:GetTooltipDelay</page>.

arguments.name: tooltip
arguments.description: The tooltip delay to set.

functions.name: SetTooltipPanel
functions.description:
Sets the panel to be displayed as contents of a <page>DTooltip</page> when a player hovers over the panel object with their cursor. See <page>Panel:SetTooltipPanelOverride</page> if you are looking to override <page>DTooltip</page> itself.

<note><page>Panel:SetTooltip</page> will override this functionality.</note>

<warning>
Calling this from <page>PANEL:OnCursorEntered</page> is too late! The tooltip will not be displayed or be updated.

Given panel or the previously set one will **NOT** be automatically removed.
</warning>

arguments.name: tooltipPanel
arguments.description: The panel to use as the tooltip.

functions.name: SetTooltipPanelOverride
functions.description: Sets the panel class to be created instead of <page>DTooltip</page> when the player hovers over this panel and a tooltip needs creating.

arguments.name: override
arguments.description:
The panel class to override the default <page>DTooltip</page>. The new panel class must have the following methods:
* <page text="SetText">Panel:SetText</page> - If you are using <page>Panel:SetTooltip</page>.
* <page text="SetContents">DTooltip:SetContents</page> - If you are using <page>Panel:SetTooltipPanel</page>.
* <page text="OpenForPanel">DTooltip:OpenForPanel</page> - A "hook" type function that gets called shortly after creation (and after the above 2) to open and position the tooltip. You can see this logic in `lua/includes/util/tooltips.lua`.

functions.name: SetUnderlineFont
functions.description:
Sets the underlined font for use by clickable text in a <page>RichText</page>. See also <page>Panel:InsertClickableTextStart</page>

This function will only work on <page>RichText</page> panels.

arguments.name: fontName
arguments.description:
The name of the font.

See <page text="here">Default_Fonts</page> for a list of existing fonts.
Alternatively, use <page>surface.CreateFont</page> to create your own custom font.

functions.name: SetURL
functions.description: Sets the URL of a link-based panel such as <page>DLabelURL</page>.

arguments.name: url
arguments.description: The URL to set. It **must** begin with either `http://` or `https://`.

functions.name: SetVerticalScrollbarEnabled
functions.description:
Sets the visibility of the vertical scrollbar.

Works for <page>RichText</page> and <page>TextEntry</page>.

arguments.name: display
arguments.description: True to display the vertical text scroll bar, false to hide it.

functions.name: SetVisible
functions.description: Sets the "visibility" of the panel.

arguments.name: visible
arguments.description: The visibility of the panel.

functions.name: SetWide
functions.description: Sets width of a panel. An alias of <page>Panel:SetWidth</page>.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: Desired width to set

functions.name: SetWidth
functions.description:
Sets the width of the panel.

Calls <page>PANEL:OnSizeChanged</page> and marks this panel for layout (<page>Panel:InvalidateLayout</page>).


See also <page>Panel:SetSize</page>.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The new width of the panel.

functions.name: SetWorldClicker
functions.description: This makes it so that when you're hovering over this panel you can "click" on the world. Your weapon aim (and its viewmodel) will follow the cursor. This is primarily used for the Sandbox context menu.

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: Whether to enable or disable the feature for this panel.

functions.name: SetWrap
functions.description:
Sets whether text wrapping should be enabled or disabled on <page>Label</page> and <page>DLabel</page> panels.

Use <page>DLabel:SetAutoStretchVertical</page> to automatically correct vertical size; <page>Panel:SizeToContents</page> will not set the correct height.

arguments.name: wrap
arguments.description: `True` to enable text wrapping, `false` otherwise.

functions.name: SetX
functions.description:
Sets the X position of the panel.

Uses <page>Panel:SetPos</page> internally.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The X coordinate of the position.

functions.name: SetY
functions.description:
Sets the Y position of the panel.

Uses <page>Panel:SetPos</page> internally.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The Y coordinate of the position.

functions.name: SetZPos
functions.description:
Sets the panels z position which determines the rendering order.

Panels with lower z positions appear behind panels with higher z positions.

This also controls in which order panels docked with <page>Panel:Dock</page> appears.

arguments.name: zIndex
arguments.description:
The z position of the panel.
Can't be lower than -32768 or higher than 32767.

functions.name: Show
functions.description: Makes a panel visible.

functions.name: SizeTo
functions.description: Uses animation to resize the panel to the specified size.

arguments.name: sizeW
arguments.description: The target width of the panel. Use -1 to retain the current width.

arguments.name: sizeH
arguments.description: The target height of the panel. Use -1 to retain the current height.

arguments.name: time
arguments.description: The time to perform the animation within.

arguments.name: delay
arguments.description: The delay before the animation starts.

arguments.name: ease
arguments.description: Easing of the start and/or end speed of the animation. See <page>Panel:NewAnimation</page> for how this works.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description:
The function to be called once the animation finishes.
<callback>
<arg type="table" name="animData">The <page>Structures/AnimationData</page> that was used.</arg>
<arg type="Panel" name="targetPanel">The panel object that was animated.</arg>
</callback>

functions.name: SizeToChildren
functions.description:
Resizes the panel to fit the bounds of its children.

<note>Your panel must have its layout updated (<page>Panel:InvalidateLayout</page>) for this function to work properly.</note>
<note>The sizeW and sizeH parameters are false by default. Therefore, calling this function with no arguments will result in a no-op.</note>

arguments.name: sizeW
arguments.description: Resize with width of the panel.

arguments.name: sizeH
arguments.description: Resize the height of the panel.

functions.name: SizeToContents
functions.description:
Resizes the panel so that its width and height fit all of the content inside.

<note>Only works on <page>Label</page> derived panels such as <page>DLabel</page> by default, and on any panel that manually implemented the <page>Panel:SizeToContents</page> method, such as <page>DNumberWang</page> and <page>DImage</page>.</note>

<warning>You must call this function **AFTER** setting text/font, adjusting child panels or otherwise altering the panel.</warning>

functions.name: SizeToContentsX
functions.description:
Resizes the panel object's width to accommodate all child objects/contents.

Only works on <page>Label</page> derived panels such as <page>DLabel</page> by default, and on any panel that manually implemented <page>Panel:GetContentSize</page> method.

<note>You must call this function **AFTER** setting text/font or adjusting child panels.</note>

arguments.name: addVal
arguments.description: The number of extra pixels to add to the width. Can be a negative number, to reduce the width.

functions.name: SizeToContentsY
functions.description:
Resizes the panel object's height to accommodate all child objects/contents.

Only works on <page>Label</page> derived panels such as <page>DLabel</page> by default, and on any panel that manually implemented <page>Panel:GetContentSize</page> method.

<note>You must call this function **AFTER** setting text/font or adjusting child panels.</note>

arguments.name: addVal
arguments.description: The number of extra pixels to add to the height.

functions.name: SlideDown
functions.description: Slides the panel in from above.

arguments.name: Length
arguments.description: Time to complete the animation.

functions.name: SlideUp
functions.description: Slides the panel out to the top.

arguments.name: Length
arguments.description: Time to complete the animation.

functions.name: StartBoxSelection
functions.description: Begins a box selection, enables mouse capture for the panel object, and sets the start point of the selection box to the mouse cursor's position, relative to this object. For this to work, either the object or its parent must be enabled as a selection canvas. This is set using <page>Panel:SetSelectionCanvas</page>.

functions.name: Stop
functions.description: Stops all panel animations by clearing its animation list. This also clears all delayed animations.

functions.name: StopLoading
functions.description: Stops the loading of the <page>HTML</page> panel's current page.

functions.name: StretchBottomTo
functions.description: Resizes the panel object's height so that its bottom is aligned with the top of the passed panel. An offset greater than zero will reduce the panel's height to leave a gap between it and the passed panel.

arguments.name: tgtPanel
arguments.description: The panel to align the bottom of this one with.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: The gap to leave between this and the passed panel. Negative values will cause the panel's height to increase, forming an overlap.

functions.name: StretchRightTo
functions.description: Resizes the panel object's width so that its right edge is aligned with the left of the passed panel. An offset greater than zero will reduce the panel's width to leave a gap between it and the passed panel.

arguments.name: tgtPanel
arguments.description: The panel to align the right edge of this one with.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: The gap to leave between this and the passed panel. Negative values will cause the panel's width to increase, forming an overlap.

functions.name: StretchToParent
functions.description: Sets the dimensions of the panel to fill its parent. It will only stretch in directions that aren't nil.

arguments.name: offsetLeft
arguments.description: The left offset to the parent.

arguments.name: offsetTop
arguments.description: The top offset to the parent.

arguments.name: offsetRight
arguments.description: The right offset to the parent.

arguments.name: offsetBottom
arguments.description: The bottom offset to the parent.

functions.name: ToggleSelection
functions.description: Toggles the selected state of a selectable panel object. This functionality is set with <page>Panel:SetSelectable</page> and checked with <page>Panel:IsSelectable</page>. To check whether the object is selected or not, <page>Panel:IsSelected</page> is used.

functions.name: ToggleVisible
functions.description: Toggles the visibility of a panel and all its children.

functions.name: Undo
functions.description:
Restores the last saved state (caret position and the text inside) of a <page>TextEntry</page>. Should act identically to pressing CTRL+Z in a <page>TextEntry</page>.

See also <page>Panel:SaveUndoState</page>.

functions.name: UnselectAll
functions.description: Recursively deselects this panel object and all of its children. This will cascade to all child objects at every level below the parent.

functions.name: UpdateHTMLTexture
functions.description:
Forcibly updates the panels' HTML Material, similar to when Paint is called on it.
This is only useful if the panel is not normally visible, i.e the panel exists purely for its HTML Material. Only works on with panels that have a HTML Material. See Panel:GetHTMLMaterial for more details. A good place to call this is in the GM:PreRender hook

functions.name: Valid
functions.description: <deprecated>Use <page>Panel:IsValid</page> instead.</deprecated>Returns if a given panel is valid or not.

returnValues.description: Whether the panel is valid or not, true being it is, false being it isn't.

functions.name: PaintingDragging
functions.description: Set to true by the <page>dragndrop</page> system when the panel is being drawn for the drag'n'drop.

returnValues.description: Set to true if drawing for the transparent dragging render.

name: PathFollower
description: Path object for a NextBot NPC and bots created by <page>player.CreateNextbot</page>. Returned by <page>Global.Path</page>.

functions.name: Chase
functions.description: If you created your path with type `"Chase"` this functions should be used in place of <page>PathFollower:Update</page> to cause the bot to chase the specified entity.

arguments.name: bot
arguments.description: The bot to update along the path. This can also be a nextbot player (<page>player.CreateNextbot</page>)

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity we want to chase

arguments.name: generator
arguments.description:
A function that allows you to alter the path generation. See example on <page>PathFollower:Compute</page> for the default function.

<callback>
<arg name="area" type="CNavArea">The area to move to.</arg>
<arg name="fromArea" type="CNavArea">The area to move from.</arg>
<arg name="ladder" type="CNavLadder">The ladder to move to or from (Validation required), if any.</arg>
<arg name="elevator" type="Entity">Will probably be always NULL</arg>
<arg name="length" type="number">Precomputed length between `area` and `fromArea`.</arg>
<ret name="cost" type="number">The cost of movement between `area` and `fromArea`.</ret>
</callback>

functions.name: Compute
functions.description: Compute shortest path from bot to 'goal' via A* algorithm.

arguments.name: bot
arguments.description: The nextbot we're generating for.  This can also be a nextbot player (<page>player.CreateNextbot</page>).

arguments.name: goal
arguments.description: The target location, the goal.

arguments.name: generator
arguments.description:
A function that allows you to alter the path generation. See example below for the default function.

<callback>
<arg name="area" type="CNavArea">The area to move to.</arg>
<arg name="fromArea" type="CNavArea">The area to move from.</arg>
<arg name="ladder" type="CNavLadder">The ladder to move to or from (Validation required), if any.</arg>
<arg name="elevator" type="Entity">Will probably be always NULL</arg>
<arg name="length" type="number">Precomputed length between `area` and `fromArea`.</arg>
<ret name="cost" type="number">The cost of movement between `area` and `fromArea`.</ret>
</callback>

returnValues.description:
* If returns true, path was found to the goal position.
* If returns false, path may either be invalid (use IsValid() to check), or valid but doesn't reach all the way to the goal.

functions.name: Draw
functions.description: Draws the path. This is meant for debugging - and uses <page>debugoverlay</page>.

functions.name: FirstSegment
functions.description: Returns the first segment of the path.

returnValues.description: A table with <page>Structures/PathSegment</page>.

functions.name: GetAge
functions.description: Returns the age since the path was built

returnValues.description: Path age

functions.name: GetAllSegments
functions.description: Returns all of the segments of the given path.

returnValues.description: A table of tables with <page>Structures/PathSegment</page>.

functions.name: GetClosestPosition
functions.description: The closest position along the path to a position

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: The point we're querying for

returnValues.description: The closest position on the path

functions.name: GetCurrentGoal
functions.description: Returns the current goal data. Can return nil if the current goal is invalid, for example immediately after <page>PathFollower:Update</page>.

returnValues.description: A table with <page>Structures/PathSegment</page>.

functions.name: GetCursorData
functions.description: Returns the cursor data

returnValues.description:
A table with 3 keys:
<page>number</page> curvature


<page>Vector</page> forward


<page>Vector</page> pos

functions.name: GetCursorPosition
functions.description: Returns the current progress along the path

returnValues.description: The current progress

functions.name: GetEnd
functions.description: Returns the path end position

returnValues.description: The end position

functions.name: GetGoalTolerance
functions.description: Returns how close we can get to the goal to call it done.

returnValues.description: The distance we're setting it to

functions.name: GetLength
functions.description: Returns the total length of the path

returnValues.description: The length of the path

functions.name: GetMinLookAheadDistance
functions.description: Returns the minimum range movement goal must be along path.

returnValues.description: The minimum look ahead distance

functions.name: GetPositionOnPath
functions.description: Returns the vector position of distance along path

arguments.name: distance
arguments.description: The distance along the path to query

returnValues.description: The position

functions.name: GetStart
functions.description: Returns the path start position

returnValues.description: The start position

functions.name: Invalidate
functions.description: Invalidates the current path

functions.name: IsValid
functions.description: Returns true if the path is valid

returnValues.description: Wether the path is valid or not.

functions.name: LastSegment
functions.description: Returns the last segment of the path.

returnValues.description: A table with <page>Structures/PathSegment</page>.

functions.name: MoveCursor
functions.description:
Moves the cursor by give distance.

For a function that sets the distance, see <page>PathFollower:MoveCursorTo</page>.

arguments.name: distance
arguments.description: The distance to move the cursor (in relative world units)

functions.name: MoveCursorTo
functions.description:
Sets the cursor position to given distance.

For relative distance, see <page>PathFollower:MoveCursor</page>.

arguments.name: distance
arguments.description: The distance to move the cursor (in world units)

functions.name: MoveCursorToClosestPosition
functions.description: Moves the cursor of the path to the closest position compared to given vector.

arguments.name: type
arguments.description:
Seek type


0 = SEEK_ENTIRE_PATH - Search the entire path length


1 = SEEK_AHEAD - Search from current cursor position forward toward end of path


2 = SEEK_BEHIND - Search from current cursor position backward toward path start

functions.name: MoveCursorToEnd
functions.description: Moves the cursor to the end of the path

functions.name: MoveCursorToStart
functions.description: Moves the cursor to the end of the path

functions.name: NextSegment
functions.description: Returns the next segment of the path.

returnValues.description: A table with <page>Structures/PathSegment</page>.

functions.name: PriorSegment
functions.description: Returns the previous segment of the path.

returnValues.description: A table with <page>Structures/PathSegment</page>.

functions.name: ResetAge
functions.description: Resets the age which is retrieved by <page>PathFollower:GetAge</page> to 0.

functions.name: SetGoalTolerance
functions.description: How close we can get to the goal to call it done

arguments.name: distance
arguments.description: The distance we're setting it to

functions.name: SetMinLookAheadDistance
functions.description: Sets minimum range movement goal must be along path

arguments.name: mindist
arguments.description: The minimum look ahead distance

functions.name: Update
functions.description: Move the bot along the path.

arguments.name: bot
arguments.description: The bot to update along the path. This can also be a nextbot player (<page>player.CreateNextbot</page>)

name: PhysCollide
description:
A PhysCollide holds collision data from VPhysics. These objects can be used to run (currently quite limited) collision tests, but do not represent actual physics objects.

Created by <page>Global.CreatePhysCollideBox</page> or <page>Global.CreatePhysCollidesFromModel</page>.

functions.name: Destroy
functions.description: Destroys the <page>PhysCollide</page> object.

functions.name: IsValid
functions.description:
Checks whether this <page>PhysCollide</page> object is valid or not.

You should just use <page>Global.IsValid</page> instead.

returnValues.description: Is valid or not.

functions.name: TraceBox
functions.description: Performs a trace against this PhysCollide with the given parameters. This can be used for both line traces and box traces.

arguments.name: origin
arguments.description: The origin for the PhysCollide during the trace

arguments.name: angles
arguments.description: The angles for the PhysCollide during the trace

arguments.name: rayStart
arguments.description: The start position of the trace

arguments.name: rayEnd
arguments.description: The end position of the trace

arguments.name: rayMins
arguments.description: The mins of the trace's bounds

arguments.name: rayMaxs
arguments.description: The maxs of the trace's bounds

returnValues.description: Hit position of the trace. This is false if the trace did not hit.
Hit normal of the trace
Fraction of the trace. This is calculated from the distance between startPos, hitPos, and endPos.

name: PhysObj
description:
This is the object returned by <page>Entity:GetPhysicsObject</page>, <page>Entity:GetPhysicsObjectNum</page> and <page>Vehicle:GetWheel</page>.

It represents a physics object.

functions.name: AddAngleVelocity
functions.description: Adds the specified [angular velocity](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Angular_velocity) velocity to the current <page>PhysObj</page>.

arguments.name: angularVelocity
arguments.description:
The additional velocity in `degrees/s`. (Local to the physics object.)
<note>Does nothing on frozen objects.</note>

functions.name: AddGameFlag
functions.description: Adds one or more bit flags.

arguments.name: flags
arguments.description: Bitflag, see <page>Enums/FVPHYSICS</page>.

functions.name: AddVelocity
functions.description: Adds the specified velocity to the current.

arguments.name: velocity
arguments.description:
Additional velocity in `source_unit/s`. (World frame)
<note>Does nothing on frozen objects.</note>

functions.name: AlignAngles
functions.description: Rotates the object so that it's angles are aligned to the ones inputted.

functions.name: ApplyForceCenter
functions.description:
Applies the specified impulse in the mass center of the physics object.

<note>This will not work on players, use <page>Entity:SetVelocity</page> instead.</note>

arguments.name: impulse
arguments.description: The [impulse](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Impulse_(physics)) to be applied in `kg*source_unit/s`. (The vector is in world frame)

functions.name: ApplyForceOffset
functions.description: Applies the specified impulse on the physics object at the specified position.

arguments.name: impulse
arguments.description: The impulse to be applied in `kg*source_unit/s`. (World frame)

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: The position in world coordinates (`source units`) where the force is applied to the physics object.

functions.name: ApplyTorqueCenter
functions.description: Applies the specified angular impulse to the physics object. See <page>PhysObj:CalculateForceOffset</page>

arguments.name: angularImpulse
arguments.description:
The angular impulse to be applied in `kg * m^2 * degrees / s`. (The vector is in world frame)
<note>
The unit conversion between meters and source units in this case is `1 meter ≈ 39.37 source units (100/2.54 exactly)`
</note>

functions.name: CalculateForceOffset
functions.description:
Calculates the linear and angular impulse on the object's center of mass for an offset impulse.
The outputs can be used with PhysObj:ApplyForceCenter and PhysObj:ApplyTorqueCenter, respectively. **Be careful to convert the angular impulse to world frame (PhysObj:LocalToWorldVector) if you are going to use it with ApplyTorqueCenter.**

arguments.name: impulse
arguments.description: The impulse acting on the object in `kg*source_unit/s`. (World frame)

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: The location of the impulse in world coordinates (`source units`)

returnValues.name: linearImpulse
returnValues.description: The calculated linear impulse on the physics object's center of mass in `kg*source_unit/s`. (World frame)

returnValues.name: angularImpulse
returnValues.description: The calculated angular impulse on the physics object's center of mass in `kg*m^2*degrees/s`. (Local frame)

functions.name: CalculateVelocityOffset
functions.description:
Calculates the linear and angular velocities on the center of mass for an offset impulse. The outputs can be directly passed to <page>PhysObj:AddVelocity</page> and <page>PhysObj:AddAngleVelocity</page>, respectively.

<warning>This will return zero length vectors if the physics object's motion is disabled. See <page>PhysObj:IsMotionEnabled</page>.</warning>

arguments.name: impulse
arguments.description: The impulse acting on the object in `kg*source_unit/s`. (World frame)

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: The location of the impulse in world coordinates (`source units`)

returnValues.description: The calculated linear velocity from the impulse on the physics object's center of mass in `source_unit/s`. (World frame)
The calculated angular velocity from the impulse on the physics object's center of mass in `degrees/s`. (Local frame)

functions.name: ClearGameFlag
functions.description: Removes one of more specified flags.

arguments.name: flags
arguments.description: Bitflag, see <page>Enums/FVPHYSICS</page>.

functions.name: ComputeShadowControl
functions.description: Allows you to move a PhysObj to a point and angle in 3D space. Works with any PhysObj, not just physics shadows.

arguments.name: shadowparams
arguments.description: The parameters for the shadow. See <page>Structures/ShadowControlParams</page>.

functions.name: EnableCollisions
functions.description:
Sets whether the physics object should collide with anything or not, including world.

<warning>This function currently has major problems with player collisions, and as such should be avoided at all costs.



A better alternative to this function would be using <page>Entity:SetCollisionGroup</page>( COLLISION_GROUP_WORLD ).</warning>

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: True to enable, false to disable.

functions.name: EnableDrag
functions.description: Sets whenever the physics object should be affected by drag.

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: True to enable, false to disable.

functions.name: EnableGravity
functions.description: Sets whether the PhysObject should be affected by gravity

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: True to enable, false to disable.

functions.name: EnableMotion
functions.description:
Sets whether the physobject should be able to move or not.

This is the exact method the Physics Gun uses to freeze props. If a motion-disabled physics object is grabbed with the physics gun, the object will be able to move again. To disallow this, use <page>GM:PhysgunPickup</page>.

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: True to enable, false to disable.

functions.name: GetAABB
