functions.description: Returns the mins and max of the physics object Axis-Aligned Bounding Box.

returnValues.description: The minimum extents of the bounding box.
The maximum extents of the bounding box.

functions.name: GetAngles
functions.description: Returns the angles of the physics object in degrees.

returnValues.description: The angles of the physics object.

functions.name: GetAngleVelocity
functions.description: Gets the angular velocity of the object in degrees per second as a local vector. You can use dot product to read the magnitude from a specific axis.

returnValues.description: The angular velocity

functions.name: GetContents
functions.description: Returns the contents flag of the <page>PhysObj</page>.

returnValues.description: The <page>Enums/CONTENTS</page>.

functions.name: GetDamping
functions.description: Returns the linear and angular damping of the physics object.

returnValues.description: The linear damping
The angular damping

functions.name: GetEnergy
functions.description: Returns the sum of the linear and rotational kinetic energies of the physics object.

returnValues.description: The kinetic energy

functions.name: GetEntity
functions.description: Returns the parent entity of the physics object.

returnValues.description: The entity this physics object belongs to

functions.name: GetFrictionSnapshot
functions.description: Returns the friction snapshot of this physics object. This is useful for determining if an object touching ground for example.

returnValues.description:
A table of tables containing the following data:
* <page>PhysObj</page> Other - The other physics object we came in contact with
* <page>number</page> EnergyAbsorbed -
* <page>number</page> FrictionCoefficient -
* <page>number</page> NormalForce -
* <page>Vector</page> Normal - Direction of the friction event
* <page>Vector</page> ContactPoint - Contact point of the friction event
* <page>number</page> Material - Surface Property ID of our physics obj
* <page>number</page> MaterialOther - Surface Property ID of the physics obj we came in contact with

functions.name: GetIndex
functions.description:
Returns the index this physics object is on its <page>PhysObj:GetEntity</page>.

Useful for <page>Entity:TranslateBoneToPhysBone</page>.

returnValues.description: The physics object index on its parent entity.

functions.name: GetInertia
functions.description: Returns the principal moments of inertia `(Ixx, Iyy, Izz)` of the physics object, in the local frame, with respect to the center of mass.

returnValues.name: angularInertia
returnValues.description:
The moment of inertia in `kg * m^2`
<note>The unit conversion between meters and source units in this case is `1 meter ≈ 39.37 source units (100/2.54 exactly)`</note>
<note>This value changes proportionally to the physics object's mass (e.g. making the object twice as heavy will result in it having twice the angular inertia)</note>

functions.name: GetInvInertia
functions.description: Returns 1 divided by the angular inertia. See <page>PhysObj:GetInertia</page>

returnValues.name: invAngularInertia
returnValues.description:
The inverted angular inertia
<warning>Returns `[0, 0, 0]` on frozen physics objects.</warning>

functions.name: GetInvMass
functions.description: Returns 1 divided by the physics object's mass (in kilograms).

returnValues.description:
The inverted mass.
<warning>Returns 0 on frozen physics objects.</warning>

functions.name: GetMass
functions.description: Returns the mass of the physics object.

returnValues.description: The mass in kilograms.

functions.name: GetMassCenter
functions.description: Returns the center of mass of the physics object as a local vector.

returnValues.description: The center of mass of the physics object.

functions.name: GetMaterial
functions.description: Returns the physical material of the physics object.

returnValues.description: The physical material

functions.name: GetMesh
functions.description: Returns the physics mesh of the object which is used for physobj-on-physobj collision.

returnValues.description: Table of <page>Structures/MeshVertex</page>s where each three vertices represent a triangle. Returns nil if the physics object is a sphere.

functions.name: GetMeshConvexes
functions.description: Returns all convex physics meshes of the object. See <page>Entity:PhysicsInitMultiConvex</page> for more information.

returnValues.description: Table of <page>Structures/MeshVertex</page>s where each <page>Structures/MeshVertex</page> is an independent convex mesh and each three vertices represent a triangle. Returns nil if the physics object is a sphere.

functions.name: GetName
functions.description: Returns the name of the physics object.

returnValues.description: The name of the physics object.

functions.name: GetPos
functions.description: Returns the position of the physics object.

returnValues.description: The position in world coordinates. (`source units`)

functions.name: GetPositionMatrix
functions.description: Returns the position and angle of the physics object as a 3x4 matrix (<page>VMatrix</page> is 4x4 so the fourth row goes unused). The first three columns store the angle as a [rotation matrix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rotation_matrix), and the fourth column stores the position vector.

returnValues.description: The position and angle matrix.

functions.name: GetRotDamping
functions.description: Returns the rotation damping of the physics object.

returnValues.description: The rotation damping

functions.name: GetShadowAngles
functions.description: Returns the angles of the <page>PhysObj</page> shadow. See <page>PhysObj:UpdateShadow</page>.

returnValues.description: The angles of the <page>PhysObj</page> shadow.

functions.name: GetShadowPos
functions.description: Returns the position of the <page>PhysObj</page> shadow. See <page>PhysObj:UpdateShadow</page>.

returnValues.description: The position of the <page>PhysObj</page> shadow.

functions.name: GetSpeedDamping
functions.description: Returns the speed damping of the physics object.

returnValues.description: speedDamping

functions.name: GetStress
functions.description: Returns the internal and external stress of the entity.

returnValues.description: The external stress (`𝜎𝑒`). It's the value of a giving force to other entities (in kg).
The internal stress (`𝜎𝑖`). It's the value of a receiving force from other entities (in kg).

functions.name: GetSurfaceArea
functions.description: Returns the surface area of the physics object in source-units². Or nil if the PhysObj is a generated sphere or box.

returnValues.description: The surface area or nil if the PhysObj is a generated sphere or box.

functions.name: GetVelocity
functions.description: Returns the absolute directional velocity of the physobject.

returnValues.description: velocity

functions.name: GetVelocityAtPoint
functions.description: Returns the world velocity of a point in world coordinates about the object. This is useful for objects rotating around their own axis/origin.

arguments.name: point
arguments.description: A point to test in world space coordinates

returnValues.name: velocity
returnValues.description: Velocity at the given point

functions.name: GetVolume
functions.description: Returns the volume in source units³. Or nil if the PhysObj is a generated sphere or box.

returnValues.description: The volume or nil if the PhysObj is a generated sphere or box.

functions.name: HasGameFlag
functions.description: Returns whenever the specified flag(s) is/are set.

arguments.name: flags
arguments.description: Bitflag, see <page>Enums/FVPHYSICS</page>.

returnValues.description: If flag was set or not

functions.name: IsAsleep
functions.description:
Returns whether the physics object is "sleeping".

See <page>PhysObj:Sleep</page> for more information.

returnValues.description: Whether the physics object is sleeping.

functions.name: IsCollisionEnabled
functions.description: Returns whenever the entity is able to collide or not.

returnValues.description: isCollisionEnabled

functions.name: IsDragEnabled
functions.description: Returns whenever the entity is affected by drag.

returnValues.description: dragEnabled

functions.name: IsGravityEnabled
functions.description: Returns whenever the entity is affected by gravity.

returnValues.description: `true` if the gravity is enabled, `false` otherwise

functions.name: IsMotionEnabled
functions.description: Returns if the physics object can move itself (by velocity, acceleration)

returnValues.description: `true` if the motion is enabled, `false` otherwise.

functions.name: IsMoveable
functions.description: Returns whenever the entity is able to move.

returnValues.description: movable

functions.name: IsPenetrating
functions.description:
Returns whenever the physics object is penetrating another physics object.

This is internally implemented as `PhysObj:HasGameFlag( FVPHYSICS_PENETRATING )` and thus is only updated for non-static physics objects.

returnValues.description: Whether the physics object is penetrating another object.

functions.name: IsValid
functions.description: Returns if the physics object is valid/not NULL.

returnValues.description: Whether the physics object is valid or not.

functions.name: LocalToWorld
functions.description:
Mapping a vector in local frame of the physics object to world frame.

<note>this function does translation and rotation, with translation done first.</note>

arguments.name: LocalVec
arguments.description: A vector in the physics object's local frame

returnValues.description: The corresponding vector in world frame

functions.name: LocalToWorldVector
functions.description:
Rotate a vector from the local frame of the physics object to world frame.

<note>This function only rotates the vector, without any translation operation.</note>

arguments.name: LocalVec
arguments.description: A vector in the physics object's local frame

returnValues.description: The corresponding vector in world frame

functions.name: OutputDebugInfo
functions.description: Prints debug info about the state of the physics object to the console.

functions.name: RecheckCollisionFilter
functions.description: Call this when the collision filter conditions change due to this object's state (e.g. changing solid type or collision group)

functions.name: RotateAroundAxis
functions.description: A convinience function for <page>Angle:RotateAroundAxis</page>.

arguments.name: dir
arguments.description: Direction, around which we will rotate

arguments.name: ang
arguments.description: Amount of rotation, in degrees

returnValues.description: The resulting angle

functions.name: SetAngleDragCoefficient
functions.description: Sets the amount of [drag](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drag_(physics)) to apply to a physics object when attempting to rotate.

arguments.name: coefficient
arguments.description: [Drag coefficient](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drag_coefficient). The bigger this value is, the slower the angles will change.

functions.name: SetAngles
functions.description: Sets the angles of the physobject in degrees.

arguments.name: angles
arguments.description:
The new angles of the physobject.
<warning>The new angle will not be applied on the parent entity while the physics object is asleep (<page>PhysObj:Sleep</page>)</warning>

functions.name: SetAngleVelocity
functions.description: Sets the specified [angular velocity](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Angular_velocity) on the <page>PhysObj</page>

arguments.name: angularVelocity
arguments.description: The new velocity in `degrees/s`. (Local frame)

functions.name: SetAngleVelocityInstantaneous
functions.description: Sets the specified instantaneous [angular velocity](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Angular_velocity) on the <page>PhysObj</page>

arguments.name: angularVelocity
arguments.description: The new velocity to set velocity.

functions.name: SetBuoyancyRatio
functions.description: Sets the buoyancy ratio of the physics object. (How well it floats in water)

arguments.name: buoyancy
arguments.description: Buoyancy ratio, where 0 is not buoyant at all (like a rock), and 1 is very buoyant (like wood). You can set values larger than 1 for greater effect.

functions.name: SetContents
functions.description: Sets the contents flag of the <page>PhysObj</page>.

arguments.name: contents
arguments.description: The <page>Enums/CONTENTS</page>.

functions.name: SetDamping
functions.description: Sets the linear and angular damping of the physics object.

arguments.name: linearDamping
arguments.description: Linear damping.

arguments.name: angularDamping
arguments.description: Angular damping.

functions.name: SetDragCoefficient
functions.description: Modifies how much drag (air resistance) affects the object.

arguments.name: drag
arguments.description:
The drag coefficient
It can be positive or negative.

functions.name: SetInertia
functions.description:
Sets the angular inertia. See <page>PhysObj:GetInertia</page>.

<note>This does not affect linear inertia.</note>

arguments.name: angularInertia
arguments.description: The angular inertia of the object.

functions.name: SetMass
functions.description:
Sets the mass of the physics object.

<warning>This resets <page>PhysObj:SetBuoyancyRatio</page> (Recalculated based materials' and the physics objects' densities, latter of which is dependent on mass). This is a physics engine limitation.</warning>

arguments.name: mass
arguments.description: The mass in kilograms, in range `[0, 50000]`

functions.name: SetMaterial
functions.description:
Sets the material of the physobject.

<note>Impact sounds will only change if this is called on client</note>

arguments.name: materialName
arguments.description: The name of the phys material to use. From this list: [Valve Developer](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Material_surface_properties)

functions.name: SetPos
functions.description: Sets the position of the physobject.

arguments.name: position
arguments.description:
The new position of the physobject in world coordinates. (`source units`).
<warning>The new position will not be applied on the parent entity while the physics object is asleep (<page>PhysObj:Sleep</page>)</warning>

arguments.name: teleport
arguments.description: If `true`, temporarily disables collisions of the physics objects just before moving it, then enables collisions back again.

functions.name: SetVelocity
functions.description: Sets the velocity of the physics object for the next iteration.

arguments.name: velocity
arguments.description: The new velocity of the physics object in `source_unit/s`. (World frame)

functions.name: SetVelocityInstantaneous
functions.description: Sets the velocity of the physics object.

arguments.name: velocity
arguments.description: The new velocity of the physics object.

functions.name: Sleep
functions.description:
Makes the physics object "sleep". The physics object will no longer be moving unless it is "woken up" by either a collision with another moving object, or by <page>PhysObj:Wake</page>.

This is an optimization feature of the physics engine. Normally physics objects will automatically "sleep" when not moving for a short while, to save resources, but it can be used for other purposes, for example to temporarily suspend an object mid air.

functions.name: UpdateShadow
functions.description:
Unlike PhysObj:SetPos and PhysObj:SetAngles, this allows the movement of a physobj while leaving physics interactions intact.
This is used internally by the motion controller of the Gravity Gun , the +use pickup and the Physics Gun, and entities such as the crane. This is the ideal function to move a physics shadow created with Entity:PhysicsInitShadow or Entity:MakePhysicsObjectAShadow.

arguments.name: targetPosition
arguments.description: The position we should move to.

arguments.name: targetAngles
arguments.description: The angle we should rotate towards.

arguments.name: frameTime
arguments.description:
The frame time to use for this movement, can be generally filled with <page>Global.FrameTime</page> or <page>ENTITY:PhysicsSimulate</page> with the deltaTime.

Can be set to 0 when you need to update the physics object just once.

functions.name: Wake
functions.description:
Wakes the physics object, so that it will continue to simulate physics/gravity.

See <page>PhysObj:Sleep</page> for more information.

functions.name: WorldToLocal
functions.description: Converts a vector to a relative to the physics object coordinate system.

arguments.name: vec
arguments.description: The vector in world space coordinates.

returnValues.description: The vector local to <page>PhysObj:GetPos</page>.

functions.name: WorldToLocalVector
functions.description:
Rotate a vector from the world frame to the local frame of the physics object.

<note>This function only rotates the vector, without any translation operation.</note>

arguments.name: WorldVec
arguments.description: A vector in the world frame

returnValues.description: The corresponding vector relative to the PhysObj

name: Player
description: This is a list of all methods only available for players. It is also possible to call <page>Entity</page> functions on the Player.

functions.name: AccountID
functions.description:
Returns the player's AccountID part of their full SteamID.

Since this does not include other vital parts of the SteamID such as "Account Type" and "Account Instance", it should be avoided, as AccountIDs are finite, and can theoretically be the same for multiple valid accounts.

See <page>Player:SteamID</page> for the text representation of the full SteamID.
See <page>Player:SteamID64</page> for a 64bit representation of the full SteamID.

<note>In a `-multirun` environment, this will return `-1` for all "copies" of a player because they are not authenticated with Steam.

For bots this will return values starting with `0` for the first bot, `1` for the second bot and so on.</note>

returnValues.description: The AccountID of Player's SteamID.

functions.name: AddCleanup
functions.description: <note>This function is only available in Sandbox and its derivatives.</note>Adds an entity to the player's clean up list. This uses <page>cleanup.Add</page> internally.

arguments.name: type
arguments.description: The Cleanup type for this Entity.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The Entity to add.

functions.name: AddCount
functions.description: <note>This function is only available in Sandbox and its derivatives.</note>Adds an entity to the player's list of entities of the same type. See <page>Player:GetCount</page> to get the current count of entities of an entity type added with this function.

arguments.name: str
arguments.description: The type of this Entity.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The Entity you want to add to the list.

functions.name: AddDeaths
functions.description: Adds the provided amount to the player's death count.

arguments.name: count
arguments.description: The amount to add to the death count.

functions.name: AddFrags
functions.description: Adds the provided amount to the player's frag/kill count.

arguments.name: count
arguments.description: The amount to add.

functions.name: AddFrozenPhysicsObject
functions.description: Adds an entity to the player's list of frozen objects.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The Entity to add.

arguments.name: physobj
arguments.description: The physics object of the Entity.

functions.name: AddPlayerOption
functions.description:
Sets up the voting system for the player.
This is a really barebone system. By calling this a vote gets started, when the player presses 0-9 the callback function gets called along with the key the player pressed. Use the draw callback to draw the vote panel.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of the vote

arguments.name: timeout
arguments.description: Time until the vote expires

arguments.name: vote_callback
arguments.description:
The function to be run when the player presses 0-9 while a vote is active.

<callback>
<arg name="voteNum" type="number">Which option the player pressed, 1-9 and 0 being the very last option.</arg>
<ret name="" type="boolean">Return true to remove this option from the vote.</ret>
</callback>

arguments.name: draw_callback
arguments.description: Used to draw the vote panel.

functions.name: AddVCDSequenceToGestureSlot
functions.description:
Plays a sequence directly from a sequence number, similar to <page>Player:AnimRestartGesture</page>. This function has the advantage to play sequences that haven't been bound to an existing <page>Enums/ACT</page>
<warning>This is not automatically networked. This function has to be called on the client to be seen by said client.</warning>

arguments.name: slot
arguments.description: Gesture slot using <page>Enums/GESTURE_SLOT</page>

arguments.name: sequenceId
arguments.description: The sequence ID to play, can be retrieved with <page>Entity:LookupSequence</page>.

arguments.name: cycle
arguments.description: The cycle to start the animation at, ranges from 0 to 1.

arguments.name: autokill
arguments.description: If the animation should not loop. true = stops the animation, false = the animation keeps playing.

functions.name: Alive
functions.description: Checks if the player is alive.

returnValues.description: Whether the player is alive

functions.name: AllowFlashlight
functions.description: Sets if the player can toggle their flashlight. Function exists on both the server and client but has no effect when ran on the client.

arguments.name: canFlashlight
arguments.description: True allows flashlight toggling

functions.name: AllowImmediateDecalPainting
functions.description: Lets the player spray their decal without delay

arguments.name: allow
arguments.description: Allow or disallow

functions.name: AnimResetGestureSlot
functions.description: Resets player gesture in selected slot.

arguments.name: slot
arguments.description: Slot to reset. See the <page>Enums/GESTURE_SLOT</page>.

functions.name: AnimRestartGesture
functions.description:
Restart a gesture on a player, within a gesture slot.

<warning>This is not automatically networked. This function has to be called on the client to be seen by said client.</warning>

arguments.name: slot
arguments.description: Gesture slot using <page>Enums/GESTURE_SLOT</page>

arguments.name: activity
arguments.description: The activity ( see <page>Enums/ACT</page> ) or sequence that should be played

arguments.name: autokill
arguments.description: Whether the animation should be automatically stopped. true = stops the animation, false = the animation keeps playing/looping

functions.name: AnimRestartMainSequence
functions.description: Restarts the main animation on the player, has the same effect as calling <page>Entity:SetCycle</page>( 0 ).

functions.name: AnimSetGestureSequence
functions.description: Sets the sequence of the animation playing in the given gesture slot.

arguments.name: slot
arguments.description: The gesture slot. See <page>Enums/GESTURE_SLOT</page>

arguments.name: sequenceID
arguments.description: Sequence ID to set.

functions.name: AnimSetGestureWeight
functions.description: Sets the weight of the animation playing in the given gesture slot.

arguments.name: slot
arguments.description: The gesture slot. See <page>Enums/GESTURE_SLOT</page>

arguments.name: weight
arguments.description: The weight this slot should be set to. Value must be ranging from 0 to 1.

functions.name: Armor
functions.description: Returns the player's armor.

returnValues.description: The player's armor.

functions.name: Ban
functions.description: Bans the player from the server for a certain amount of minutes.

arguments.name: minutes
arguments.description: Duration of the ban in minutes (0 is permanent)

arguments.name: kick
arguments.description: Whether to kick the player after banning them or not

functions.name: CanUseFlashlight
functions.description:
Returns true if the player's flashlight hasn't been disabled by <page>Player:AllowFlashlight</page>.

<note>This is not synchronized between clients and server automatically!</note>

returnValues.description: Whether the player can use flashlight.

functions.name: ChatPrint
functions.description:
Prints a string to the chatbox of the client.

<warning>Just like the <page>usermessage</page>, this function is affected by the 255 byte limit!</warning>

arguments.name: message
arguments.description: String to be printed

functions.name: CheckLimit
functions.description:
Checks if the limit of an entity type added by <page>Player:AddCount</page> is hit or not. If it's hit, it will call the <page>GM:PlayerCheckLimit</page> hook, and call <page>Player:LimitHit</page> if the hook doesn't return `false`.

This will always return `true` in singleplayer, as singleplayer does not have limits.

<note>This function is only available in Sandbox and its derivatives.</note>

arguments.name: str
arguments.description:
The entity type to check the limit for. Default types:
* "props"
* "ragdolls"
* "vehicles"
* "effects"
* "balloons"
* "cameras"
* "npcs"
* "sents"
* "dynamite"
* "lamps"
* "lights"
* "wheels"
* "thrusters"
* "hoverballs"
* "buttons"
* "emitters"

returnValues.description: Returns `true` if the limit of this type is not hit, `false` otherwise.

functions.name: ConCommand
functions.description:
Runs the concommand on the player. This does not work on bots. If used clientside, always runs the command on the local player.

If you wish to directly modify the movement input of bots, use <page>GM:StartCommand</page> instead.

<note>Some commands/convars are blocked from being ran/changed using this function, usually to prevent harm/annoyance to clients. For a list of blocked commands, see <page>Blocked ConCommands</page>.</note>

arguments.name: command
arguments.description: command to run

functions.name: CreateRagdoll
functions.description:
Creates the player's death ragdoll entity and deletes the old one.

This is normally used when a player dies, to create their death ragdoll.

The ragdoll will be created with the player's properties such as <page text="Position">Entity:GetPos</page>, <page text="Angles">Entity:GetAngles</page>, <page text="PlayerColor">Player:GetPlayerColor</page>, <page text="Velocity">Entity:GetVelocity</page> and <page text="Model">Entity:GetModel</page>.

You can retrieve the entity this creates with <page>Player:GetRagdollEntity</page>.

functions.name: CrosshairDisable
functions.description: Disables the default player's crosshair. Can be reenabled with <page>Player:CrosshairEnable</page>. This will affect <page>WEAPON:DoDrawCrosshair</page>.

functions.name: CrosshairEnable
functions.description: Enables the player's crosshair, if it was previously disabled via <page>Player:CrosshairDisable</page>.

functions.name: Crouching
functions.description: Returns whether the player is crouching or not (<page text="FL_DUCKING">Enums/FL</page> flag).

returnValues.description: Whether the player is crouching.

functions.name: Deaths
functions.description: Returns the player's death count

returnValues.description: The number of deaths the player has had.

functions.name: DebugInfo
functions.description: Prints the players' name and position to the console.

functions.name: DetonateTripmines
functions.description: Detonates all tripmines belonging to the player.

functions.name: DisableWorldClicking
functions.description: Disables world clicking for given player. See <page>Panel:SetWorldClicker</page> and <page>Player:IsWorldClickingDisabled</page>.

arguments.name: disable
arguments.description: Whether the world clicking should be disabled.

functions.name: DoAnimationEvent
functions.description:
Sends a third person animation event to the player.

Calls <page>GM:DoAnimationEvent</page> with <page text="PLAYERANIMEVENT_CUSTOM_GESTURE">Enums/PLAYERANIMEVENT</page> as the event, data as the given data.

arguments.name: data
arguments.description: The data to send.

functions.name: DoAttackEvent
functions.description:
Starts the player's attack animation. The attack animation is determined by the weapon's HoldType.

Similar to other animation event functions, calls <page>GM:DoAnimationEvent</page> with <page text="PLAYERANIMEVENT_ATTACK_PRIMARY">Enums/PLAYERANIMEVENT</page> as the event and no extra data.

functions.name: DoCustomAnimEvent
functions.description:
Sends a specified third person animation event to the player.

Calls <page>GM:DoAnimationEvent</page> with specified arguments.

arguments.name: event
arguments.description: The event to send. See <page>Enums/PLAYERANIMEVENT</page>.

arguments.name: data
arguments.description: The data to send alongside the event.

functions.name: DoReloadEvent
functions.description:
Sends a third person reload animation event to the player.

Similar to other animation event functions, calls <page>GM:DoAnimationEvent</page> with <page text="PLAYERANIMEVENT_RELOAD">Enums/PLAYERANIMEVENT</page> as the event and no extra data.

functions.name: DoSecondaryAttack
functions.description:
Sends a third person secondary fire animation event to the player.

Similar to other animation event functions, calls <page>GM:DoAnimationEvent</page> with <page text="PLAYERANIMEVENT_ATTACK_SECONDARY">Enums/PLAYERANIMEVENT</page> as the event and no extra data.

functions.name: DrawViewModel
functions.description: Show/Hide the player's weapon's viewmodel.

arguments.name: draw
arguments.description: Should draw

arguments.name: vm
arguments.description: Which view model to show/hide, 0-2.

functions.name: DrawWorldModel
functions.description: Show/Hide the player's weapon's worldmodel.

arguments.name: draw
arguments.description: Should draw

functions.name: DropNamedWeapon
functions.description: Drops the players' weapon of a specific class.

arguments.name: class
arguments.description: The class to drop.

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: If set, launches the weapon at given position. There is a limit to how far it is willing to throw the weapon. Overrides velocity argument.

arguments.name: velocity
arguments.description: If set and previous argument is unset, launches the weapon with given velocity. If the velocity is higher than 400, it will be clamped to 400.

functions.name: DropObject
functions.description:
Drops any object the player is currently holding with either Gravity Gun, Physics Gun or `+use` (E key)

See also <page>Entity:ForcePlayerDrop</page>.

functions.name: DropWeapon
functions.description: Forces the player to drop the specified weapon

arguments.name: weapon
arguments.description: Weapon to be dropped. If unset, will default to the currently equipped weapon.

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: If set, launches the weapon at given position. There is a limit to how far it is willing to throw the weapon. Overrides velocity argument.

arguments.name: velocity
arguments.description: If set and previous argument is unset, launches the weapon with given velocity. If the velocity is higher than 400, it will be clamped to 400.

functions.name: EnterVehicle
functions.description:
Force puts the player into a specified vehicle.
This **does not** bypass <page>GM:CanPlayerEnterVehicle</page>.

arguments.name: vehicle
arguments.description: Vehicle the player will enter

functions.name: EquipSuit
functions.description:
Equips the player with the HEV suit. Allows the player to zoom, walk slowly, sprint, pickup armor batteries, use the health and armor stations and also shows the HUD.
The player also emits a flatline sound on death, which can be overridden with GM:PlayerDeathSound. The player is automatically equipped with the suit on spawn, if you wish to stop that, use Player:RemoveSuit.

functions.name: ExitVehicle
functions.description:
Forces the player to exit the vehicle if they're in one.

This function will bypass <page>GM:CanExitVehicle</page>. See also <page>GM:PlayerLeaveVehicle</page>

functions.name: Flashlight
functions.description: Enables/Disables the player's flashlight.<page>Player:CanUseFlashlight</page> must be true in order for the player's flashlight to be changed.

arguments.name: isOn
arguments.description: Turns the flashlight on/off

functions.name: FlashlightIsOn
functions.description: Returns true if the player's flashlight is on.

returnValues.description: Whether the player's flashlight is on.

functions.name: Frags
functions.description:
Returns the amount of frags a player has.

<note>The value will change depending on the player's kill or suicide: +1 for a kill, -1 for a suicide. </note>

returnValues.description: frags

functions.name: Freeze
functions.description:
Freeze the player. Frozen players cannot move, look around, or attack. Key bindings are still called. Similar to <page>Player:Lock</page> but the player can still take damage.

Adds or removes the <page text="FL_FROZEN">Enums/FL</page> flag from the player.

<bug>Frozen bots will still be able to look around.</bug>

arguments.name: frozen
arguments.description: Whether the player should be frozen.

functions.name: GetActiveWeapon
functions.description:
Returns the player's active weapon.

If used on a <page>Global.LocalPlayer</page>() and the player is spectating another player with `OBS_MODE_IN_EYE`, the weapon returned will be of the spectated player.

returnValues.description: The weapon the player currently has equipped or NULL if the player doesn't have an active weapon eg. when they're dead.

functions.name: GetActivity
functions.description: Returns the player's current activity.

returnValues.name: act
returnValues.description: The player's current activity. See <page>Enums/ACT</page>.

functions.name: GetAimVector
functions.description: Returns the direction that the player is aiming.

returnValues.description: The direction vector of players aim

functions.name: GetAllowFullRotation
functions.description: Returns true if the players' model is allowed to rotate around the pitch and roll axis.

returnValues.description: Allowed

functions.name: GetAllowWeaponsInVehicle
functions.description: Returns whether the player is allowed to use their weapons in a vehicle or not.

returnValues.description: Whether the player is allowed to use their weapons in a vehicle or not.

functions.name: GetAmmo
functions.description: Returns a table of all ammo the player has.

returnValues.description:
A table with the following format
* <page>number</page> Key - AmmoID to be used with functions like <page>game.GetAmmoName</page>.
* <page>number</page> Value - Amount of ammo the player has of this kind.

functions.name: GetAmmoCount
functions.description: Gets the amount of ammo the player has.

arguments.name: ammotype
arguments.description: The ammunition type. Can be either <page>number</page> ammo ID or <page>string</page> ammo name.

returnValues.description: The amount of ammo player has in reserve.

functions.name: GetAvoidPlayers
functions.description: Gets if the player will be pushed out of nocollided players.

returnValues.description: pushed

functions.name: GetCanWalk
functions.description: Returns true if the player is able to walk using the (default) alt key.

returnValues.description: AbleToWalk

functions.name: GetCanZoom
functions.description: Determines whenever the player is allowed to use the zoom functionality.

returnValues.description: canZoom

functions.name: GetClassID
functions.description: Returns the player's class id.

returnValues.description: The player's class id.

functions.name: GetCount
functions.description:
<note>This function is only available in Sandbox and its derivatives.</note>Gets the total amount of entities of an entity type added by <page>Player:AddCount</page>.

Default types:
```
balloons
buttons
cameras
dynamite
effects
emitters
hoverballs
lamps
lights
npcs
props
ragdolls
sents
thrusters
vehicles
wheels
```

arguments.name: type
arguments.description: Type to get entity count of.

arguments.name: minus
arguments.description: If specified, it will reduce the counter by this value. Works only serverside.

returnValues.name: count
returnValues.description: The returned count.

functions.name: GetCrouchedWalkSpeed
functions.description:
Returns the crouched walk speed multiplier.

See also <page>Player:GetWalkSpeed</page> and <page>Player:SetCrouchedWalkSpeed</page>.

returnValues.description: The crouched walk speed multiplier.

functions.name: GetCurrentCommand
functions.description:
Returns the last command which was sent by the specified player. This can only be called on the player which <page>Global.GetPredictionPlayer</page>() returns.

<note>When called clientside in singleplayer during <page>WEAPON:Think</page>, it will return nothing as the hook is not technically predicted in that instance. See the note on the page.</note>

<bug issue="3302">This will fail in <page>GM:StartCommand</page>.</bug>

returnValues.description: Last user commands

functions.name: GetCurrentViewOffset
functions.description:
Gets the **actual** view offset which equals the difference between the players actual position and their view when standing.

Do not confuse with <page>Player:GetViewOffset</page> and <page>Player:GetViewOffsetDucked</page>

returnValues.description: The actual view offset.

functions.name: GetDrivingEntity
functions.description: Gets the entity the player is currently driving via the <page>drive</page> library.

returnValues.description: The currently driven entity, or NULL entity

functions.name: GetDrivingMode
functions.description: Returns driving mode of the player. See <page>Entity Driving</page>.

returnValues.description: The drive mode ID or 0 if player doesn't use the drive system.

functions.name: GetDuckSpeed
functions.description: Returns a player's duck speed (in seconds)

returnValues.description: duckspeed

functions.name: GetEntityInUse
functions.description: Returns the entity the player is currently using, like func_tank mounted turrets or +use prop pickups.

returnValues.description: Entity in use, or NULL entity otherwise. For +use prop pickups, this will be NULL clientside.

functions.name: GetEyeTrace
functions.description:
Returns a table with information of what the player is looking at.

The results of this function are **cached** clientside every frame.

Uses <page>util.GetPlayerTrace</page> internally and is therefore bound by its limits.

See also <page>Player:GetEyeTraceNoCursor</page>.

returnValues.description: Trace information, see <page>Structures/TraceResult</page>.

functions.name: GetEyeTraceNoCursor
functions.description:
Returns the trace according to the players view direction, ignoring their mouse (holding <key>C</key> and moving the mouse in Sandbox).

The results of this function are **cached** clientside every frame.

Uses <page>util.GetPlayerTrace</page> internally and is therefore bound by its limits.

See also <page>Player:GetEyeTrace</page>.

returnValues.description: Trace result. See <page>Structures/TraceResult</page>.

functions.name: GetFOV
functions.description: Returns the FOV of the player.

returnValues.description: Field of view as a float

functions.name: GetFriendStatus
functions.description: Returns the steam "relationship" towards the player.

returnValues.description: Should return one of four different things depending on their status on your friends list: "friend", "blocked", "none" or "requested".

functions.name: GetHands
functions.description: Gets the hands entity of a player

returnValues.description: The hands entity if players has one

functions.name: GetHoveredWidget
functions.description: Returns the widget the player is hovering with their mouse.

returnValues.description: The hovered widget.

functions.name: GetHull
functions.description:
Retrieves the minimum and maximum <page text="Vectors">Vector</page> of the [Axis-Aligned Bounding Box (AABB)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minimum_bounding_box) used for the <page text="Player's">Player</page> physics and movement <page text="Hull Traces">util.TraceHull</page>.

See also: <page>Player:SetHull</page>, <page>Player:SetHullDuck</page>, <page>Player:GetHullDuck</page>

returnValues.name: mins
returnValues.description: The hull mins, the lowest corner of the Player's bounding box.

returnValues.name: maxs
returnValues.description: The hull maxs, the highest corner of the Player's bounding box, opposite of the mins.

functions.name: GetHullDuck
functions.description:
Retrieves the minimum and maximum <page text="Vectors">Vector</page> of the [Axis-Aligned Bounding Box (AABB)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minimum_bounding_box) used for the <page text="Player's">Player</page> physics and movement <page text="Hull Traces">util.TraceHull</page> while they are crouching (or "Ducking").

See also: <page>Player:SetHullDuck</page>, <page>Player:GetHull</page>, <page>Player:SetHull</page>

returnValues.name: mins
returnValues.description: The hull mins, the lowest corner of the Player's bounding box while crouching.

returnValues.name: maxs
returnValues.description: The hull maxs, the highest corner of the Player's crouching bounding box, opposite of the mins.

functions.name: GetInfo
functions.description:
Retrieves the value of a client-side <page>ConVar</page>. The <page>ConVar</page> must have a <page text="FCVAR_USERINFO">Enums/FCVAR</page> flag for this to work.

<warning>The returned value is truncated to 31 bytes.</warning>
<warning>On client this function will return value of the local player, regardless of which player the function was called on!</warning>

arguments.name: cVarName
arguments.description: The name of the client-side <page>ConVar</page>.

returnValues.description: The value of the <page>ConVar</page>. Or an empty string if the convar doesn't exist.

functions.name: GetInfoNum
functions.description: Retrieves the numeric value of a client-side convar, returns nil if value is not convertible to a number. The <page>ConVar</page> must have a <page text="FCVAR_USERINFO">Enums/FCVAR</page> flag for this to work.

arguments.name: cVarName
arguments.description: The name of the <page>ConVar</page> to query the value of

arguments.name: default
arguments.description: Default value if we failed to retrieve the number.

returnValues.description: The value of the <page>ConVar</page> or the default value

functions.name: GetJumpPower
functions.description: Returns the jump power of the player

returnValues.description: Jump power

functions.name: GetLadderClimbSpeed
functions.description:
Returns the player's ladder climbing speed.

See <page>Player:GetWalkSpeed</page> for normal walking speed, <page>Player:GetRunSpeed</page> for sprinting speed and <page>Player:GetSlowWalkSpeed</page> for slow walking speed.

returnValues.name: speed
returnValues.description: The ladder climbing speed.

functions.name: GetLaggedMovementValue
functions.description: Returns the timescale multiplier of the player movement.

returnValues.description: The timescale multiplier, defaults to `1`.

functions.name: GetMaxArmor
functions.description: Returns the maximum amount of armor the player should have. Default value is 100.

returnValues.name: maxarmor
returnValues.description: The new max armor value

functions.name: GetMaxSpeed
functions.description:
Returns the player's maximum movement speed.

See also <page>Player:SetMaxSpeed</page>, <page>Player:GetWalkSpeed</page> and <page>Player:GetRunSpeed</page>.

returnValues.description: The maximum movement speed the player can go at.

functions.name: GetName
functions.description:
Returns the player's name, this is an alias of <page>Player:Nick</page>.

<note>This function overrides <page>Entity:GetName</page> (in the Lua metatable, not in c++), keep it in mind when dealing with <page>ents.FindByName</page> or any engine function which requires the mapping name.</note>

returnValues.description: The player's name.

functions.name: GetNoCollideWithTeammates
functions.description: Returns whenever the player is set not to collide with their teammates.

returnValues.description: noCollideWithTeammates

functions.name: GetObserverMode
functions.description: Returns the the observer mode of the player

returnValues.description: Observe mode of that player, see <page>Enums/OBS_MODE</page>.

functions.name: GetObserverTarget
functions.description:
Returns the entity the player is currently observing.

Set using <page>Player:SpectateEntity</page>.

returnValues.description: The entity the player is currently spectating, or <page text="NULL">Global_Variables</page> if the player has no target.

functions.name: GetPData
functions.description:
Returns a **P**ersistent **Data** key-value pair from the SQL database. (`sv.db` when called on server, `cl.db` when called on client)

Internally uses the <page>sql</page> library. See <page>util.GetPData</page> for cases when the player is not currently on the server.

<note>This function internally uses <page>Player:SteamID64</page>, it previously utilized <page>Player:UniqueID</page> which can cause collisions (two or more players sharing the same PData entry). <page>Player:SetPData</page> now replaces all instances of <page>Player:UniqueID</page> with <page>Player:SteamID64</page> when running <page>Player:SetPData</page></note>

<note>PData is not networked from servers to clients!</note>

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: Name of the PData key

arguments.name: default
arguments.description: Default value if PData key doesn't exist.

returnValues.description: The data in the SQL database or the default value given.

functions.name: GetPlayerColor
functions.description:
Returns a player model's color. The part of the model that is colored is determined by the model itself, and is different for each model.
<note>Overide this function clientside on a Entity(not a player) with playermodel and return color will apply color on it</note>

returnValues.description: The format is `Vector(r,g,b)`, and each color component should be between 0 and 1.

functions.name: GetPlayerInfo
functions.description: Returns a table containing player information.

returnValues.description: A table containing player information.

functions.name: GetPreferredCarryAngles
functions.description:
Returns the preferred carry angles of an object, if any are set.

Calls <page>GM:GetPreferredCarryAngles</page> with the target entity and returns the carry angles.

arguments.name: carryEnt
arguments.description: Entity to retrieve the carry angles of.

returnValues.description: Carry angles or nil if the entity has no preferred carry angles.

functions.name: GetPressedWidget
functions.description:
Returns the widget entity the player is using.

Having a pressed widget stops the player from firing their weapon to allow input to be passed onto the widget.

returnValues.description: The pressed widget.

functions.name: GetPreviousWeapon
functions.description: Returns the weapon the player previously had equipped.

returnValues.description:
The previous weapon of the player.

<warning>This is not guaranteed to be a weapon entity so it should be checked with <page>Entity:IsWeapon</page> for safety.</warning>

functions.name: GetPunchAngle
functions.description:
<deprecated>You should use <page>Player:GetViewPunchAngles</page> instead.</deprecated>
Returns players screen punch effect angle. See <page>Player:ViewPunch</page> and <page>Player:SetViewPunchAngles</page>

returnValues.description: The punch angle

functions.name: GetRagdollEntity
functions.description:
Returns players death ragdoll. The ragdoll is created by <page>Player:CreateRagdoll</page>.
<note>Calling <page>Entity:GetPos</page> server-side with this function then will return the position where <page>Player:CreateRagdoll</page> was used, as it is a hl2mp_ragdoll which is a serverside point entity that creates a clientside ragdoll for everyone (opposed to prop_ragdoll that is serverside and networks).</note>

returnValues.description:
The ragdoll.

Unlike normal clientside ragdolls (`C_ClientRagdoll`), this will be a `C_HL2MPRagdoll` on the client, and `hl2mp_ragdoll` on the server.

functions.name: GetRenderAngles
functions.description: Returns the render angles for the player.

returnValues.description: The render angles of the player. Only **yaw** part of the angle seems to be present.

functions.name: GetRunSpeed
functions.description:
Returns the player's sprint speed.

See also <page>Player:SetRunSpeed</page>, <page>Player:GetWalkSpeed</page> and <page>Player:GetMaxSpeed</page>.

returnValues.description: The sprint speed

functions.name: GetShootPos
functions.description:
Returns the position of a Player's view

<note>This is the same as calling <page>Entity:EyePos</page> on the player.</note>

returnValues.description: The position of the player's view.

functions.name: GetSlowWalkSpeed
functions.description:
Returns the player's slow walking speed, which is activated via <key>+WALK</key> keybind.

See <page>Player:GetWalkSpeed</page> for normal walking speed, <page>Player:GetRunSpeed</page> for sprinting speed and <page>Player:GetLadderClimbSpeed</page> for ladder climb speed.

returnValues.name: speed
returnValues.description: The new slow walking speed.

functions.name: GetStepSize
functions.description: Returns the maximum height player can step onto.

returnValues.description: The maximum height player can get up onto without jumping, in hammer units.

functions.name: GetSuitPower
functions.description:
Returns the player's HEV suit power.

<bug issue="3449">This will only work for the local player when used clientside.</bug>

returnValues.description: The current suit power.

functions.name: GetTimeoutSeconds
functions.description:
Returns the number of seconds that the player has been timing out for. You can check if a player is timing out with <page>Player:IsTimingOut</page>.

<note>This function is relatively useless because it is tied to the value of the `sv_timeout` ConVar, which is irrelevant to the description above. [This is not considered as a bug](https://discord.com/channels/565105920414318602/567617926991970306/748970396224585738).</note>

returnValues.description: Timeout seconds.

functions.name: GetTool
functions.description: Returns <page text="TOOL">Structures/TOOL</page> table of players current tool, or of the one specified.

arguments.name: mode
arguments.description: Classname of the tool to retrieve. ( Filename of the tool in gmod_tool/stools/ )

returnValues.description: TOOL table, or nil if the table wasn't found or the player doesn't have a tool gun.

functions.name: GetUnDuckSpeed
functions.description: Returns a player's unduck speed (in seconds)

returnValues.description: unduck speed

functions.name: GetUseEntity
functions.description:
Returns the entity the player would use if they would press their `+use` keybind.
<note issue="5027">Because entity physics objects usually do not exist on the client, the client's use entity will resolve to whatever the crosshair is placed on within a little less than 72 units of the player's eye position. This differs from the entity returned by the server, which has fully physical use checking. See <page>util.TraceHull</page>.

Issue tracker: [5027](https://github.com/Facepunch/garrysmod-issues/issues/5027)</note>

returnValues.name: ent
returnValues.description: The entity that would be used or NULL.

functions.name: GetUserGroup
functions.description: Returns the player's user group. By default, player user groups are loaded from `garrysmod/settings/users.txt`.

returnValues.description: The user group of the player. This will return "user" if player has no user group.

functions.name: GetVehicle
functions.description: Gets the vehicle the player is driving, returns NULL ENTITY if the player is not driving.

returnValues.description: vehicle

functions.name: GetViewEntity
functions.description:
Returns the entity the player is using to see from (such as the player itself, the camera, or another entity).
<note>This function will return a [NULL Entity] until <page>Player:SetViewEntity</page> has been used</note>

returnValues.description: The entity the player is using to see from

functions.name: GetViewModel
functions.description:
Returns the player's view model entity by the index.
Each player has 3 view models by default, but only the first one is used.

To use the other viewmodels in your SWEP, see <page>Entity:SetWeaponModel</page>.

<note>In the Client <page text="realm">States</page>, other players' viewmodels are not available unless they are being spectated.</note>

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: optional index of the view model to return, can range from 0 to 2

returnValues.description: The view model entity

functions.name: GetViewOffset
functions.description:
Returns the view offset of the player which equals the difference between the players actual position and their view.

See also <page>Player:GetViewOffsetDucked</page>.

returnValues.description: New view offset, must be local vector to players <page>Entity:GetPos</page>

functions.name: GetViewOffsetDucked
functions.description:
Returns the view offset of the player which equals the difference between the players actual position and their view when ducked.

See also <page>Player:GetViewOffset</page>.

returnValues.description: New crouching view offset, must be local vector to players <page>Entity:GetPos</page>

functions.name: GetViewPunchAngles
functions.description: Returns players screen punch effect angle.

returnValues.description: The punch angle

functions.name: GetViewPunchVelocity
functions.description: Returns client's view punch velocity. See <page>Player:ViewPunch</page> and <page>Player:SetViewPunchVelocity</page>

returnValues.name: punchVel
returnValues.description: The current view punch angle velocity.

functions.name: GetVoiceVolumeScale
functions.description: Returns the current voice volume scale for given player on client.

returnValues.description: The voice volume scale, where 0 is 0% and 1 is 100%.

functions.name: GetWalkSpeed
functions.description:
Returns the player's normal walking speed. Not sprinting, not slow walking. (+walk)

See also <page>Player:SetWalkSpeed</page>, <page>Player:GetMaxSpeed</page> and <page>Player:GetRunSpeed</page>.

returnValues.description: The normal walking speed.

functions.name: GetWeapon
functions.description: Returns the weapon for the specified class

arguments.name: className
arguments.description: Class name of weapon

returnValues.description: The weapon for the specified class, or NULL ENTITY if the player does not have this weapon.

functions.name: GetWeaponColor
functions.description: Returns a player's weapon color. The part of the model that is colored is determined by the model itself, and is different for each model. The format is `Vector(r,g,b)`, and each color should be between 0 and 1.

returnValues.description: color

functions.name: GetWeapons
functions.description:
Returns a table of the player's weapons.
<note>
This function returns a sequential table. Prefer to loop it with <page>Global.ipairs</page> instead of the <page>Global.pairs</page> function.
</note>

returnValues.description: All the weapons the player currently has.

functions.name: Give
functions.description:
Gives the player a weapon.

<note>While this function is meant for weapons/pickupables only, it is **not** restricted to weapons. Any entity can be spawned using this function, including NPCs and SENTs.</note>

arguments.name: weaponClassName
arguments.description: Class name of weapon to give the player

arguments.name: bNoAmmo
arguments.description: Set to true to not give any ammo on weapon spawn. (Reserve ammo set by DefaultClip)

returnValues.description: The weapon given to the player, if one was given. It will return NULL if the player already has the weapon, or the weapon entity (entity with given classname) doesn't exist.

functions.name: GiveAmmo
functions.description: Gives ammo to a player

arguments.name: amount
arguments.description: Amount of ammo

arguments.name: type
arguments.description:
Type of ammo.
This is a string for named ammo types, and a number for ammo ID.

You can find a list of default ammo types <page text="here">Default_Ammo_Types</page>.

arguments.name: hidePopup
arguments.description: Hide display popup when giving the ammo

returnValues.description: Ammo given.

functions.name: GodDisable
functions.description: Disables god mode on the player.

functions.name: GodEnable
functions.description: Enables god mode on the player.

functions.name: HasGodMode
functions.description: Returns whether the player has god mode or not, contolled by <page>Player:GodEnable</page> and <page>Player:GodDisable</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether the player has god mode or not.

functions.name: HasWeapon
functions.description: Returns if the player has the specified weapon

arguments.name: className
arguments.description: Class name of the weapon

returnValues.description: True if the player has the weapon

functions.name: InVehicle
functions.description: Returns if the player is in a vehicle

returnValues.description: Whether the player is in a vehicle.

functions.name: IPAddress
functions.description:
Returns the player's IP address and connection port in ip:port form
<note>Returns `Error!` for bots.</note>

returnValues.name: ip
returnValues.description: The player's IP address and connection port

functions.name: IsAdmin
functions.description:
Returns whether the player is an admin or not. It will also return `true` if the player is <page>Player:IsSuperAdmin</page> by default.

Internally this is determined by <page>Player:IsUserGroup</page>.

returnValues.description: True if the player is an admin or a super admin.

functions.name: IsBot
functions.description: Returns if the player is an bot or not

returnValues.description: True if the player is a bot.

functions.name: IsConnected
functions.description: Returns true from the point when the player is sending client info but not fully in the game until they disconnect.

returnValues.description: isConnected

functions.name: IsDrivingEntity
functions.description: Used to find out if a player is currently 'driving' an entity (by which we mean 'right click > drive' ).

returnValues.description: A value representing whether or not the player is 'driving' an entity.

functions.name: IsFrozen
functions.description: Returns whether the players movement is currently frozen, controlled by <page>Player:Freeze</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether the players movement is currently frozen or not.

functions.name: IsFullyAuthenticated
functions.description:
Returns whether the player identity was confirmed by the Steam network.

See also <page>GM:NetworkIDValidated</page>.

returnValues.description:
Whether the player has been fully authenticated or not.

This will always be true for singleplayer and the listen server host.
This will always be false for bots.

functions.name: IsListenServerHost
functions.description: Returns if a player is the host of the current session.

returnValues.description:
`true` if the player is the listen server host, `false` otherwise.

This will always be `true` in single player, and `false` on a dedicated server.

functions.name: IsMuted
functions.description: Returns whether or not the player is muted locally.

returnValues.description: whether or not the player is muted locally.

functions.name: IsPlayingTaunt
functions.description: Returns true if the player is playing a taunt.

returnValues.description: Whether the player is playing a taunt.

functions.name: IsSpeaking
functions.description: Returns whenever the player is heard by the local player clientside, or if the player is speaking serverside.

returnValues.description: Is the player speaking or not.

functions.name: IsSprinting
functions.description:
Returns whether the player is currently sprinting or not, specifically if they are holding their sprint key and are allowed to sprint.

This will not check if the player is currently sprinting into a wall. (i.e. holding their sprint key but not moving)

returnValues.description: Is the player sprinting or not

functions.name: IsSuitEquipped
functions.description:
Returns whenever the player is equipped with the suit item.

<bug issue="3449">This will only work for the local player when used clientside.</bug>

returnValues.description: Is the suit equipped or not.

functions.name: IsSuperAdmin
functions.description:
Returns whether the player is a super admin.

Internally this is determined by <page>Player:IsUserGroup</page>. See also <page>Player:IsAdmin</page>.

returnValues.description: True if the player is a super admin.

functions.name: IsTimingOut
functions.description:
Returns `true` if the player is timing out (i.e. is losing connection), `false` otherwise.

A player is considered timing out when more than 4 seconds has elapsed since a network packet was received from given player.

returnValues.description: Whether the player is timing out.

functions.name: IsTyping
functions.description:
Returns whether the player is typing in their chat.

This may not work properly if the server uses a custom chatbox.

returnValues.description: Whether the player is typing in their chat or not.

functions.name: IsUserGroup
functions.description: Returns true/false if the player is in specified group or not. See <page>Player:GetUserGroup</page> for a way to get player's usergroup.

arguments.name: groupname
arguments.description: Group to check the player for.

returnValues.description: isInUserGroup

functions.name: IsVoiceAudible
functions.description: Returns if the player can be heard by the local player.

returnValues.description: isAudible

functions.name: IsWalking
functions.description: Returns if the player currently walking. (`+walk` keybind)

returnValues.description: True if the player is currently walking.

functions.name: IsWorldClicking
functions.description: Returns whether the player is using the world clicking feature, see <page>Panel:SetWorldClicker</page>

returnValues.description: Is the player world clicking or not.

functions.name: IsWorldClickingDisabled
functions.description: Returns whether the world clicking is disabled for given player or not. See <page>Player:DisableWorldClicking</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether the world clicking is disabled or not.

functions.name: KeyDown
functions.description: Returns whether a key is down. This is not networked to other players, meaning only the local client can see the keys they are pressing.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: The key, see <page>Enums/IN</page>

returnValues.description: whether the key is down or not.

functions.name: KeyDownLast
functions.description: Gets whether a key was down one tick ago.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: The key, see <page>Enums/IN</page>

returnValues.description: Is key down ?

functions.name: KeyPressed
functions.description: Gets whether a key was just pressed this tick.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: Corresponds to an <page>Enums/IN</page>. You can use <page>bit.bor</page> here (see example 2)

returnValues.description: Was pressed or not

functions.name: KeyReleased
functions.description: Gets whether a key was just released this tick.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: The key, see <page>Enums/IN</page>

returnValues.description: Was released or not

functions.name: Kick
functions.description:
Kicks the player from the server.
<note>This can not be run before the player has fully joined in. Use <page>game.KickID</page> for that.</note>

arguments.name: reason
arguments.description:
Reason to show for disconnection.

<warning>This will be shortened to ~512 chars, though this includes the command itself and the player index so will realistically be more around ~498. It is recommended to avoid going near the limit to avoid truncation.</warning>

functions.name: Kill
functions.description: Kills a player and calls <page>GM:PlayerDeath</page>.

functions.name: KillSilent
functions.description:
Kills a player without notifying the rest of the server.

This will call <page>GM:PlayerSilentDeath</page> instead of <page>GM:PlayerDeath</page>.

functions.name: LagCompensation
functions.description:
This allows the server to mitigate the lag of the player by moving back all the entities that can be lag compensated to the time the player attacked with his weapon.

This technique is most commonly used on things that hit other entities instantaneously, such as traces.

<note><page>Entity:FireBullets</page> calls this function internally.</note>

Lag compensation only works for players and entities that have been enabled with <page>Entity:SetLagCompensated</page>

Despite being defined shared, it can only be used server-side in a <page text="Predicted Hook">~search?q=%3Cpredicted%3EYes</page>.

<warning>This function NEEDS to be disabled after you're done with it or it will break the movement of the entities affected!</warning>

<bug issue="3683">Lag compensation does not support pose parameters.</bug>

arguments.name: lagCompensation
arguments.description: The state of the lag compensation, true to enable and false to disable.

functions.name: LastHitGroup
functions.description: Returns the hitgroup where the player was last hit.

returnValues.description: Hitgroup, see <page>Enums/HITGROUP</page>

functions.name: LimitHit
functions.description:
Shows "limit hit" notification in sandbox.
<note>This function is only available in Sandbox and its derivatives.</note>

arguments.name: type
arguments.description: Type of hit limit.

functions.name: LocalEyeAngles
functions.description:
Returns the direction a player is looking as a entity/local-oriented angle.

Unlike <page>Entity:EyeAngles</page>, this function does not include angles of the Player's <page>Entity:GetParent</page>.

returnValues.description: local eye angles

functions.name: Lock
functions.description:
Stops a player from using any inputs, such as moving, turning, or attacking. Key binds are still called. Similar to <page>Player:Freeze</page> but the player takes no damage.

Adds the <page text="FL_FROZEN">Enums/FL</page> and <page text="FL_GODMODE">Enums/FL</page> flags to the player.

<bug>Frozen bots will still be able to look around.</bug>

functions.name: MotionSensorPos
functions.description: Returns the position of a Kinect bone.

arguments.name: bone
arguments.description: Bone to get the position of. Must be from 0 to 19.

returnValues.description: Position of the bone.

functions.name: Name
functions.description: Returns the players name. Identical to <page>Player:Nick</page> and <page>Player:GetName</page>.

returnValues.description: Player's Steam name.

functions.name: Nick
functions.description: Returns the player's nickname.

returnValues.description: Player's Steam name

functions.name: OwnerSteamID64
functions.description:
Returns the 64-bit SteamID aka CommunityID of the Steam Account that owns the Garry's Mod license this player is using. This is useful for detecting players using Steam Family Sharing.

If player is not using Steam Family Sharing, this will return the player's actual SteamID64().

<note>This data will only be available after the player has fully authenticated with Steam. See <page>Player:IsFullyAuthenticated</page>.</note>

returnValues.description: The 64bit SteamID

functions.name: PacketLoss
functions.description: Returns the percentage of packets lost by the client. It is not networked so it only returns 0 when run clientside.

returnValues.description: Percentage of packets lost (0-100)

functions.name: PhysgunUnfreeze
functions.description: Unfreezes the props player is looking at. This is essentially the same as pressing reload with the physics gun, including double press for unfreeze all.

returnValues.description: Number of props unfrozen.

functions.name: PickupObject
functions.description:
This makes the player hold ( same as pressing <key>E</key> on a small prop ) the provided entity.

<note>Don't get this confused with picking up items like ammo or health kits</note>

<note>This picks up the passed entity regardless of its mass or distance from the player</note>

arguments.name: entity
arguments.description: Entity to pick up.

functions.name: PickupWeapon
functions.description:
Forces the player to pickup an existing weapon entity. The player will not pick up the weapon if they already own a weapon of given type, or if the player could not normally have this weapon in their inventory.

This function **will** bypass <page>GM:PlayerCanPickupWeapon</page>.

arguments.name: wep
arguments.description: The weapon to try to pick up.

arguments.name: ammoOnly
arguments.description: If set to true, the player will only attempt to pick up the ammo from the weapon. The weapon will not be picked up even if the player doesn't have a weapon of this type, and the weapon will be removed if the player picks up any ammo from it.

returnValues.name: result
returnValues.description: Whether the player succeeded in picking up the weapon or not.

functions.name: Ping
functions.description: Returns the player's ping to server.

returnValues.description: The player's ping.

functions.name: PlayStepSound
functions.description: Plays the correct step sound according to what the player is staying on.

arguments.name: volume
arguments.description: Volume for the sound, in range from 0 to 1

functions.name: PrintMessage
functions.description:
Displays a message either in their chat, console, or center of the screen. See also <page>Global.PrintMessage</page>.

<note>When called serverside, this uses the archaic user message system (the <page>umsg</page>) and hence is limited to ≈250 characters.

`HUD_PRINTCENTER` will not work when this is called clientside.</note>

arguments.name: type
arguments.description: Which type of message should be sent to the player (<page>Enums/HUD</page>).

arguments.name: message
arguments.description: Message to be sent to the player.

functions.name: RemoveAllAmmo
functions.description: Removes all ammo from a certain player

functions.name: RemoveAllItems
functions.description: Removes all weapons and ammo from the player.

functions.name: RemoveAmmo
functions.description: Removes the amount of the specified ammo from the player.

arguments.name: ammoCount
arguments.description: The amount of ammunition to remove.

arguments.name: ammoName
arguments.description: The name of the ammunition to remove from. This can also be a <page>number</page> ammoID.

functions.name: RemovePData
functions.description:
Removes a **P**ersistent **Data** key-value pair from the SQL database. (`sv.db` when called on server, `cl.db` when called on client)

Internally uses the <page>sql</page> library. See <page>util.RemovePData</page> for cases when the player is not currently on the server.

<note>This function internally uses <page>Player:SteamID64</page>, it previously utilized <page>Player:UniqueID</page> which can cause collisions (two or more players sharing the same PData entry). <page>Player:SetPData</page> now replaces all instances of <page>Player:UniqueID</page> with <page>Player:SteamID64</page> when running <page>Player:SetPData</page></note>
<note>PData is not networked from servers to clients!</note>

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: Key to remove

returnValues.description: true is succeeded, false otherwise

functions.name: RemoveSuit
functions.description: Strips the player's suit item.

functions.name: ResetHull
functions.description: Resets both normal and duck hulls to their default values.

functions.name: Say
functions.description:
Forces the player to say whatever the first argument is. Works on bots too.

<note>This function ignores the default chat message cooldown</note>

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: The text to force the player to say.

arguments.name: teamOnly
arguments.description: Whether to send this message to our own team only.

functions.name: ScreenFade
functions.description: Fades the screen

arguments.name: flags
arguments.description: Fade flags defined with <page>Enums/SCREENFADE</page>.

arguments.name: clr
arguments.description: The color of the screenfade

arguments.name: fadeTime
arguments.description:
Fade(in/out) effect transition time ( From no fade to full fade and vice versa ).

This is limited to 7 bits integer part and 9 bits fractional part.

arguments.name: fadeHold
arguments.description:
Fade effect hold time.

This is limited to 7 bits integer part and 9 bits fractional part.

functions.name: SelectWeapon
functions.description:
Sets the active weapon of the player by its class name.

<warning>This will switch the weapon out of prediction, causing delay on the client and <page>WEAPON:Deploy</page> and <page>WEAPON:Holster</page> to be called out of prediction. Try using <page>CUserCmd:SelectWeapon</page> or <page>input.SelectWeapon</page>, instead.</warning>

<note>This will trigger the weapon switch event and associated animations. To switch weapons silently, use <page>Player:SetActiveWeapon</page>.</note>

arguments.name: className
arguments.description:
The class name of the weapon to switch to.

If the player doesn't have the specified weapon, nothing will happen. You can use <page>Player:Give</page> to give the weapon first.

functions.name: SendHint
functions.description:
Sends a hint to a player.

<note>This function is only available in Sandbox and its derivatives. Since this adds `#Hint_` to the beginning of each message, you should only use it with default hint messages, or those cached with <page>language.Add</page>. For hints with custom text, look at <page>notification.AddLegacy</page>.</note>

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name/class/index of the hint. You can find a list of hint names for this function <page text="here">List_of_Hint_Classes</page>.

arguments.name: delay
arguments.description: Delay in seconds before showing the hint

functions.name: SendLua
functions.description:
Executes a simple Lua string on the player.
<note>If you need to use this function more than once consider using <page>net</page> library. Send net message and make the entire code you want to execute in <page>net.Receive</page> on client.</note>

<note>The string is limited to 254 bytes. Consider using the <page text="net library">Net_Library_Usage</page> for more advanced server-client interaction.</note>

arguments.name: script
arguments.description: The script to execute.

functions.name: SetActiveWeapon
functions.description:
Sets the player's active weapon. You should use <page>CUserCmd:SelectWeapon</page> or <page>Player:SelectWeapon</page>, instead in most cases.

This function will not trigger the weapon switch events or associated equip animations. It will bypass
<page>GM:PlayerSwitchWeapon</page> and the currently active weapon's <page>WEAPON:Holster</page> return value.

arguments.name: weapon
arguments.description: The weapon to equip.

functions.name: SetActivity
functions.description: Sets the player's activity.

arguments.name: act
arguments.description: The new activity to set. See <page>Enums/ACT</page>.

functions.name: SetAllowFullRotation
functions.description: Set if the players' model is allowed to rotate around the pitch and roll axis.

arguments.name: Allowed
arguments.description: Allowed to rotate

functions.name: SetAllowWeaponsInVehicle
functions.description:
Allows player to use their weapons in a vehicle. You need to call this before entering a vehicle.

<bug issue="1277">Shooting in a vehicle fires two bullets.</bug>

arguments.name: allow
arguments.description: Show we allow player to use their weapons in a vehicle or not.

functions.name: SetAmmo
functions.description: Sets the amount of the specified ammo for the player.

arguments.name: ammoCount
arguments.description: The amount of ammunition to set.

arguments.name: ammoType
arguments.description: The ammunition type. Can be either number ammo ID or string ammo name. See <page>Default Ammo Types</page> for default values.

functions.name: SetArmor
functions.description: Sets the player armor to the argument.

arguments.name: Amount
arguments.description: The amount that the player armor is going to be set to.

functions.name: SetAvoidPlayers
functions.description:
Pushes the player away from other players whenever the player inside another players' bounding box.

This avoidance is performed clientside by altering movement sent to server.

This applies to players within a single team. (<page>Player:Team</page>)

arguments.name: avoidPlayers
arguments.description: Whether to avoid teammates, or not.

functions.name: SetCanWalk
functions.description: Set if the player should be allowed to walk using the (default) alt key.

arguments.name: abletowalk
arguments.description: True allows the player to walk.

functions.name: SetCanZoom
functions.description: Sets whether the player can use the HL2 suit zoom ("+zoom" bind) or not.

arguments.name: canZoom
arguments.description: Whether to make the player able or unable to zoom.

functions.name: SetClassID
functions.description: Sets the player's class id.

arguments.name: classID
arguments.description: The class id the player is being set with.

functions.name: SetCrouchedWalkSpeed
functions.description:
Sets the crouched walk speed multiplier.

Doesn't work for values above 1.

See also <page>Player:SetWalkSpeed</page> and <page>Player:GetCrouchedWalkSpeed</page>.

arguments.name: speed
arguments.description: The walk speed multiplier that crouch speed should be.

functions.name: SetCurrentViewOffset
functions.description:
Sets the **actual** view offset which equals the difference between the players actual position and their view when standing.

Do not confuse with <page>Player:SetViewOffset</page> and <page>Player:SetViewOffsetDucked</page>

arguments.name: viewOffset
arguments.description: The new view offset.

functions.name: SetDeaths
functions.description: Sets a player's death count

arguments.name: deathcount
arguments.description: Number of deaths (positive or negative)

functions.name: SetDrivingEntity
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
Sets the driving entity and driving mode.

Use <page>drive.PlayerStartDriving</page> instead, see <page>Entity Driving</page>.

arguments.name: drivingEntity
arguments.description: The entity the player should drive.

arguments.name: drivingMode
arguments.description: The driving mode index.

functions.name: SetDSP
functions.description:
Activates a given DSP (Digital Signal Processor) effect on all sounds that the player hears.

To apply a DSP effect to individual sounds, see <page>CSoundPatch:SetDSP</page>

arguments.name: dspEffectId
arguments.description:
The index of the DSP sound filter to apply.

For a list of the available IDs and their meaning, see <page text="DSP Presets">DSP_Presets</page>.

arguments.name: fastReset
arguments.description:
If set to true the sound filter will be removed faster.
<note>
**This only works clientside**
If used serverside, a message will be displayed (`SetPlayerDSP: fastReset only valid from client`) in the server console.
</note>

functions.name: SetDuckSpeed
functions.description:
Sets how quickly a player ducks.

<bug issue="2722">This will not work for values >= 1.</bug>

arguments.name: duckSpeed
arguments.description: How quickly the player will duck.

functions.name: SetEyeAngles
functions.description: Sets the local angle of the player's view (may rotate body too if angular difference is large)

arguments.name: angle
arguments.description: Angle to set the view to

functions.name: SetFOV
functions.description:
Set a player's FOV (Field Of View) over a certain amount of time.
